description: I loved the dinner!! Pad Thai - chicken and shrimp, massaging curry, jasmine rice was all fabulous! The waitress was sweet, and attentive.
author: Patrick B.

description:
In terms of trying to be fancy, I would say this place misses the mark. The food is average and not something I would rave over. For the price, this place can be better. 

PROs: 
1. Big portion sizes
2. Lychee Tea 
3. Service was good

CONs:
1. Scallops were a miss
2. Prices are too high for the food quality
3. Food was not authentically thai

If it wasn't for a lack of thai food options in the area, I would have probably chose a different restaurant. The ambiance was lacking and not very inviting.
author: Eunice Y.

description:
Came here a couple of weeks ago (4/14 to be exact). Walked in, it was pretty empty so I thought we'd be able to get seated and fed right away. Well, I was more than wrong.

The young lady standing near the register didn't greet us. She saw us walk in, grabbed two menus and led the way to a table for us to be seated. She then walked away. So we're thinking, that was pretty rude, but OK.

It was a nice day outside so I asked her if we could sit in their outside section. She grabbed our menus, again without saying a word to us, and led us to the outside section and tossed our menus on the table and walked away. She seemed annoyed that we even asked her to do something (mind you, there were only 3 customers inside the restaurant, including us, 2 of which were already eating). 

10 minutes passed by... we didn't even get a glass of water. It's been 15-20 minutes now, and we've been more than ready to order our food. I looked at her, trying to get her attention. She looked straight at us, looked away, and continued chatting away with her coworker. At this point, we're hungry and fed up. We got up and left. She just watched us walk out without saying a word. Rude, much? 

0 stars for customer service!!!!!!
author: Rayne K.

description: Tried the Pad Thai because it looked like the most recommended dish on this yelp page - and we were not let down. It was delicious! Would highly recommend adding that to your order. The BF said the tofu in the dish was the best he's ever had.
author: Vanessa F.

description: Got the Eggplant with rice lunch special (with tofu) for only $12! Really good portion size and very delicious, I have no complaints. Solid taste, and the dishes came out in about after 10 minutes or ordering on a Sunday afternoon. The others' dishes looked great too, and everyone enjoyed their foods.
author: Li W.

description: I used to live two blocks away and used to come here a lot. Now whenever I come to this area Modern Thai will be the to-go spot for me. They have a nice space, really authentic Thai food and servers are always sweet. I highly recommend the Thai basil and spicy pumpkin. If you are a soup lover try out their tom yum. Would recommend this place for a date as well :)
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Been here twice. It's an interesting menu with plenty of signature dishes that go beyond standard green curry and pad Thai. 

The lunch specials are a real bargain. You can get three courses for about fifteen bucks. It's a huge amount of food. 

Nice decode feels relatively upscale. 

As for the food, I was very impressed on my first visit several years ago. Today's visit was less exceptional. The tofu coconut soup was good and had lots of veggies. The tofu spring rolls were okay -- but nothing to sing about. The crispy basil chicken noodles were very well prepared but a little sweet for my taste. I wanted to branch out from my usual pad kee mao and these noodles looked original. I wouldn't order them again. 

But I'd still come back. This is definitely better than average Thai food.
author: Tim P.

description: Green Curry is a C+. By far the blandest I've had (I've tried 7 places in San Francisco). Also note that on DoorDash you don't have the option to choose a meat. In the picture it shows chicken and I chose the default. When it showed up...a bowl of tofu! Very disappointed that I chose to explore this as an option. Trust me, there are MUCH better options around.
author: Brandon F.

description: The atmosphere and the food are pretty good. Ordered chicken satay skewers and pad Thai with crispy pork belly. The chicken is tender and I really like the sauce, however, the portion is a bit small in my opinion. I may come back to try their curry next tim
author: Pinky L.

description:
This is a great location near van ness but the slow service, higher prices, and the mediocre flavors make this 3 stars.

Came here on a Saturday for lunch ans we were only one of two tables, yet still the waitress wanted to talk on her cellphone instead of help the customers.

The green curry was watery and the Thai tea that was supposed to be free with check in was a pain to redeem.

The rice was cold and I really think it was sitting in the rice cooker for hours.

Skip this place. I really wanted to give it 2 stars but my friend said it was okay so I'll bump it to 3 stars.
author: Jack R.

description: The curry was terrible. Undercooked veggies and very slow service. Would not come back or recommend.
author: Tanner M.

description:
Meh.
Better Thai in the neighborhood (Tycoon, Lers Ros). You can even walk a bit further up Polk and go to Co Nam (Vietnamese). 

We went to Modern Thai because we were looking for another place that ended up being closed. The space is promising but the food wasn't very good and the service was pretty bad.

We ordered chicken wings, V rolls (basically egg rolls), soup, red curry and dessert (exotic bomba). The dessert was the only good thing we ate. Soup was flavorful at least but a smidge too sour. Curry was bland. Rice portion tiny.

Our server was super scattered and seemed confused.

Won't be back.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Thankfully you can't really mess up Thai food.  I was walking down Polk St and came across this restaurant that has such a cute set up.  I looked it and it was nearly empty, and I was hungry, so I decided to stop in.  Obviously we were seated right away.  The inside was so adorable! I had the Thai tea - very good! -and the Udon Pad Thai - also very good! But the best dish is what my husband got which was the Crispy Fried Chicken with fried rice.
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: I ordered food thru grub hub and it's 40 minutes late and the restaurant isn't answering their phone.  Totally sucks!!! I'm never ordering from this place again.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Visiting from the East Coast - we walked in and we're amazing how good the food was! Service was quick, food was fantastic - fresh and flavorful. Would com back here any day.
author: Raluca M.

description:
I've ordered for pick up from here a few times since I work near by. The food is good. Yesterday for the first time I decided to have lunch there with a colleague. The service was horrible. The server was completely rude and we felt rushed to order, the restaurant was pretty empty. And she seemed really annoyed or irritated that we wanted to hold on to the menu a little longer after ordering food to look at the drinks. She came back and asked if we were done, we said yes thank you and she took the menus. We ordered a shrimp tempura and she never brought it out, and tried to charge us for two margaritas when we only ordered one. 

I will not be going back.
author: Sandra R.

description: The food is blend. The order is wrong half the time. If you tell them they got it wrong, they will say it is impossible. I have been a regular, but I'm done ordering from them. Services is worse than food.
author: Maya K.

description: The place is nice, reasonably priced, with very good food. Try their Singaporean noodles
author: Ifred M.

description: This used to be one one of my all time favorite Thai places. Unfortunately they don't seem to have the same cook anymore. The Pad Sleng Hai doesn't use the awesome transparent half pipe mung bean noodles they used to use. The Catfish with Eggplant is no longer amazing. The last cook used some kitchen magic to keep the eggplant bright purple and the catfish crispy, now the eggplant is brown and grey and the catfish is soggy just like it looks when I try cooking this dish. The food is still ok, but nowhere close to its former glory.
author: David T.

description: I travel for a living .... while downtown San Fran ... I wanted some good Thai food! I must say this was the worse Thai I've eaten in a while...salty and the noodles were terrible... as if it's been setting in a pot all day! Wow! Never again!
author: Aprill W.

description:
I've been to Modern Thai a few times and really like their lunch specials. The place is always open and easy to bring a group or have a quiet lunch with coworkers. I usually order one of the lunch sets, that comes with appetizer and cup of soup, your meal and a drink. It's a pretty good deal. 

My favorite items are the chicken curry with rice and the beef salad. Service is good and the food is almost prompt which brings me back every time.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Ate here several times while visiting San Francisco. Very welcoming to all and great food. The red curry was delicious with shrimp as well as their fried wings. Server was very courteous and prompt. I will be sure to visit again if I am in the city
author: Jovan E.

description: Ordered a Pad Thai to go for a lunch meeting. It was the worst Pad Thai I ever ate in my life. The noodles were dry and so were the shrimps. It seemed like I was being given left overs from several days ago. I will never order from them again. There's just way too many better choices!
author: Phil G.

description: So fresh, really high quality food. Loved everything- favorite is the pumpkin curry (spicy) with chicken and rice- but literally everything is awesome.
author: Breana L.

description: I went here for lunch, and no complaints. I ordered the Pad See Ew w/tofu and it was cooked perfectly. Only thing that scared me was the 89 health rating. Maybe put that sign in the front, so I don't see it while eating and freak out.
author: Jim B.

description: Quick Service. Ordered the Thai Green and Red Curry. Both of them were delicious with right of amount of spice.
author: Vinay K.

description: Not my favourite place. Food is ok, nothing special but the customer service was pretty shocking
author: Claire C.

description:
1) Delivery estimate time was 60 minutes.  Took over 2 hours and took 2 calls to get them to deliver it
2) Food arrived cold
3) Ordered Tom Yum soup which is sour.  They delivered a soup with so much sugar in it that I couldn't eat it and tossed it.  Perhaps they thought I wanted dessert?
4) The $13 beef salad was a joke.  A tiny bit of lettuce and meat with no flavor.

I ordered through grubhub and everything was so bad that I asked for my pre-paid tip back.  Tipping before you get any service is convenient but I'll never do it again.  Tips should be based on service received.
author: reza n.

description:
Delivery went smooth. Everything I ordered was accounted for and hot.

Tom Yum Soup:  Was not spicy AT ALL! So bland I had to spice it up myself and it did not cure my craving. It looked nothing like the picture.  There was no cilantro (not that big of a deal) and the broth was yellow like straight chicken stock instead of red.  Also, the tomato was not ripe, crunchy, and a bit yellow too.

Pad See Ew Chicken:  The flavor was good, however, all the noodles were super broken up like they stirred them too much.  Also, not a lot of chicken. I'll have to add some meat when I finish it.
author: Devynne H.

description:
Why is everyone hating on poor Modern Thai? My roommate and I have been consistently coming to Modern Thai for the past four years and it's been great!

The servers are all so nice and accommodating. Getting to-go and even eating in the restaurant, we've never felt that the service was slow or lacking. The portions are large and the prices are definitely cheaper/reasonable for San Francisco. I've never had issues using my Yelp check-in for the Thai iced tea so it's a little surprising to read that. The only reason I'd dock a star is that sometimes I think the space could be cleaner but I haven't had any issues, personally.

It's not the most authentic, for sure, but if you want something fast and cheap that will satisfy your Thai food craving, Modern Thai is sure to be your jam.
author: Salma R.

description:
First time customer by way of Door Dash.

I ordered Thai Basil with tofu. It wasn't terrible but the flavor was lacking and the vegetables could have been cooked better. 

Kick up the flavored, please!
author: Lolly F.

description: Modern Thai is one of my favorites! The food is always very fresh and filled with extra vegetables and great flavors. They have every item you want and more. Plus, great service.
author: Hope M.

description: Probably one of the best casual Thai places in the city for my money. Service is good (in a Thai way, where sometimes it's confused with a smile). Decor is welcoming, prices fair, curries and appetizers and noodles have all been decent quality. I especially like the lunch combos- many, many options where you start with an entree and can pay more to add more and more features like appetizer, Thai tea/coffee, etc. Servers are genuine Thai with a service orientation, which I prefer. I've never seen the place too crowded to get a seat. Worthy of repeat visits.
author: T J.

description:
This was my first time visiting this restaurant. I ordered the Manamuss chicken curry, which has always been my favorite dish whenever I go. 
With the the Yelp app you were able to get a tea for free. But beware because i feel they somehow charge you for it one way or another.
I usually have left overs, this time I didn't due to the small portion they give me.
She asked if I wanted rice with it. I said Yes , what I didn't know is that I was going to be charged for it.
Every restaurant that I've  been to, the rice comes with the meal. 
I'll just say that paying $18 was way to much money spent for the meal I received.
author: Patty H.

description:
I've been here 2 years ago with my BFF and I recalled the food being really good so I decided to take my parents here for lunch after our flight.

Boy, was I wrong. We each ordered a plate of food and 3/4 of them were superrrrr salty. We had to ask for extra rice for the ground chicken and basil rice plate because it was so intolerably salty.

Only thing that wasn't salty or over board was the pad thai and thai iced teas. 
We just wanted to get out of here asap because everything was so salty, we ended up leaving with doggy bags of over half our food.

Not sure if they changed the chef or they just spilled the salt container over the food that day but I will not be back to find out.
author: Kelly L.

description: Extremely rude staff and slow service. Not only did they give my order to someone else then give me the wrong thing.. I had to ASK for my change and she even shorted me so I had to ask again for ALL my change.. I understand working in the food industry is rough some times but don't be rude to me rite off the bat.. this is your job act like it.
author: Flower F.

description:
The Ambiance is beautiful and relaxed. The food is consistently delicious. They have great very reasonable lunch specials.
Just had the green curry that was creamy just the right spicing and delicious.
author: Wendy C.

description:
First impressions, nice looking tucked away spot.
Friendly staff.

Food quality was the opposite.

Ordered the boneless breaded fried chicken. It arrived with beading too crunchy due to improper cooking temp. But the worst part was the old oil as it tasted slightly off.

I did enjoy the ginger rice that it came with.

Price is high for Thai. $17 with an iced coffee.

Too many other restaurants in the neighborhood to go to instead. Most likely would not come back.
author: Evan W.

description: I really love this food, however, they are skimping more and more on the portions. When you order meats there is hardly ANY in the dishes. It is really frustrating. Argh
author: Amber M.

description: I'm giving it a 4 because the red chicken curry is just to sweet and the rice as well. It is probably because it is suppose to help with the spice but I give the coconut shrimp  5 stars they were perfect  and the Thai ice tea was amazing
author: Brooke W.

description:
Having wonton noodle soup with duck and shrimp today. 
The broth is soooooo good. Great soft skin wontons and delicious roasted duck. One of the best noodle in town!
author: Wirunna W.

description: This restaurant is bull. Don't order the vegetarian egg rolls. This restaurant purchases Ling Ling egg rolls and tries to pass them off as their own. I have literally purchased these rolls many times at Whole Foods and Real Foods! It's such a joke! I also ordered the coconut soup with shrimp. Full of onions and pre-made. This place is a joke.
author: Anne R.

description:
Not so Modern Thai. We ordered for delivery while staying at a hotel down the street. We had the Thai Fried Rice, Pad Se Ew and 3 other items. 

Our ordered arrived just in time. Unfortunately 2 items were missing. Not really a big deal. The driver apologized and told us they would come back with the other items. 

The only problem... they never came back. We've waited for over an hour. They never called us back. They just took the money and left. The few dollars isn't the issue. It's the lack of professionalism. 

As for the food... I've had better.
author: Dr. Groovy O.

description:
Food = good. 

Golden Bags = carrots, sweet potatoes, corn, taro seasoned with yellow curry powder wrapped in egg-roll skin and deep fried, served with cucumber salad. Flaky, hot and filling. $8.00.

Lunch special, Set A (entree plus appetizer) = pad kee mao (stir fried flat rice noodles, garlic, onion, bell peppers, tomatoes, chilies, green beans and basil) with pork, and fresh spring rolls (shrimp, lettuce, mint leaves, basil, cucumber, carrots and vermicelli wrapped in Vietnamese rice paper). Perfect noodles, well-cooked vegetables and great seasoning. $10.45 plus upcharge of $1.00 for shrimp. 

Lunch special, Set A = basil chicken with brown rice and fresh rolls = delicious, full of basil, and well-cooked peppers. Lunch date loved this meal. $10.95 plus upcharge of $0.50 for brown rice. 

Thai iced tea = $2.50. 

Prices = moderate. Lunch for two came out to $36.32, with leftovers for another meal for one.  

Service = okay. Only one server. 

Seating = mostly 2-tops and some pushed together for 4-tops. A bit of dim lighting in certain areas. 

Only complaint I had was that I couldn't redeem the free Thai iced tea (Yelp check-in) because I hadn't ordered "an entree". Lunch special didn't count and there was no fine print for that.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Ordered 3 entrees through GrubHub. It took ***2.5*** hours for them to deliver. We had to call in 3 times after the ETA given, and each time they LIED to us about how long it'd take. First, they said it'd take another 15 minutes. 30 minutes later they said it'd take 5 minutes. 30 minutes later they said they were there. They were at the WRONG address. My food finally showed up at 10:15PM. Waited 2.5 hours for 3 simple entrees from a restaurant 1 mile from me on a Wednesday night. 

And they've refused to refund me for the horrific wait time and poor customer service. The food is just as bad as the service.

I repeatedly posted on their Facebook account to get a refund and they finally offered me an email to send my complaint to so that they could resolve my problem. They NEVER responded to my email. Awful food and awful business. You should be ashamed of yourselves.
author: Ai N.

description: Great vegan options! I got the Pad Kee Mao (which does not have eggs) with tofu and they were easily able to accommodate my request to have the dish prepared without fish sauce. It was very flavorful and came in a nice large portion, very filling. Great service as well.
author: Carina B.

description:
It really was a meh, disappointing experience. The memories stay vivid. It was a miserable December evening. I was sick and really all I sought was a proper chicken noodle soup (save the pho and rare meats for when I was feeling better) and some good old fried protein sides for the guilty pleasures. The soup was disappointing, but maybe I can blame the meds too. It just seemed a little too "salty" even for my dehydrated state. 

I was excited. The order was supposed to take an hour, but I had to call to make sure it was still on its way. It took a bit longer, but fine maybe traversing across all of "downtown" SF runs into traffic sometimes.

I had the shrimp tempura (6 hearty pieces) and the crab rangoons or crab moon cheese as they call it. Yum right? Ok, definitely more cheese than crab, but that was probably expected.

Anyways, this all nearly comes out to $40 with delivery. Whoa! I will say it was packaged nicely and I was grateful in my miserable state to have had it delivered, but really I can't say much else. I got better eventually but my wallet sure got lighter and it was all just meh. Thanks for the chance of getting better a bit quicker, maybe next time I'll stop by. Or not.
author: Joseph L.

description: Meh. Mediocre sums it up. That's about all I can say for this place. Delivery was prompt, but the containers were broken. Veggies were meh, flavor was just okay, tofu was barely flavorful or cooked. Everything felt thrown together versus prepared. It was 20 min before closing, so maybe that's part of it, but I won't be going back.
author: Ryan S.

description: A friend recommended this place to me and I wasn't disappointed! Favorite Thai place I've tried so far in SF. The cashew nut chicken, egg fried rice, and pad see ew with chicken are our go-to dishes. All are delicious and affordable. Excellent location, and they put together to-go orders quickly. Ben Thai is just up the street, but Modern Thai has better prices and food. Highly recommend!
author: Roxie B.

description: Solid takeout Thai food. Everything is good. Quick and friendly service. Definitely deserves more stars.
author: KJ G.

description:
I love Thai Food  at Modern Thai
Very good service 
I love it here.Everything is tasty
Waitress are very nice and kind.
Awesome food.i like thos place.
I think this is the best Thai restaurant in SF.
author: Title N.

description: It's a less expensive for SF standards restaurant. With that in mind I can give it four stars. The food is OK, not the best Thai food I have ever tasted, but not the worst either. Yes, not very flavorful, not very fast, but again, if you want something out of this world - there are plenty of fine more expensive Thai restaurants in SF.
author: Andy D.

description:
Ordered pick up over their website, which was quite solid all around.

The food in isolation is quite great. I think a great kick with their curry goes a long way to making it a fairly solid go to resto. Without a doubt, worth repeat visits for those who enjoy Thai food done well, without the need for overdosing on the Sriracha.
author: Rafael C.

description: The Thai food here is really average. It's too bad because it's right near my apartment, but for the price I think they could do better. We ordered Pad Thai and Red Curry Tofu.
author: Lauren M.

description:
Check-in on yelp says I could get a free thai tea with a purchase of an entre... Came here during lunch and they said i couldn't use that offer and showed me another menu where I could purchase more expensive items for a free drink.

Ordered a pad see ew, tasted kind of sour... It was ok, I've had better, but I don't like how the noodles are chopped up into small pieces. It makes it basically not noodles..
author: Mei Z.

description:
This place has constantly gone down a downward spiral. The "Green Curry Fried Rice" hardly looks green like it did eons ago! A sincere request to make the dish "Thai Spicy" does not seem to be understood- food has come to the table bland at best.

Second, third and many more chances given - but this time "Never Again" will have to stick. Pity
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Good food, not sure what I got is reflected in the menu description.  Good service.  Cleaner area and a safer walk then a few blocks south.  Different take on Thai.
author: Lisa H.

description: EWW...This is the first time I'm seeing an ant in my food at Modern Thai...and I've been a consumer for years... Sadly, I may not come back after seeing this.
author: Kayley K.

description: Delivery guy blatantly made snide comments at my 13-y/o brother about the tip given. You would think a grown man would have more manners and some decency.
author: Brenda W.

description:
THIEVES! I have been ordering from them for a long time online through eat24.. They decided that this time they were going to put 4 prawns in my order instead of the usual 6-8 and still charge me an up charge of $2 .. Have the decency to put "YOU WILL ONLY RECEIVE 4 PRAWNS AFTER WE CHARGE YOU EXTRA" THEN PEOPLE WILL BE AWARE!!!!! In addition to that EVERYTHING was SOOOOO SALTY!!!  I had to throw it out half way.. 
Nice way of running a business! THIEVES will always be THIEVES!
author: Nina R.

description: The food was mediocre at best, but the rudest and foul mannered service ensured this to be my last visit!
author: Dan R.

description: I wish I lived closer to this place, so I can enjoy food at this Thai place more often. My favorite dish is "Naam Leam Gai" or Ground chicken with Chinese black olive over rice. It is a unique Thai dish that you can not find anyway else but Modern Thai.
author: Nuntiya K.

description: The first time i have been here sine 2013. I'm looking for Thai food restaurant around polk st. I got RadNah a traditional thai noodle with gravy sauce. the taste was really good. Now i came back and got the same dish it's still the same taste. yumm! Highly recommend :P
author: Jiraporn S.

description: I ordered my usual, Pad Kee Mow which I tend to order every where. The food came out piping hot, you could tell the vegetables were fresh. Tofu was cooked just as I liked it and the dish was tasty. Sprigs of basil through out just as the dish should have. Only have 4 stars because you really have to wow me for 5 stars. Also, the door to the resteraunt remains open so you have to wear your jacket inside.
author: Nirali A.

description:
This was a completely "meh" experience. There are 10 Thai places within a few blocks, so I thought the competition would force everyone to up their game. Unfortunately, Modern Thai fell completely short in the flavor department.

We had the Tom Yum and Pad Se Eww, two staples that all Thai restaurants should be able to pull off flawlessly. Both dishes were fairly large portions and perfect for sharing. The first spoon of Tom Yum was quite nice; slightly spicy tart soup with well cooked vegetables. As we got further into the bowl, there was a gritty sediment (possibly the spices?) that made it very unpleasant. The Pad Se Eww was weak in flavor and the noodles were all clumped together and over chewy. Not fun.

On a positive note, service was quite good (granted there were only three tables of diners).
author: Akash K.

description: I've ordered from this restaurant twice using Grub Hub as the delivery service. The food was pretty good but the food came an hour later than the scheduled delivery. The 1st time was no big deal. The 2nd time was very annoying because a lunch meeting was involved. I ordered the food at 11:11am. I received an email at 11:15 stating the restaurant received the order and was preparing the food. I was given an ETA of 12:10-12:20 pm.  I had to call the restaurant twice before the food arrived at 1:21 pm. I'm done!
author: Kimberley M.

description: This place was great! I stayed right up the street was looking for something local and delicious obviously. I had the Chicken Satay & Cashew Nut Chicken. So good that i went back the next day for dinner again. Good quality food, nice staff reasonable prices for Thai food in SF. All around good vibes, good food,good times!!
author: Tuna O.

description:
Ordered delivery from Eat24. I believe this is my 2nd time ordering here. I was going to give them a 4 star but they're not consistent with the spicy-ness level of each entree or something is always off like it doesn't taste right. The first time I ordered here was last year in October, I remember ordering their thai basil chicken, mild spicy and it was good. The garlic rice that comes with crispy fried chicken is really yummy but the fried chicken was a little dry and soggy. Bf ordered Kho Soi, beef was a little hard. Curry that comes with Kho Soi was rich and nice thick texture but the flavoring was a little off. We can still taste the curry but with a sour taste. Unlike other thai restaurants, I love how I can get their Tom Yum Soup for $6 for a cup but again their flavoring/spicy-ness level is off. First time, I added tofu. It tasted more sweet than sour/spicy like how it should be. The 2nd time I ordered, I chose medium spicy Tom Yum with chicken, flavoring was perfect but the spicy-ness level seemed more like hot spicy than medium spicy. Their mixed vegetable entree is really good, too, but medium spicy was too spicy. What threw me more off was bf ordered Pad Se Ew and was superrr spicy! Trust me, bf and I are a fan of spicy foods but that was sooo spicy that his lips were numb after 3 bites and we had to throw it away :( 

I still believe in this place so I will give them another chance. I'll order again next time but not any time soon. I will try mild level of spicy-ness and see how that works. Hopefully I can update my review and give them a 4 star!!!
author: Sharmaine M.

description: Worst Thai food ever! Food was not flavorful and I ordered the Tofu salad and was given some soupy spicey awful item. But most importantly they over charged us by 20 dollars! When they told me the price last night I had my 6 month old and 2 year old next to me so I didn't think about what they charged us but I realized this morning that was way too much for just 5 entrees and 1 appetizer at 10.00-13.00 a dish. We will try to deal with this today and hopefully we will be reimbursed.
author: Jacki K.

description: Ordered Pad Thai and Pineapple fried rice and it was not good at all. The only good thing we got was the crab ragoons
author: Tamara M.

description: This is my favorite Thai place in all San Francisco. I have been to lots of places and I always comeback to Modern Thai. They give huge portions and the food is really flavorful. The staff is amazing and super friendly. I recommend the Thai fried rice with beef. So delicious. I wish I could give them more stars. Great job Modern Thai!!!!
author: Omar H.

description: We order from work often. I only wish we could use the free appetizer coupons online since we can't show you in person to receive it. Maybe use a code, we can apply.
author: Jenny V.

description: Didn't think it was possible but this place totally screwed up my delivery order - TWICE IN ONE NIGHT.  3 out of 4 items wrong.  Redelivered and still one item completely wrong.  Not simple things either.  Ordered veggies and got tofu and NO veggies.  No egg and there is egg.  No chicken and it's filled with chicken.  Spicy and it was tasteless.  Extra sauce and not even one filled tiny cup.  There can't be a single person at this place that understands English.  Save yourself the hassle and don't even think about it!!!
author: Lynne P.

description:
I Live two blocks from this restaurant and I support them at least once or twice a week. They know my voice when I call to order and they know me by name so you would think they would take maybe a little extra care of someone who eats there frequently... I have dined in their quiet dining room on many occasions for lunch and dinner.  On many nights I just call and walk over and  pick up dinner to go. I love this place BUT Tonight I ordered one of my favorite dishes, 
cashew nut chicken,  and it was INEDIBLE !!!   It was as if I had ordered chicken jerky. THE chicken STRIPS WERE  SOOOOOO DRY and SOOOO OVERDONE THAT you could have bounced them off  the floor. The chef must've dropped 10 or 12 Thai Chili peppers into my chicken dish, because I took one bite and my whole face and neck started perspiring profusely and  this is a dish I eat ALL THE TIME ...I don't know if the chef was ready to go home or was asleep at the wheel or he was maybe trying to sabotage the business, it could be any of those because the dish that he sent out tonight, he should be fired. I have been in the restaurant business for over 50 years as restaurant owner and as a working manager in the finest dining restaurants. Believe me, I know and appreciate well prepared foods. Somebody dropped the ball tonight, BIG TIME..  To screw up a dish is one thing but then to send it out to a regular customer and expect them to eat it  borders on insanity.
author: Henri P.

description:
This place is pretty great and has good service. Admittedly I went during off peak hours, around 9:30pm, but man, if you can be bothered to stay open as a restaurant past 10, good on you, and this restaurant does. My water glass never went empty, which is a good sign. The fish I ordered, the MT Mango, was a delightful combination of sweet, savory onions, bell peppers, chicken, mango, and a bunch of spices I can't remember the name of. All I know is that I downed it faster than I could finish watching a buzzfeed video. It didn't matter at that moment whether I was dining by myself or with a group of friends (though I wasn't, because I'm visiting from the OC), the food was sublime, and that's kind of a rare event for Thai food in Southern California, so it was refreshing to see this restaurant break those expectations. The dish itself was full of mango goodness, as the dish name MT Mango would suggest. I got some rice to mop up the sauce and that was great too. All in all, there are far worse ways (and for me, it was a totally worth it fish) to spend your $15.

I'm not sure why this restaurant gets 3.5 average stars; I'd guess it's because parking in SF sucks (but it does everywhere in SF), and it's not as large good portions as other SF places. But it makes up for it in atmosphere and food tastiness, and service. Anyway, I'm a fan.
author: Mike L.

description:
The food is really great here. If you read my other posts, I hardly go to the same place twice in the city....some.much.good.food.to.be.had! #SFfoodlove

With that being said, I love to get their fresh (not fried) spring rolls to start of my meal. Their Thai Ice tea, is excellent, just the right amount of creamy, cold delish. 

Off to their main dishes! All their noodle dishes are hard to beat. My favorites? Any of the flat rice noodle dishes, lol. I also recommend any of their curry dishes....my fav is their green curry, it is certainly hard to beat, I get it with seafood. It looks and taste pretty amazing. The right bit of everything! 

Their services is pretty good too. Sometimes they get pretty busy, because the place is quiet popular for the area, but they are always visibly around, so you can quickly flag them down and they will accommodate you the best they can. Keep in mind their English is not the best, so be patient and talk slow, and you will get the due diligent service you need:)

They have a semi outdoor area in front that fits a big group, and is lighted very nicely for the nighttime dining. I would recommend that if you want to host a group of people, say for birthday or something. 

It's Michelin recommend, and it lives up to it's name. 

Nom, nom, nom to this Thai place people! You won't be disappointed!
author: Sonia A.

description: Good food, great prices, old time SF restaurant with kind Thai service. Spicy strings beans tum, Pad Thai great, beef noodle soup AMAZING broth, and scalding hot water in the bathroom sink! Woo!
author: Kenji O.

description: Ordered delivery (through Grub Hub) ... we were COMPLETELY IMPRESSED. Everything was so fresh, spicy to a perfect level, light and amazing.  Honestly, we order out a LOT, and this will be on our GoTo from now on!
author: Elissa B.

description: Decent Thai Food, great service, clean establishment. The pumpkin curry is delicious..it's not the pumpkin you think it's pumpkin squash...sweet and spicy
author: Miek T.

description: Best Tom Yam in San Francisco. Everything is clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated.
author: Vladimir Z.

description: It is my first time at this Thai restaurant and Jap provided me with great hospitality. I ordered the Pad Thai with chicken to go and I didn't wait long for my food. Thank you for your kind customer service and great first impression.
author: Pamela L.

description:
Pad Sieng Hai is so good 
You have to try that ,I love it !
Also, the cashew nut with crispy chicken is awesome, taste a little bit sweet but for me it's just perfect!!! 
Definitely come back!!!
author: Jirachaya P.

description: Excellent tom yum soup ...lovely staff ...tried this place first time last night ...and was extremely delighted with the thai curry and the soup !!will definitely go back to try some more thai food !!
author: Abhilasha S.

description: Modern Thia's food has great flavor combined with balanced texture.  I was satisfied with the  portion size and price.  Atmosphere is low key yet pleasant and the service is helpful and friendly.  I would go again.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Came here with my friend and we were hungry. The restaurant looks really nice and there is seating inside and "outdoor". Its not really outdoor because its still glassed but its outside the restaurant? Oh well whatever we sat outdoors because the weather was nice.

We were starving so we ordered a lot. Maybe a bit too much. We got the Pumpkin Curry, Pad See Ew with V Rolls (deep fried veggie rolls), a bowl of Shrimp Tom Yum, and a Free Thai Milk Tea with a Yelp Check-In. The Tom Yum came first and the bowl was much bigger than I expected. The soup was sour and not too spicy just how I like it. It came with tons of mushrooms and nice big pieces of shrimp! The Pad See Ew and V Rolls were average.

The Pumpkin Curry was to die for omg it is my new favorite curry. Every time I go to a Thai place I will order Pumpkin Curry now it is so good! I know it sounds weird but it works! Nice big chunky pieces of sweet pumpkin really goes well with the spices in the curry and the veggies. Very delicious I wish I had more of it right now actually my stomach is growling while typing this. The Thai Milk Tea was too sweet so we couldn't finish it. Aside for that, it was a pretty nice meal!
author: Juan F.

description:
First of all...this place is so stinking cute. Secondly... the food is freaking amazing. What more can you ask for? 

I stopped in with 2 friends for dinner and we went all out. Thai tea, appetizers, and 3 entrees. Yeah, we did it. The papaya salad appetizer is so good, I don't know what they put in that Som Tum dressing, but it was light and flavorful and we were fighting over the last couple bites! Luckily we still are friends. 

For entrees, we ordered the pad see ew, green curry, and I had to try the pumpkin curry. They all were excellent, but the green curry really stood out! It was so tasty and some of the best green curry I've ever had! Plus they serve the food with heart shaped rice. How much better can you get?
author: Sheena T.

description:
Sadly this place, which was one of my top three favorite thai restaurants, has become an over-priced, over-sweetened, under-cooked shadow of it's former self. I ordered Tom Yum soup, hot tea and coconut shrimp. These three items came out to $30. Which would have been fine if any one of these things had been good, but ALL of them had issues. And that isn't even the only issue I had with this visit.

First, when I arrived there was only one other party there. A party of about 6 people that grew every half an hour as one of the marina-types rolled their drunk asses out of bed to stroll in "fashionably late" to their friend's birthday dinner. They were loud and obnoxious, but that doesn't explain why I had to wait 20 minutes for someone to ask if me I was ready to order especially since I knew what I wanted before I sat down. And there were THREE people working there -- a waiter and two waitresses. It looked like the women were intimidated by the loud group and mostly just the waiter dealt with them.

Let's talk about the coconut shrimp. A dish I have ordered many times. At least half of the time I come here or order delivery, this dish is ordered. It is even in my first review of this place: http://bit.ly/1a8dsUX I love this dish, it's shrimp and coconut fried together what's not to love? Well what I don't love is biting in to raw shrimp. Not undercooked, but still translucent RAW shrimp. But what I really don't love is when I spit it out on a plate (they give you cloth napkins so I couldn't discretely spit it out into a napkin) and push it to the far side of the table and it takes someone a full 15 minutes to ask me if there is something wrong. The waitress did have the kitchen re-fry the shrimp to cook it through but by the time it came back my soup was ready and I was kind of skeptical about trying it again.

Now the tea. It's hot water and tea bags. You would think it is impossible to get terribly wrong right? But you'd be wrong...  For some unknown reason they sweeten their ice tea when they brew it so I couldn't just get regular hot thai tea. Instead they heated the pre-sweetened iced tea which was way too freakin sweet. Think southern food sweet tea with another pound of sugar in it. The waitress did offer to dilute it with hot water (why she didn't just make it with half plain water and half tea to begin with is beyond me) but it was still way more sugar than I , or any person who is over the age of 5, would normally consume.

Lastly the Tom Yum soup with noodles. This is the only thai restaurant I've been to where this dish is not technically on the menu. Here they are essentially giving you an order of tom yum soup with a side order of noodles, which is odd because they have a whole menu section of noodle soups and all of those soups are fairly bland (Even the Starbucks of SF thai food, Osha Thai has this dish). This was the closest to being perfect, but it was supposed to be chicken but I got shrimp. Not a big deal since I obviously like shrimp and at least these shrimp were cooked. And because this is a side order of noodles, there were way too many noodles in soup. There was also an odd soapy after taste to the noodles.

The waitress, when she did notice issues, did an admirable job of trying to correct the problem. But it took her much too long to react. Unfortunately, this comedy of errors was just not funny when all I wanted was some hot spicy soup and some hot tea to clear my allergy-induced congestion and it took twice as long for me to get half the quality of food and one third the level of service I had come to expect from this place. I don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon.
author: Dani D.

description:
this place has gone downhill so badly.  i'm really sad because it used to be be one of my favorite local cheap eats. i've been here so many times, i think i was the duchess or king or whatever crown it is you get on yelp.  

the last time i ordered take out from here, i was disappointed by the lack of flavor, but i thought it was because i had made the mistake of delivery.

then i actually sat down in the restaurant.  i didn't recognize any of the waiters. the two girls were nice but so slow.  it took 10 minutes to even get their attention to order. we had to ask twice for drinks and rice. they made a mistake when i asked them to add tofu to an order. and we couldn't get their attention to get the bill. 

the food was so disappointing.  i have been ordering mung bean pad kee mao here for years and i always get it the same way: not spicy, no seafood, add tofu.  the waitress said she couldn't do it not spicy, but i told her just try since i have ordered it that way 20+ times! when it came out, it was not spicy, but also it tasted bland, as if no seasoning at all.  the noodles were really overcooked and mushy.  normally the veggies in this dish are plentiful and there is lots of variety including baby corn, but this time there was hardly any at all, mostly onion and bell pepper.  we also ordered the papaya salad - it tasted old and rubbery. my bf ordered ginger chicken and it was just ok, though probably the best dish of the three.

i probably won't be back anymore.  i just can't handle the disappointment again.  :(

ps.  if you want to give this place a try, they do give you a free thai iced tea if you check in on yelp.
author: Josie M.

description: This is one of my favorite places in the city. I've never had to wait in line, it's Michelin-recommended, and the food is very reasonably priced. Did I mention it's really tasty ^_^? On top of all this, it's quiet (underappreciated aspect of restaurants these days!) and makes a great laid-back, but still classy, dinner date spot.
author: Vaibhav M.

description: I dine at Modern Thai at least two times a week. The quality varies depending on who is in charge of the kitchen.  The chicken wings can be very moist or dry?! I don't understand not serving moist towels when your hands are sticky and you have to get up and use the restrooms or sit with sticky fingers. Please rectify this particular problem...
author: Heda B.

description: Hands down one of the best Pad Thai's I have ever had, I recommend the seafood option, it's phenomenal! I also loved their Thai iced tea, not to mention they have gluten free options :-) love love love!
author: Makenzy A.

description: I visited this place on a Thursday night and were seated right away with friendly staff. I ordered Chicken Noodle soup and my friend got Beef pad kee mao. Both items were excellent. I love tastes and smell of my Chicken Noodle soup that was perfect. My friend also like the spiciness of Pad Kee Mao which was not too strong. At the end, we tried Black sweet rice with Mango for dessert which was a perfect finale. We will definitely come back here to try some other stuffs.
author: Pang W.

description:
Thai ice tea perfect taste wise...helped me keep awake.I just wish it was fresh and not from a pretty made mixture that was heavily reliant on half and half....but regardless.I'll give it the thumb's up  (+1)

Seared Scallops- could do without the veggies but the flavoring was right and I did t find any cold portions throughout the plate. (+1)

Lychee and Duck- The duck was cooked thoroughly enough to where you didn't have to worry about any stomach or digestive ailments later on. Unless of course you have some have some hidden allergic reaction to lychee. (+1)

Fried Banana Ice cream: Could do better with the ice cream portion with all the fried stuff around it. (-1)

Server: Jane- Of the two waitresses,
She was the most attentive and on point server who was on shift at the time I was there. Not only was she able to be on time with refills  but even when I was partially buzzed she was even able to understand my mumbling at times.. I'm impressed by her...much better than that overrated OSHA Thai.... 
Well Done Jane! (+1)
author: Eric C.

description:
Not a fan. I have only been in a few times but it seems like they just don't care. 
I am in a service industry and can honestly say customer service is lacking big time. 
On lunch one time I was told they can't serve me because I wasn't ordering enough. 
Another time I swear it smelt like dog poop and I wasn't the only one who noticed.
author: Timothy A.

description: Couldn't leave work to get lunch so I ordered delivery from these guys. I got two orders of egg rolls for my co-workers and Drunken Noodles for myself. Both were delicious! And I give them extra credit for being able to follow my complicated instructions (not even that complicated) on how to find the entrance to where I work. For some reason, every other restaurant I order delivery from can't seem to figure out how to get in here lol. But Modern Thai staff nailed it! Good job! ^-^
author: Jenn H.

description: Delivery service only - do not trust them when they say the order is on the way. After a solid hour and half, it never came.
author: Angela L.

description: I ate here everyday when I visited San Francisco. It was right down the street from my hotel. The prices are cheap, they have plenty of seating, and the food comes out quickly. The shrimp pad thai was yummy, the crispy tofu was delightful, and the sticky rice with mango dessert was amazing.
author: Sylvia O.

description: Food was very fresh and delicious. The wings specifically were great!!! Waiter was kind. The prices are reasonable great for lunch. It is casual so there is no need to dress up.
author: Diego A.

description:
I spent 20 years living in Asia. Weirdly, given the SF diversity the Thai food here is so odd - often it is so sickly sweet that I have always assumed that it is adjusted to the American palate. 

I ordered Larb Gai and Massaman Curry, delivered by Amazon. See review below. 

-Amazon food delivery rocks
-Larb Gai was so-so: I recommend more lime and fish sauce, it was good texture and such but the flavor was weak. 
-Massaman Curry: Ok, this was just weird. Stewed, shredded chicken with large chunks of potato (?) and the curry sauce was non existent and no coconut (gravy), and the spice was just strange. It just didn't taste like Massaman. I have spent LOTS of time in Thailand and I appreciate taking liberty with and interpretations of Thai cuisine but this was just odd. I didn't mind the odd green beans but overall this was just an odd rendition of Massaman. 

It was ok. On the positive side it wasn't sickly sweet but it also wasn't noteworthy in any way for the dishes I ordere.
author: Deena L.

description: Love this place. I get delivery from these folks all the time, and it usually arrives ahead of the ETA. The fried tofu is addictive, and they do a great job of the mango sticky rice.
author: Mary S.

description:
This place is so cute! We ordered the pad Thai and the mango curry with an extra side of rice for the curry. The rice came in a heart shape! The mango curry was pretty decent. My boyfriend ordered for it to be mild but it was still a bit spicy for his liking. I had the pad Thai! It seemed like a very big portion! No complaints there!

My only complaint about this place was that there is a draft coming through the front door! 

There's also a check-in offer through yelp! You get a free Thai tea, either hot or cold!
author: Cathie N.

description:
My friends and I were in the area attempting to go to Swan Oyster Depot... but the line was insane and we were hungry, so we wandered down Polk and came upon this place.

My boyfriend ordered the tom yum soup. It was okay. I didn't hate it, but I definitely wasn't in love with it. I just wish there was a good Thai place near home (Torrance) that had solid tom yum soup.

We both ordered the pad see ew. I got it with chicken and he got it with beef and added extra scallops. The scallops weren't bad! They were seared before they were put into the pad see ew so it was perfectly crisp on the outside. I liked the pad see ew. Portions are always too much for me, so I took half home with me. I liked that they had a lot of veggies in it. There were carrots, Chinese broccoli, and regular broccoli. Usually when I order pad see ew, they just put a teensy bit of either Chinese broccoli OR regular broccoli, but this one had both, which made me happy.

I also got a free Thai iced tea with my entree for checking in on Yelp.

It was a pleasant food experience, but let's be real, I'm not coming back here when I come visit SF. I will wait in that line for Swan Oyster Depot.
author: Patricia L.

description: Nasty ass food, was pissed I had to pay for it. The basil beef is like 90% fat do not get it.
author: Richard H.

description: I am very picky when it comes to pad Thai and I loved theirs. It's was a bit tangy and not oily at all. I also ordered a Thai iced tea and It was a perfect blend. I also found the staff to be friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend Modern Thai.
author: Savvy P.

description: I am a thai food friends. First time to come this restaurant. I order Pad Thai noodle, taste is different than other thai testaurants that i had before, noodle is sweet and tasty, it blends well with the other ingredients  spices. Except it is a bit greasy,otherwise is perfect. Will come again to try other dishes.
author: Leanne K.

description: Aesthetically the place is gorgeous, has a very modern look to it. Food was good not great, but the portion size was better than expected.
author: Kai-Rey L.

description: We will never order from Modern Thai again. There's late, really late and crazy making late. We were hungry! The order time on Eat 24 said 35 - 60 minutes for delivery. Our order, after several phone calls, came in just a hair under two hours. Not acceptable.
author: Jeremy B.

description: I absulutly loved my experience at Modern Thai. The red curry duck had some of the best flavor I've ever had.
author: Santipap K.

description: Ive definitely had better Thai :(  The red curry was pretty tasty but that was the only thing memorable. I ordered the spring roll, red curry, and bbq beef which came to a total of about $40.  At that price I would expect a small side of rice to go along with the curry.  Either they forgot to include it or you have to pay for it separately which is kind of a rip off.  The bbq beef was super dry with no flavor and looked like a half portion (the container was filled with mostly salad). I ordered from grub hub so maybe its a better experience if you eat in. The food came on time but I was pretty disappointed with the quality given the price.
author: Diana D.

description: It saddens me to say that in the last month or two, Modern Thai's food quality has declined considerably. Most notably, the egg rolls are like soggy cardboard now, with no crispness whatsoever. My D&D group now orders from Red Jade.
author: Storm A.

description:
Yelp rarely fails me, but this one was a definite miss.  Probably the worst Thai food I've had in San Francisco.

The calamari and coconut shrimp had wayyy too much breading.  We ordered the crab fried rice, which was not only totally bland, but they didn't cook the crab with the rice.  It was like they cooked the rice and threw the cold crabmeat on... Beef Pad See Ew was pretty tasteless as well, and super tough & chewy beef.  Ugh. 

Modern Thai was a total disappointment.
author: Grace C.

description: Never order modern Thai on a Sunday after 8pm. Not only did they ask if they can switch up the noodles from my Pad Se Ew. They only place 2 pieces of broccoli in my dish. This will be the last time I ever order from them.
author: Amelia H.

description: Came here 12-9-2015 Ordered pumpkin curry with tofu, steamed rice, and steamed veggies. Curry was very good, rice was a little skimpy imo, and veggies were ok. They also had a yelp dine in offer for thai iced tea but sadly cant get it togo. Everything cost around 20 a bit pricier then some of the other thai places I have been too. But lady who took my order was nice and polite. Overall I will definitely come back for the pumpkin curry!!!
author: Abdul Qader R.

description:
I've been to the Modern Thai several times ... With my husband, with friends ... And they all loved it ! (Me too)
The prices are not expensive, you have choices, you eat well and the staff is nice.
I really recommend this restaurant !
author: Virginie H.

description:
Excellent service. The servers were super polite and attentive in recommending several dishes. Dropped by at 9pm and ordered a Thai basil tofu appetizer and the acclaimed 2011 michelin rated roasted duck curry. 

The atmosphere was a mixture between sophisticated with the audience being a mix of older and younger individuals. 

The tofu was light with crispy basil leaves. Nothing too special, almost reminiscent of the taste of Korean tofu (cold) albeit it being warm. 

Thai iced tea was fantastic. Perfect mixture of sweet and milky, unlike other places. MVP is roasted duck curry. Amazing mixture and blend of flavor. The curry is super rich with complex palette and a hint of spicy sweetness. The tingly aftertaste is similar to drinking chai tea. 

Tomatoes and lychee both offered a unique explosion of flavor. The acidic taste of the tomatoes mixed with the curry gave a unique mix of flavor, and as similar taste was found with the lychee.

The duck needs improvement. The larger pieces had the definite over powering taste while the smaller pieces offered a good mix.
author: Jason L.

description: I live right around corner on Clay.  It has been my easy & inexpensive place for years.  Did it change hands or something?  Satay was so-so, the price is up and they only give you 4 skewers.  The cucumber salad was UNDER the Satay, made of onions with a few chunks of mushy cucumber and there was next to no sause or juice or whatever you call the clear liquid.  The  main dish was Basil Chicken.  They have stopped putting peppers in it at all,  there was very little basil and I think it came out of a can. LOTS of onions, bland and tasteless otherwise.
author: William B.

description:
We come after every Escape Games nearby. Great food with excellent prices, and they're always great for our small group. 

Checking in on yelp also nets you a free Thai iced tea. 

My favorites are the pumpkin curry and the Thai basil dish.
author: Justin H.

description:
We ordered delivery from Modern Thai late Friday night since my favorite place, Navin, was closed. Delivery was relatively quick, about 40 minutes. The delivery guy was friendly and called me instead of ringing the doorbell which was thoughtful given the late hour.

We ordered a tom yum gai soup, spicy string beans with chicken, and pad thai. The soup and pad thai were good, I did not particularly care for the string bean dish. 

It was a-ok and if I'm craving thai at a late hour I would probably order from here again. But for normal business hours, I'll stick with my regular.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Food is pretty good but the staff isn't too friendly. 

I recommend Thai beef noodle soup. It's unique and tasty.
author: Nikki A.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night after my boxing class to grab some take out.

Place was super empty so I was weary about getting food here but I was here and I didnt want to be rude and walk right back out. 

The staff was friendly and greeted me and sat me down at the bar while I waited for my food. 

I ordered the larb with chicken and their Thai BBQ chicken entree which came with a salad. For 2 items it was a little over $30 which I think is too expensive for Thai food but whatever.

I waited about 10 to 15 min for my order and at first glance it didn't look like much but when I got home and dug in I could only barely finish the larb.

The larb with chicken was really good and omg it was REALLY spicy. My mouth was on fire but I love spicy food so I didn't mind. I would definitely get this again and will need to make sure I have plenty of beers to wash down the spiciness!

For the Thai BBQ chicken dish I only ate a couple pieces of this since I was full from eating the larb but it did have good flavor to it and the Thai sweet chili dipping sauce was so tasty with it.

Overall I would come back here for the larb and would like to try it with roast duck next time!
author: Christine W.

description:
I have high standards for thai food, and this place lives up to them. The first time I ate there I forgot my leftovers in my friend's fridge and I was so upset that I drove back to SF from Oakland just to pick them up. It's that good.

Pumpkin curry is phenomenal, phad kee mao is spicy and flavorful (they asked if I wanted it "thai spicy" or "white people spicy", I went "thai spicy"), and the Golden Bags (appetizer) was really delicious. The fresh roll appetizer is just ok, that's probably the only mediocre thing I've had so far.

The staff are friendly and accommodating - the last time I went there we asked if we could order the Combo Appetizer but substitute one of the selections, and they happily obliged. :)

I definitely will return to this place!
author: Julia M.

description: Food is good but not great. Tom yum with shrimp was mildly spicy and had a modern flavor to it. The shrimp was plentiful and well-cooked. The coconut shrimp appetizer was the highlight.  Papaya salad is fresh and lacks enough spice. No real bite to it at all. The chicken pra rem had a fairly thick but tasty peanut sauce. Have previously had chicken cashew and I enjoyed that more. Chocolate tartufo for dessert was excellent with a nice balance of creamy and crunchy, and a hint of rich.
author: Kyle S.

description: My new favorite Thai delivery place in SF! Ordered this for a work training on Sunday and I was so blown away, I had to order it for lunch today. Get the pumpkin curry. Do it now! Also loved Pad see ew, and crispy tofu with peanut sauce. Ordered at 3:05 and it was at my work by 3:35. Amazing! Fast, amazing, with vegan options! Yay!
author: A'Lizzabeth B.

description: Been here multiple times to dine in and for take out due to working in the area. Food is okay and they are pretty quick (ten minutes) for call in take out orders. Have lunch menu which items are cheaper prices so if you feel like eating something on that menu, saves you a few dollars. Work team did a holiday dinner here and it turned out pretty good to my surprise because their service for dine in is usually on the slower side... We reserved the entire restaurant! Check your bill before paying because they may bill you incorrectly, happened to me twice.
author: Iris H.

description: My favorite.  Best Tom Kha in the city.
author: nathan k.

description:
This place is awesome!

Easily our go to casual Thai restaurant in the city, I love coming here because the service and food is good, quick, and very delicious. Pad Thai never fails us here and the Mango curry is always on the table when we come around. If I want my favorite Thai dishes we can go here because they'll be open 10.30 PM . Staff is always friendly and they love their regulars. I love the setup of the restaurant and the ambiance is great. Lots of tree around. We always like sitting in patio at night, it always gives me that romantic night eating at a diner tiny spot light on us feeling when I eat here, very homey and just a warm feeling to night dining, I love it!

Some of the other reviews complain that Modern Thai is a little to pricey. I on the other hand think its moderately price that is tippy toeing on a fine line between moderation and too pricey. If it was too expensive this wouldn't be our go to place for Thai. Oh, and one more thing, you will never being charged for the tip at least you are not five people. Wondering why some people are moaning about being charged for tip. Not a big deal man ! Appreciated people !  Be nice and easy when you are not at home.
author: Chayawee Y.

description: Amazing food, especially their curries. The portions are really big too.
author: Ben S.

description: Very authentic thai food especially the thai basil dish. Most thai restaurant in US they gave sliced meat instead of minced and thats why the flavor wasnt good enough at all. But here was definitely much more tasty using minced meat. If u like spicy, tell the staff for extra spicy too. Brown rice is a perfect match for that too!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
I received my delivery order from this restaurant. Let me say, the food was decent.  Nothing extraordinary, the appetizer I ordered was pretty mediocre (crispy tofu) and the pad kee mao (which I ordered extra spicy) was bland and mostly onions and tomatoes instead of noodles. 

However, what really got me was that the restaurant charged a $4 delivery fee (I live in downtown SF, too) and the delivery guy had the guts to ask me for more tip.  I told him straight up that he's crazy if he expects more than the $4 I'm already paying for delivery.  He argued with me for a full five minutes before shaking his head at me and driving off in a fancy, nice vehicle that no poor, young delivery boy would ever have the hopes of driving. 

Some tips for this restaurant - get rid of your exorbitant delivery fee and I will tip your son for dropping off the food in his daddy's car. Secondly, when someone orders noodles, they don't mean onions.  Please add more noodles to your *noodle* dishes.  Thirdly, good tips are for good customer service and good food.  

It's a stupid idea that by tacking on a delivery fee that's basically half the price of an entree, you expect to wrangle more money out of your consumers by sending your kids to shake their heads at paying customers.  Especially, when you're delivering within a 2 mile radius.  

There are way better thai restaurants in SF that I'll be choosing to order from in the future.
author: Sw A.

description: It is one of my favorites thai restaurant.There are many kind of thai traditional dish,especially Choo-Chee salmon that is so nice.Last night I went there and waitress offered Free thai ice tea,I have never known before,it's so awesome.
author: Kanyarat S.

description: Can here for a late night dinner after a movie at the Van Ness theater. Friendly, prompt service with a smile and the food was incredible. We started with the crispy basil tofu appetizer and my husband who doesn't usually like tofu even loved it. The crab fried rice was delicious and they also offer free delivery. This is definitely our new go-to Thai place!
author: Tori M.

description:
HANDS DOWN MY FAVORITE THAI PLACE!!
Jack, the owner, is a great guy and has a passion for this local restaurant that has FANTASTIC food!!  If you've ever dined someplace and felt like it was a great experience and you want to keep coming back- you know that it's a great feeling.  Many of us in this city eat out almost every night.  I can only speak for myself, but when I find a place I love and feel at home- I'll spend several hundred a month there- take my friends, talk about it.  Jack will make you feel like every time you're there it's a special event.  The staff is very upbeat and knows the menu well- if ever you wanted a place where you could say "surprise me" this is the one!!  Thai Food restaurants are very common but great food and ambiance together are a winning combo!!  

Jack appreciates a good review, but he appreciates honest feedback more than anything.  HANDS DOWN MY FAVORITE THAI PLACE!!

**Oh yeah, the deserts are awesome too!!
author: Timothy K.

description: I like to place orders to go from Modern Thai and the service is always very quick and convenient! It is rare that i wait over 15 minutes for my order and the food is always hot and ready for pick up.
author: Stephen S.

description:
We had a big party of 7 having dinner on Polk St. Most of them are B&T (bridge and tunnel) people. I think I was the only person who actually lived in San Francisco. 

We had ordered a couple of appetizers, they were decent. I think the only one I didn't really like was the fried tofu. I expected the tofu to still be pretty decently moist in the center, but it was so dry. 

Then ordered some main dishes - Pad Thai, Papaya Salad, and 
Pumpkin Red Curry. These were really good. I think my favorite was the pumpkin curry. I'm not normally super into pumpkin curry but it was good. 

Service was decent, so possibly they've read their yelp reviews and improved that. 

Oh before I forget, free thai tea for checking in!
author: Nina Y.

description:
Came here for the first time the other day and totally gorged myself. I got a noodle dish that was extremely similar to chow fun - thick flat noodles, veggies, etc. Pretty good! Didn't really stand out to me but the fried tofu was very good. There was really only one issue - I asked for peanut sauce to dip my tofu in and the waiter brought me a tray of every other sauce except peanut. Haha oops! Ah well.

Editing: I've eaten two more times and I've definitely chosen this as my new neighborhood chow mein spot.
author: Cecilia A.

description: Good thai food, but service leaves something to be desired. The Pad see ewe with beef and pad Thai are always a good choice. I've also had the chicken basil which was pretty good as well. Desserts- the MT Sunday is my favorite! Oddly, it looks nothing like the picture on the menu. The Sundae is basically two scoops of coconut ice cream, red beans and mangos, it's quite refreshing. Last night I tried the sweet sticky rice dessert- not bad, but wish it had been a little sweeter.
author: J C.

description:
Best thai food in the area. Pretty cheap for the amount of food they give you.
They give you a free thai iced tea when you check in on yelp too. 
I've gotten a number of dishes here before.
The pad thai was average. Nothing extraordinary, but not bad by any means at all.
My favorite dish is the pumpkin curry. This is the first and only place I've ordered pumpkin curry (because of yelp reviews) so I can't really compare it to any other restaurants.
author: Tiffany G.

description:
This is the WORST Thai restaurant I've ever had the misfortune of visiting. We came in on a whim on a night out in SF, since we were walking past and decided we were hungry.

Where do I even begin?

1. Let's start with the crappy food. I ordered Panang curry, and guys, this isn't my first time at the rodeo. I know what good Panang curry tastes like. The Panang curry at this place was nothing more than veggies and tasteless, mushy lumps of tofu swimming in peanut sauce. I kid you not. The peanut sauce taste was so overpowering that I couldn't handle more than a few bites. Not to mention no proper curry spices or anything remotely savory. Just peanut sauce. The best part was the brown rice. Which brings me to complaint #2. 

2. The check came and I noticed that I was charged an extra $2.50 for my rice. I asked our waiter why I was charged for the rice and he explained that rice with my meal was extra. Excuse me? What planet do you live on? I've had more than a few Thai curries in my life and they ALWAYS come with rice. They have to, because they're usually soupy and need the rice to balance them out. I told him that, and the fact that he failed to mention that the rice was an extra charge when I was ordering, and that it didn't say so anywhere on the menu, either. He went and got the manager, and I told her the exact same thing. She told me that she would take off the charge "this time," but that next time I would have to pay it. Um, there won't be a next time, lady.

3. It only went downhill from here. Because of the awful food and arguments with both the server and the manager, we decided to forgo the tip. (As a rule, I always begin at 15% when I walk into any restaurant, and the tip either goes up/down from there depending on the experience.) As we were standing up to leave, the manager corners me and gets in my face, demanding why I didn't leave a tip. I told her how I felt and she started berating me, telling me that "good people leave tips" and told me that I HAVE to leave a tip. I told her I don't HAVE to do anything, including taking any verbal abuse from her. I turned my back on her and started walking out of the restaurant. She PUT HER HANDS on my back and shoulders and told me I wasn't welcome at her restaurant anymore. I shook her off of my, told her not to touch me again, and said that don't worry, I wouldn't be coming back.

4. BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE! We're already outside the restaurant walking away and the manager comes out into the doorway with the cook, and both are screaming at us as we walk away down the street. 

My advice? Eat someplace else and spare yourself awful food, argumentative service, and a psychotic, abusive manager.
author: Rimma A.

description:
If I lived in San Francisco this might be my favorite Thai place. 

The food was excellent and the portions were huge. The restaurant is beautiful with bright different colored walls and and orchids on every table. This would be a nice plate for a date.

We had the lunch special that came with an appetizer for $9.95 each and a Thai Iced Coffee and Thai Iced Tea. Very good. 

My entree was the Thai Basil with sautéed ground chicken and onions, bell peppers, Thai chili, peppers, garlic and basil leaves and my boyfriend had the Pad See Ew with chicken. Both were very tasty and again the portions were big. We got the medium spicy level and it was spicy but not too spicy. Spice lovers might want to get a hotter spice level.

For appetizers we had the crispy tofu and fresh rolls. I liked the tofu a lot and the fresh rolls were pretty good. 

The lunch deal is a great value for $9.95. You get a small appetizer and a big plate of food that is easily enough for two meals. I wish I could go there for lunch today!
author: Chelsea J.

description:
This is a decent Thai place in the Lower Polk neighborhood.
The food is OK, noting spectacular, but the quantities are a good portion for the price and they have a nice variety of dishes to offer.
I had a review which stated that the curry was a little water, which i agree, but i actually liked it (i.e. i prefer soupy curry).
author: Ayall S.

description:
Oh my god.  Seriously, I've never ever had better Thai food.  Loved the decor, from the funky green walls to the dark wood accents and the mirrors adding the illusion of space.  
They have a few "outdoor" tables in a porch-type area that's glassed in.  Looked like it would be a great spot to eat on a sunny day.

We were seated immediately and the servers remained attentive throughout our meal.  They have a decent selection of everything - beer, wine, curries, soups, pad Thai.

I had the chicken noodle soup (just what the doctor ordered on a cold windy evening in SF), and I've been craving it since that night.  The broth was light, but didn't lack flavor and the chicken was in big junks of white meat and still so juicy.  My husband got the fried chicken and it was so good that the rest of the table ate most of his food.  A friend with us ordered the pumpkin curry and wow!  I've never had pumpkin curry before, and what a first impression.  He said it was perfectly cooked and came in big chunks so you don't forget what you're eating.  My mother-in-law got the basil Thai fried rice and it was delicious with my hubby's chicken. ;)  I had a side of steamed veggies, and they were perfectly done, if a little bland.

My only complaint was that there wasn't anything on the tables like chili sauce or soy sauce or peppers.  I got the feeling that you weren't supposed to ask for things like that.  I can understand why, I guess, sometimes I want things a little spicier than they come.

Next time I'm wanting Thai food, I'm coming here.
author: Samantha E.

description:
Modern Thai is just OK. There wasn't anything in particular we tasted that I thought "WOW, I need to have that again". That's not always a bad thing; I've noticed San Francisco has quite a few Thai restaurants and this ranks amongst the most average of them. I will say that I was impressed with their shrimp spring rolls. I could actually taste each element and not just a mess of greens. The Singapore noodles and Pad Thai were good but not knockout. 

I'd say give Modern Thai a chance if you're in the area but I wouldn't say go out of your way for it.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Hands Down. 

Modern Thai is the best Thai restaurant in SF!

It is my "go to" restaurant when I have guests in town, a first date or a night out with the girls.

I love the pumpkin curry, fresh spring rolls and spicy eggplant.

The wine specials are great as well. I usually get a bottle of a nice white..the staff keeps it chilled at the table and makes sure our glasses are always just full enough!

Reasonably priced and always reliable - just make sure your review the order with your server - many of the staff are from Thailand and are here in SF, learning English. Be patient with them - it's worth it!!
author: L S.

description: Food is good, but delivery and customer service is horrible. I just received my delivery order which was missing the BBQ pork in the Singaporean noodles (two orders). Called and they said they ran out. Wouldn't they notify the customer a first? And how do you run out at the beginning of the day on a long holiday weekend? Seems like the worst management decision ever. They "say" that I will have 10% off my next order, but how is that possible with delivery apps? Probably never going to order from here again. Lers Ros is better anyway.
author: Steph A.

description: Great place to bring a lunch date, the food is fantastic and very timely. I had the Pad Thai and it was delicious, as well as a chai tea in a fancy glass.
author: Chris B.

description: This place is awful!  Avoid it at all cost. I'm really curious how it was listed as the best Thai Restaurant in San Francisco. Not by a long shot. We ordered Tom Yum Soup that was plain and flavorless, the chicken wings were previously frozen and cooked in old oil, the roasted duck was the worst, the grilled trout was also flavorless with cold veggies.
author: Cedric E.

description: This is my top favorite neighborhood Thai place. I have been ordering delivery so much from them lately. I like their pineapple fried rice and pra ram tofu. Their vegetarian fried egg rolls are the best I've ever had, so chewy on the outside and just perfect. When I have eaten in I like to order their young coconut to drink from. The servers are always sweet, polite, and attentive. Highly recommended!
author: Cynthia C.

description:
The food was good, i had the Green curry and the fried veggie rolls. My low review comes from the spicyness level of the green curry was way above what i am used to.  When the restaurant takes time to specify some dishes as spicy, i assumed this would not be. 
tldr: Green curry is very spicy, despite not being marked as such.
author: Jacob L.

description:
First time delivery last night as a treat.  Wow, let me say this was a treat, some of the best Thai I've had in a while.  We started with golden bags, delicious, crispy and hot.  The cucumber salad was perfect, not too sharp.  The green papaya salad was spot on.  We also had a red curry, medium hot (and it was really medium) and spicy pumpkin (that was really spicy and good).  Nothing wrong with anything, the delivery time was spot on, the food was fresh and piping hot.  I have found my new go to spot for Thai.  Yum!!

Update, the day after.  Leftovers are equally yummy.  We still have more food left for a third meal.  This has been not only delicious, generous portions, too.
author: Donna H.

description:
I probably won't come back here as it wasn't the best Thai food I've ever had and especially if the service was as slow/unattentive as it was on New Year's Eve night. 

Ambiance:  The interior of the restaurant was very nice, as was the semi-interior area (it's supposed to be this area in front of the restaurant that usually would be for outdoor seating where people watch other people in European cafes but is semi-enclosed by walls/ceiling).
