Food: The pork we had was good (my husband did like the sauce that came with it very much) and the fried rice and vegetarian pad thai were decent but the other ingredients (besides the rice or the noodles) was a bit skimpy in the amount (aka little less rice or noodles and more vegetables/egg/meat, please). Though there were two enormous slices of cucumbers that came on top of the rim of the fried rice plate, which is alright but I think I would have just preferred the actual fried rice to be of better quality. 

Service: We did have to remind the servers to bring us our orders a few times, including my husband's beer (which was served to him after our first dish arrived, not before). 

To sum, three stars because it wasn't horrible but it wasn't great either.
author: Mona Lisa M.

description:
Came here for a sit in dinner. Food was good. But the waitress failed to remember that I said no onions in my fried rice... She said I only said no onions on the tofu salad. Aiyah. Even though it may be a customers fault, should you talk back and say it wasn't ur fault but mine?! It's common restaurant etiquette to please your customers and not to upset them more. Hmmm aside from that one bad experience, all else was awesome.

*Update* Went in tonight for a sit-in dining experience. 

The ambiance and decor was amazingly very nice. They have an outdoor (porch terrace) area that is beautifully decorated with flowers and makes you feel like you're outside, but really....indoors. You have a nice view of passer-byers. You walk in a little more is the main dining area. They have a full wine bar near the door and the colorful slightly dimmed room is where we were seated.

I ordered the same dish....fried chicken over fried egg brown rice. The bf got the pad see eww and for appetizer, we got the fried tofu salad.

I made sure to order the salad and fried rice WITHOUT any onions. Unfortunately, the waitress failed to hear I didn't want onions in my fried rice....so, they lost a few points for neglecting that and then blaming me for not mentioning it. I understand we all make mistakes and all, but if you work at a restaurant, even thought you know the customer MAY have been wrong, you don't accuse them for your mistakes. It's bad customer service! 

Regardless, they replaced my entree with what I ordered and I happily ate it! My bf loved their pad see eww and said the dish tasted very fresh and not too greasy. I was pleasantly please with my salad and entree. 

I won't let that waitress experience stop me from returning here for another yummy meal!
author: Christina T.

description:
We ordered the eggplant with tofu, the flat noodles with ground chicken, green beans and basil, and the pad Thai. The most disappointing dish was the Pad Thai, which I think is a hard one to mess up. For the most part, we enjoyed the food and the price was average.  

I would recommend for good Thai food.
author: Gina G.

description:
During my stay in San francisco I was pretty disappointed in some of the restaurants that we visited. I'm glad to say that Modern Thai changed all of that. I was very pleased with the food that they had to offer. Their menu has a decent amount of dishes that will please your tastebuds. My personal favorite was the Gai Naam Leab! Be careful though, as it was on the spicy side when I asked for mild. I must have eaten a whole pepper because my mouth was on fire! Other than the inferno that was taking place in my mouth, Luckily I ordered an ice cold bottle of Singha. That beer saved my life that night.  


Service was quick, considering that it was a Saturday night. Water was always full and I needed it. I have yet to try the Pad Thai here, however a friend says it is quite tasty!
author: Keith O.

description:
Came for dinner before going to a show at the Regency Ballroom. Just two of us on a Saturday night - no reservations. Mostly empty restaurant that filled up a little toward the end of our meal.

FOOD: Started with crispy pumkin -which were a lot like sweet potato fries. It was good - nothing incredibly special though. Then roasted duck fried rice and catfish with eggplant. Both delicious and a good amount of food. The fried rice I would recommend. It's a tiny bit greasy but has more duck than I was expecting and you can really taste it. 

ENVIRONMENT: Surprisingly nice inside. White table clothes, very modern minimal plates. Pretty little bouquets on the table. I could totally see bringing parents here for a casual dinner. It's got a good amount of space - with an indoor part and a weird enclosed patio area as well. 

SERVICE: Really great. Had to ask for water refill once when they came to check on us, but after that they were really good about it. Made sure to ask that we were done with the dishes before just taking them away. I felt they were really attentive but not overbearing or annoying.
author: Kailyn G.

description:
I really don't have anything bad to say about this place.  The food is good, service is friendly, nice interior design, standard prices for thai.  You get a free Thai iced tea when you check in on yelp!

Last time I went I had the fried tofu app and massaman chicken curry.  My friend had the yellow curry.  Everything was really tasty and the portions are generous enough for lunch the next day!  All around it's a good place, and I'm a fan!
author: Olivia D.

description: the server was very nice however I cannot give this place more than a 2 star. I ordered tofu pad thai, the dish was sour and had too much sauce, it looked like sticky noodles. I asked them to make it with less sauce and it came back with even more sauce and no tofu so we got the other food to go and going to eat somewhere else.
author: Jojo C.

description:
I somehow got coerced into eating this food again.  Boy, was that one of the biggest mistakes I made this year.

Let me summarize: Modern Thai-arrhea .  Myself, my friends, and my wife all threw up and had horrible food poisoning for two days straight.  I was so sick in the bathroom that I gave myself a concussion trying to vomit this food up.  We have been discarding pad-se-poo from our rears and vomiting ginger rice.  I have felt bad after eating at cheap and gross places, but never like this.  The most disgusting food I have ever eaten.  This may have permanently ruined thai food for me forever.

They do not deserve a single star.  They deserve to be shut down.  Someone thinks this place should be Michelin recommended?  When the Michelin guide starts recommending restaurants to not eat at, then I'll agree.

We are getting our money refunded.
author: Nathan B.

description: This restaurant is terrible and became hostile after getting absolutely nothing right on my delivery order. I would give them zero stars if I could. The soup I ordered was a no show and the 2 entrees that were ordered 'not spicy' came so spicy that they were inedible. That would have been fine had the restaurant either refunded my money and/or delivered the correct order, instead they blamed it on the delivery driver ("he took the wrong order" even though she read me the order correctly) and told me that "it's your problem, you need to deal with it". Eventually, she told me that there was nothing that she could do and she hung up on me and any call back effort resulted in receiving a voicemail message telling me that the voicemail was full and unable to take any additional messages. No recourse, no refund for the missing food, just 2 inedible entrees. Fortunately, Amazon has standards and resolved it for me and refunded all of my money, as they should have.
author: Aaron M.

description:
WOW!!! Such an excellent meal.

My friend and I ate here our last night in San Francisco...because I was dying for some thai food. I yelped my little heart out and discovered this lovely place.
THANK YOU GUYS!!

Delish. 

We began with the combo appetizer because A. we were starved and B. we couldn't decide on the soft of fried spring rolls. We asked the waiter if we could sub the fried tofu for the soft spring rolls and our request was granted with no hesitation. Me like. 

After that we decided to try the Soju lemonade thai iced tea - and it was fantastic!! 

So far, so excellent. 

Then arrived the main course --

We ordered the chicken pad thai, since I was craving it hardcore - 
and the thai basil, spicy. 
We ordered a side of rice for the thai basil and it came out in the shape of a heart - precious.

I was so impressed with the whole meal. The service was great - the ambiance was great - the prices were great -- the food was super great. 
I wish I could have taken this place home with me...

Until we meet again, Modern Thai...
author: Shannan M.

description: Love the food and ambiance.  They definitely give you your money's worth. The waitress was very nice.  Their lunch menu seems more like dinner because of the amount of food. I will definitely be back!!!!!!!!
author: Synedra B.

description:
We went again this weekend, and MODERN THAI was still as wonderful as before!

The little 'golden bags' were deep fried rolls shaped like a 'bag' (see photo). They have a mild tasting potato and veggie filling. It comes with a mild sauce to dip. (I was in the mood for something stronger, but still, these were good.)

Last time, i had the wonderful eggplant & tofu dish. It was awesome. 

I thought it would be hard to top that, but they did...There was a different twist on the eggplant/fried tofu that I had...so, perfect. Crispy tofu, and nice chunks of eggplant. The sauce was mild, which i like, but one can order spicy. 

My pal had the basil-chicken dish which he raved about and said, "We really have to make an effort to come here more often!". 

The service was pleasant and the waitress was attentive without being overbearing.  Nice 'modern' colors setting. One feels like  they are in a plantation in Thailand ! 

Highly recommended ...again!
author: Addadada A.

description: This is my go-to spot for Thai food. I live near by and come here all the time. The service is always quick and the people are so friendly! Not to mention the food is delicious!! I recommend the crab moon cheese to start then the red curry with chicken and brown rice. Yum!!!
author: Caitlyn M.

description:
I was really impressed by all the food I tasted here. I don't even know if I can remember it all, but considering we had a party of 8 and ordered a ton of items and shared everything and it was all superb. 

Some of the items I can remember: fried tofu, spring rolls, calamari, duck soup, fried rice. 

We also had another type of soup (spicy, veggie) and a couple of curries.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Good food, good service. My wife and I ate the BBQ beef and combination fried rice. Prices are a little high but worth it.
author: Joe W.

description: I ordered red curry chicken  and it was delicious! They also shape  your rice like a heart, too cute. I will definitely come back to try other food here.
author: B S.

description:
Cool thai restaurant place, i just love the decor set up: plain, simple, elegant, and contemporary. 

Food wise, great. The curries are not to creamy, my favorite are the calamaries from the appetizers. Its just so hard to find a decent calamari: where its crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Most places ive been to has only achieved one part of it. But you go, Modern Thai!
author: Cavin T.

description:
Yesterday I placed fairly large order for 1:15PM at 11 AM.  
At 1:10 I decided to call them and check on the status, they told me it was on the way and would be there shortly.  
At 1:40 I called again and was told that they were running late (oh really?) and would be there in 10 minutes.  
At 2:00 I called for the third time and was told the driver had been in an accident of some sort and that the car was driving really slowly...  
Finally at 2:20, over 3 hours since I had placed the order, someone arrived with the food.  That person didn't know anything about any accidents or why the food was late.  They offered me a whopping 10% off my next order (yeah right).  

The food was still somewhat warm, but the portions were quite meager.   The green curry was pretty bland, the ground meat dish was awful, the pad thai was decent, the thai fried rice was ok, and some of the chicken dishes weren't too bad.  

Overall the consensus between 10 people was that the food is mediocre at best, but the service and lies were atrocious.
author: Andrew L.

description: Their fresh spring rolls for $8.50 include 8 pieces of spring roll the size of sushi rolls pieces and does not include any sauce. Their food is over priced and BLAND! I suggest you find a better place to eat Thai Food.
author: Denise L.

description:
Ordered through GrubHub and I was so happy with everything.

I ordered:

Pad Se Ew: delicious, tender chicken, wish I had ordered 2 because it ended up being my favorite dish

Wonton Soup: very flavorful, it was still hot when we got it

Thai Basil Chicken: I love minced chicken and how slightly spicy it was

Overall, the delivery was under 30minutes, everything was hot and delicious, and will become a returning customer!
author: C M.

description:
1.  This was a very good overall experience.

2.  Easy to order via Grubhub.com.

3.  Chicken with Green Beans - Nice and spicy.  I might ask for a tad more kick next time and there will be a next time.  But it was very good.  The chicken was tender.  The veggies were well cooked and were crispy.  Upon delivery, the food was still hot.

http://tinyurl.com/3fz2bab

4.  Steamed Rice - The rice was cooked perfectly.

5.  Packing - The food was neatly packed.  The entree was in a easy to reseal plastic container.  The rice was packed into a small Chinese style food container.  The cold beverages were in a separate bag so that they did not come into contact with the food.

6.  Order Minimum - It is relatively high ($20).

7.  Prices - They  are slightly high for Thai delivery.  The entree was $10.95.  That is a couple dollars higher than a number of other Thai places.

4  Soda  $ 7.80
1  Spicy Green Bean  $ 10.95
1  Steamed Jasmine Rice  $ 1.75
Subtotal  $20.50
Tax  $1.95
Total  $22.45

8.  Delivery - The order was logged at 5:58 PM.  The food was delivered at 6:13 PM.  Yep, you got it.  It really was delivered in 15 minutes.  A whopping 45 minutes faster than estimated.  You can't beat that.  The delivery person was professional and polite.

9.  Overall - The food was great.  Delivery was fast and professional.  Prices are slightly high but the quality makes up for it.
author: Mark D.

description: This place was a great find for a spontaneous date night! We came in around 9:30pm- an hour before closing and they were so welcoming. Service was good and the food was amazing. Best Thai restaurant I've ever been to! I had the wonton soup and the seasoning in it was perfect. Some of the best crab puffs I've ever had as well. This place also played the best music I've heard in a restaurant. It was perfect for our date and we knew every song. I would definitely recommend Modern Thai, especially for younger generations.
author: Aaliyah S.

description:
Can't go wrong with a lunch special price of $7.95.  I had the Pad See Ew and it was great.  Not too salty or greasy, and comes with a nice amount of chicken and broccoli.
Definitely coming back for lunch again.
author: Karen L.

description: This place is average/ok. It's very close to my apartment so I do go there in a pinch for my Thai fix. Service usually slow. Then again most Asian restaurants are never on top of their service game.
author: Kaila L.

description: The best Thai restaurant in town! If you find something authentic and affordable, it's worth checking out.
author: Santi S.

description: Perfect spot for a casual dinner after yoga on a Tuesday! Staff were very nice and accommodating. A friend and I ordered pad kee mao and pad Thai, which were both delicious!
author: Gabriella F.

description: What can I say? It's pretty darn good Thai food for the money. It's also normally empty when I go and I always question why.
author: Joel T.

description:
I love this Thai restaurant. It's definitely my favorite in San Francisco as of this moment. I stumbled upon this place without checking with Yelp-- and it turned out to be the best discovery ever. The food is so so so delicious. I love the Thai tea here too-- it's the perfect blend of milk and Thai tea, and comes in a tall fancy glass. It wasn't bitter or overly watery like some of the Thai tea I've tasted at other restaurants. I could seriously drink this Thai tea all day every day.

I've had their coconut shrimp, pad kee mao, tom ka, pad thai, and green curry. Everything was flavorful and properly spiced. The noodles were perfectly soft and slippery. Every time I think of Thai food, I think of Modern Thai.

For a restaurant in the Tenderloin area, it is pretty nice, and definitely not representative of the outside. Actually, I think there are a lot of great restaurants in the Tenderloin area. If you aren't scurred to venture into the land of crackheads, you'll find there's a lot of yummy food waiting to be discovered. Anyway, back to the interior-- it reminds me of the house in the Thai movie- Jan Dara. It's got columns, vines, and Thai carved statues/art-- and definitely looks very fancy in a Western and Thai way. It's been recommended by the Michelin guide-- and I concur with their recommendation-- the Thai food here is definitely one of the best in SF. However, the food does not come cheap-- but what do you expect for quality Thai food?
author: Julie H.

description:
Modern Thai may not be the most sophisticated Thai food you've ever had, but it's undeniably "comfort food".  Tasty, hot, big portions.

The kid and I always order the same thing for delivery: Chicken satay for her, and pineapple fried rice and yellow chicken curry + rice for 1 for me. Somehow, mysteriously, she turned out not to be a big eater, yet she invariably devours nearly every skewer of her chicken.  As for my rice and curry, I'm able to stretch it into two hearty, delicious dinners *and* a lunch, which makes my cheap little cost-amortizing heart jump for joy.

Plus, their takeout containers are awesome and reusable.
author: Valeria R.

description: Modern Thai has yummy crab moon cheese and a kind staff. The restaurant area is large and almost never full so you can probably find a seat at the last minute. I've started ordering take-out but make sure while you're there that they've given you everything. The brown rice is pretty good, I enjoyed the curry with pumpkin and the Pad Thai was good. My boyfriend regularly gets the yellow curry. All in all you'll end up full and satisfied, but probably won't be blown away by innovation dishes or unusual flavoring.
author: Rebecca M.

description: This place has amazing food their Thai tea is amazing I would recommend you get that. The only reason I give it a four star is because of location it is as all city folks do in the TL. Not the best customers. But if you like great good the best places are located usually in the worst parts.
author: Nikkie N.

description: Terrible service. I ordered my food just to get a call back 50 minutes later to hear I need to come pick it up myself or wait an additional hour. Staff was rude over the phone and made it sound like it was my problem not theirs. Unless you think 2 hours delivery is acceptable I would steerclear of this place.
author: Liya K.

description: This place is pretty good. First time experience and the service was awesome. The food is great and free Thai tea with Yelp! Definitely will come back again.
author: Johnny H.

description: This is our regular spot for Thai, can't beat the prices with their scrumptious food. Truly A hidden gem, much better than osha IMO! Must try!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
It's finals time again and after hours of studying, I heard a grumbling in my tummy. I realized I hadn't eaten all day, so I rang up Modern Thai because of their 4 stars on Yelp. 

I'm VERY sorry I did.

I called at 9 pm (with a closing time of 10:30, keep in mind) and ordered 2 main dishes, thinking I'd save one for tomorrow. They told me they'd be 45 minutes. 

An hour later, I call the store and they tell me they are on their way. They finally arrive at 10:10. By this time, I'm starving! 

I opened up the Thai Basil and it smelled delicious. It was only luke warm. The first bite had good flavor, but as I dug deeper for a bigger bite, there was a layer of watery fat. No, it wasn't sauce- it was disgusting, inedible layer of fat and liquid. 

I decided to try my second dish (the Drunken Noodles), hoping for better luck. I bent my plastic fork trying to get a bite. The noodles were clumped together and no amount of stabbing and pulling was getting them loose. Just to humor the place, I tried a tiny bite. Tasteless and gross, with the texture of glue

I realize I called an hour and a half before closing time, but this by no means gives anyone a free pass on quality. I suppose I was just given the leftovers at the bottom of the pot and they hoped I wouldn't notice.

I'm wasted $25 (including tip). I think I will call tomorrow and demand my money back. By the way, if you would like more proof of this misfortune, I'm posting pictures. Don't waste your time and your money.

As for me, I'm having yogurt for dinner. Thanks for nothing, Modern Thai.
author: emily h.

description: Worst spring rolls ever!! My company does Water.com and I was excited to get spring rolls from this place.. The options were tofu and shrimp. I opted for the shrimp.. The pieces were precut and the shrimp was sitting on top. They tasted like they were a week old. The rice noodles inside were terrible and well everything about it was bad.. Won't ever order from here AGAIN! Even if it's free - my company pays for it.
author: Monica S.

description: This place was great.  I had the chicken red curry spicy.  It was incredibly flavorful, lots of meat and veggies and the perfect level of spicy for me, although I think for most people it could have been too spicy.  The restaurant is cute inside and very clean and the waitresses were very friendly and gave good service.   I'd definitely go back
author: Ashley G.

description:
Holy mother of Thai food, this place rocks.

A friend of mine and I were walking down Polk street looking for "interesting food" if I remember correctly. We saw this place with a distinctly uninteresting exterior and almost skipped it if it weren't for the Michelin guide sticker and a dim green light glowing from the inside. That's when we decided to go in.

What a delightful surprise. 5-star decor, 5-star food, 5-star flavorful spices embedded within every bite. Best of all, their prices are extremely fair. An amazing deal for the sizable portions and exquisite flavors they offer.

I knocked off a star because it took them forever to prepare our food, like 30 minutes at least. I actually had to converse with my friend. Ew, conversations...
author: Nick A.

description: This is my go-to for Thai in my neighborhood.  I often pick up on my way home, but the dining room is nice and cheerful too.  My favorite is the green curry, but I've enjoyed everything I've had off the menu over the years.
author: Karen T.

description:
I don't do juice cleanses or yoga or meditation or drink water. Instead, I get my vitality kicks from papaya salad and Tom Yum. Modern Thai is an okay place for both, but you won't have your mind irreparably blown here. 

I usually go for the aforementioned soup/salad, though I've also had their spring rolls, pumpkin curry, and fried rice. All are relatively uninspired, but not unpleasant. 

The real draw for me is actually the outdoor-ish dining area w/ plants and white tablecloths. Somehow makes lower Polk look idyllic and serene while I'm enjoying my papaya+soup brunch bash. 

Prices are reasonable and there's a Yelp check-in offer for Thai iced coffee.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Our friends are regulars of Modern Thai and suggested we meet up for dinner there.  While parking can be challenging in the area, we lucked out and found a parking place not too far from the restaurant after driving in circles a number of times.  

Don't expect the traditional Thai decor at Modern Thai-- it is funky and the walls are painted in bright colors, which I liked.  The food is eclectic yet you'll find all the traditional Thai dishes-- And the food was excellent... my favorites were the Pra Ram with tofu and veggie Pad Thai.  I also liked the deep fried pumpkin.  Service was wonderful-- they all doted on our friend's infant daughter and were very charming overall.

We'll definitely be back!
author: Janette M.

description:
Newly Michelin starred Modern Thai will not disappoint Thai food fans! 
Friday night we decided to hop over to this Polk Street staple to sample the crispy pumpkin and chicken satay appetizers, followed by the sauteed pumpkin tofu and scallops w/ bok choy entrees. At around 7pm the tables were about 60% seated with a few single diners and a large dinner party.

I don't know what I was expecting but I was surprised that the crispy pumpkin was served French fry style. And more surprised to find that they were, in reality, more soggy than crispy. With the sauce it was quite tasty but I would have to ask for it to be actually crispy if I ordered this dish again. 

The entrees were almost back to back home runs. Excellent authentic flavors. Loved the subtle kick in the scallops dish but the scallops were a touch rubbery from being over cooked. 

Overall experience was quite lovely. Waitstaff was friendly, prompt and kept the water in the glasses. Space was clean. Decor balanced being chic yet comfy, ie you would be comfortable showing up on date night or casual. The two unisex bathrooms are pretty spacious. And last but certainly not least, it should be noted that the waitstaff will sing Happy Birthday.
author: Kim K.

description: Went on a really warm day and the interior of the restaurant didn't help since there was no apparent AC. Service was slow, but the 4 starts comes from the unexpected spiciness of my green curry fried rice which was delicious. Also, I have never had green curry fried rice before and it was a great dish that I would try again, but after I've tried more items on their menu!
author: ML N.

description:
The food is solid, a decent representation of Thai food, with particular favorite being the Pumpkin Red Curry.

The interior has a strange patio type area at the front, enclosed from the street, but not in the restaurant itself. It was cold and empty during my visit, but I can imagine it being quite nice during summer. 

This place is delivery central, car loads of orders are leaving by the minutes, as it serves all the online food emporiums such as Eat24 and GrubHub.

Prices are reasonable, service is slow
author: Chris M.

description: Literally the worst Thai food we've ever had. When we left the restaurant felt sick probably from MSG and gross tasting chicken and beef. Skip this place at all costs
author: Sabrina S.

description: The service is awful. As I write this, in a relatively empty restaurant, I have been now waiting over an hour for my dinner. The waiter has only come to the table after I've flagged him down. No explanation, no apology. This may be the first time in my 30 years of dining out that I leave no tip.
author: Chaz R.

description:
3 stars on a San Francisco scale
4.5 stars on a NoVA/DC scale 

Modern Thai was my go-to Thai take-out place when I lived in Pacific Heights, just before moving to Arlington. It was never my favorite Thai place in SF, but now that I've been subjected to such bad Thai food here, I'm missing it. The staff is sometimes patronizingly friendly, but whatever. The ambiance is kind of ironic given its location. 

And the food? (i.e. all that really matters) It's perfectly fine. Solid Pad Thai, Pad See Ew and Pad Kee Mao. Yummy Pumpkin Curry. Good Panang Curry. No complaints.
author: Sally M.

description:
A fan of the food.  Not a fan of the service.  Had a bad delivery experience last Sunday.  Here is what I sent to them via email.  Let's see if there is a response.  

Sunday, I placed an order through Eat24 for your restaurant.  I have placed ordered with your restaurant 10 times in the last 5 months, I would say I'm pretty much a regular.  Historically, I give a $2 tip for my deliveries.  I order from locations quite close to me, I just am lazy to get up and pick it up.  This time and person that delivered the meal, told me that $2 is not enough and that I need to pay 10% which is $4, that he has expenses, etc, that he needs to take care of, so I need to pay at least 10%.  I was so shocked by this behavior, that I was lost for something to say or something to do, at which point, he turned around and said, "Ok, ok, I'll remember you."  If $2 isn't enough then there are different ways of saying it.  But a tip is a tip, if there is a set amount, then it should be a set charge.  To be honest, I don't get very good experience from the delivery drivers from this place to make me want to give more than $2 and only give that because something is expected, but seriously, a $0 tip is more appropriate most times.  "Hi, how are you?" "How's your evening going?"  "I hope you enjoy your dinner/food."  Things like this go a long way and reflect better on the restaurant.
author: Jason B.

description:
A very good thai restaurant on polk!

This place is very reasonably priced ($10-15 for the entrees?) and the food tastes great.

Some thai restaurants have a problem of making their food a little too sweet (Osha Thai comes to my mind...) but Modern Thai does not. There's just right amount of sweetness where needed.

I had Duck curry with lychee both times and I highly recommend it!

As other reviewers have said their pumpkin curry (vegetarian / vegan I think?) is a must.  For carnivores though you might want something meaty on the side.  

If you check in via Yelp you can redeem 1x thai iced tea for the entree (although I forgot to redeem it both times I went! duh)

Their pad thai and fried rice are both humongous in portions.

It was also Michelin rated a few years ago (which for a thai restaurant in SF is AMAZING).

Both times I went, I made last minute reservations for groups ranging in 6-10 in size so I don't think it is hugely popular (which is surprising to me!) so I would think getting a table without a reservation should be easy (but it's always better to be safe than sorry!~)
author: Sujan H.

description:
Probably the WORST food, and the SMALLEST portions.

My boyfriend and I ate lunch here today.

We ordered the shrimp tempura appetizer. OMG, are you people JOKING??? 6 strings of carefully sliced PIECES of shrimp, which was about 60% batter.  Insulting!

the pan thai noodles with "chicken" ...WHERE WAS THE CHICKEN??? We counted. There were exactly 6 miniscule pieces of chicken, which were tough and dry.

There were 3 pieces of tofu.

And a lot of soggy noodles with too much sauce.

the $7 "house white" wine was disgusting

Eat at nearby Subway ..you'll get the same quality, and save 80% of your money!
author: Sara D.

description:
BOMB BOMB Thai food!  You cannot, absolutely cannot go wrong here.  Everyone in my party loved their dish.

There's not much more to say.  I had the Pad See Eew.  GREAT stuff!

Don't pass this place by!  Even the decor is nice.
author: Michelle T.

description: Everyone, stop everything, I just had the best chicken chow mein in San Francisco (make sure to ask for American broccoli instead of Chinese unless that's your thing).  I need this delivered intravenously.
author: Chase N.

description:
5 stars for food. 0-1 for service!  (And service is IMPORTANT if you're in the FOOD SERVICE industry!!!)

I've often ordered take out here for lunch, and they have never disappointed.  

Until now.

I ordered delivery and was told our order would arrive in 30 minutes.  At the 45 minute marker I called wondering where our food was and was told it was on it's way and would arrive in 10 minutes.  After 10 minutes, I called again and was informed that the food had NOT been on the way and that someone would deliver it right away.

Being that it was already over an hour that I ordered and was misinformed (while my food sat there cooling down), I decided to not tip.  I signed the receipt in front of my office mates (who were all also hungry and waiting) and he says, "Who's card is this?"  I answered saying it was mine.  And he said, "What? No tip?"  I then explained myself, even though I shouldn't have to.  AS TIPS ARE EARNED, not a right.  In fact, I'm surprised we weren't offered a discount or something being they were late, and disorganized on their end.  

After more attitude and nonprofessional behavior from this man, he finally left.  I, of course, was too flustered to check our bag.  

Lo and behold, WE WERE MISSING AN ORDER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I called back and asked to speak to a manager, supervisor, or anyone in charge.  Surprisingly (NOT!) there was none (I'm assuming the delivery man had returned and complained about us).

I spoke to the woman who originally took my order and she repeated every item, including the missing one.  I told her we were missing it and she said "We'll deliver in 45 minutes."  45 minutes?!?  After over an hour of waiting?!?  HELL NO.  

Someone else got on the phone and said he will personally deliver it after I complained about that other guy.  

They get great reviews, but it only takes one incident to lose a customer.
author: Tina G.

description:
I was really craving Thai food today, and since this place is 2 blocks from me, I was down. Walked in around 3pm, obviously didn't expect anyone to be in the restaurant eating at this time, and I was right. Who eats lunch at 3pm anyways? Yeah, I guess just me.

I chose a spot to sit, and was handed a menu. Lunch specials go until 4pm. Awesome! I ordered the Thai Basil with pork. While waiting for my food I had a good look at the place. It was really nice inside. High ceilings, brightly colored walls, and modern decor. They even have an outside area in the front... more like a sunroom. Not really OUTside. Pretty cool.

My food came out really fast (as expected since there was no one there). Sweet! My rice is in the shape of a heart. My food was not only delicious, but cute. Seriously though, I loved my food. It was quite good, and cheap! $7.95 for the lunch special. I ate everything on my plate, which is normally hard for me to do. And the portions were large too. So that says something right there. Yup, it says I'm gonna be a huge pig at this place. No actually that's not what I'm trying to say, but I will be back, I swear.

Also to those of you complaining about the Restaurant.com coupons, the staff has pretty much made wallpaper out of the signs saying they do not accept them. So there's really no excuse to give this place a bad rating based on that. They simply don't accept those coupons. Big chipping deal, get over it, and enjoy the deliciousness that is Modern Thai. I'm sorry you wasted $2 of your income on a coupon. I feel for ya, really.
author: Ashley D.

description:
I've owed a bump to Modern Thai for awhile now and by bump I don't mean cocaine, I mean another star up the ladder.

They're reliable and timely, every visit. There are great lunch specials for $7, dish + rice + salad = un-beatable. Their staff will deliver food for free next door at McTeague's, just walk it right on over. (Hah! I finally used "they're/there/their" all in a row, score!)

I seriously ate Modern Thai almost every Sunday for the entire NFL season. It's right next door to McTeague's so I can get my cheap yet still good Thai food in 15 minutes and eat it right at the bar, missing none of my precious football. They listen to me when I say between medium and hot on the spiciness scale and for that, I heart them.

It's just a solid Thai place to go, sure it's a touch Americanized I assume but they'll listen to your requests and make it happen, all while delivering a speedy and value packed meal. 

Here is your bump Modern Thai, enjoy.
author: Justin N.

description: This review is only for delivery. I ordered delivery 3 times from Modern Thai the first time perfect took about 45 but that's fine everything is kind of slow for delivery around here. Second time the food was a little cold and they forgot one thing. The third time they brought me the wrong food, when I called them the women on the phone yelled at me insisted that I had gotten the right food (funny thing she hadn't asked for my address so how did she know what my order was??) and then when she finally agreed to replace my order she told me that I better of not eaten the wrong food because it needed to be returned. So because they are rude as*^%#oles I will not be ordering from them again. Also this was an online order and I went back and checked that I had put the order in correctly.
author: Dominique D.

description: Modern Thai is one of the better Thai restaurants I have been to. The prices are ridiculously cheaper than I anticipated. The presentation of dishes was great. Service was sufficient.
author: Erica C.

description: A little over priced but the food is awesome ! I've been here countless times and no complaints so far. My favorite dish is Yellow Sea. Idk wha they put in it to make it so darn delicious but whatever it is keep it up !
author: Lena E.

description: Ordered delivery last night. The foods were good, esp the tom yum goong with shrimp was excellent. To tell you the truth, I have no expectation on delivery foods, but this place packed their foods neatly and look appetizing! Will def get foods from here again!
author: Melody F.

description: Not worth the price. My Thai ice tea was good but, it was 60% ice so the one thing I liked I didn't get much of. The Crab moon cheese.... Which are just crab ragoons that are less crispy were mediocre. The pad Thai I had was so spicy (I only got mild) and the herbs they used were too dominate of a flavor that i couldn't eat more than a few bites. 25$ that I wish I never spent.
author: Georgia S.

description: The food was really good it had a lot of flavor and not greasy at all the pad sew was especially delicious and the fried bananas and ice cream from mitchells makes their deserts great.  The service was friendly and the restaurant had a good atmosphere and decor.
author: Muy V.

description: Was owned by a friend of mine. That's why i frequented a lot with friends, especially on Friday nights or weekends right before clubbing.  The chef(ex) used to be a friend of mine too from Thailand. Lol good service plus authentic Thai food.  I haven't tried the place since the change of ownership. Hope all is well!
author: Alanda B.

description:
SO MODERN.

Don't bring your awkward boyfriend.
author: Kaylie P.

description: Totally impressed!  Had chicken satay skewers & coconut shrimp.  Then the Pumpkin Red Curry & Thai Fried Rice with beef.  Could not finish all so a bonus lunch for one tomorrow.  We shared a dessert, fried banana with coconut ice cream. Everything came out promptly and the waiter was very attentive. We have travelled to Thailand many times & love Thai food & this rates as one of the best!   Will definitely be back and highly recommend.
author: Robert L.

description: I was on my way to House of Thai on Larkin (formerly Thai House Express) when I passed by Modern Thai, which I hadn't seen before.  I looked them up on Yelp, they had some good reviews, plus a free Thai Iced Tea offer, so I thought I'd give it a try.  Although they have a nice ambience, including a covered outside sidewalk area, and their staff is friendly, and the Thai Iced Tea was great and served in one of those very tall glasses, I thought the actual food was just 'ok.'   I ordered the chicken satay and although it was served in a nice, long dish, the way it was prepared it was a bit dry and not very flavorful.   I then ordered my favorite type of curry, mussaman, which is usually made with beef cubes, but this time with chicken.  Now I've had a lot of mussaman in my many varied visits to Thai restaurants (with R'noh Thai in Larkspur making it the very best), but this was NOT Mussaman, or at least the way I know it.  I don't know what it was but it had a very different flavor, a bit bland, the peanuts were uncooked and there were no potatoes.  The chicken, which she said was white meat, was not -- it was thigh and leg -- which, for some people, is absolutely fine -- but I only like white meat chicken in my curry dishes because it soaks up the curry sauce much better.  It was a misunderstanding -- she didn't understand what I meant by white meat -- so I'm not rating them on that -- but I simply have had better Thai food elsewhere.
author: Merrick W.

description: I love Modern Thai! Their takeout service is super-fast and the food is always tasty. Staff are friendly and efficient and the noodle dishes are some of the best in the city!
author: Charlotte R.

description:
3.5 Stars

First off, I really like the decor. The first room towards the street is very cute, well lit because of the windows and their wooden chairs. Unfortunately, we sat in the bigger room, but still very nice.

A friend and I came during lunch after walking around Polk Street. She had the Pad Thai and I had a curry noodle dish. We also decided to get an appetizer, which was $2 with our lunch deal. We got the spring rolls, but when it came out, it was basically one small roll cut up in four. It was so tiny, not quite worth even $2. I don't think they dipped the rice paper in water long enough since it was a little tough/dry. 

My curry noodle was quite good. I never had this type of dish before, so it was a nice and new experience. My friend on the other hand thought her Pad Thai was just okay. 

Customer service was good, they were nice and let us split our checks.

I would come back to try other dishes if I was in the neighborhood, but I don't think I will expect such a deal when it comes to the lunch appetizers.
author: Mandy D.

description:
Another scrumptious Thai place in Nob Hill. So happy I am surrounded by all of this Thai goodness! :)

My friend and I came here last night and ordered:

*Beef Sirloin Salad- Grilled sliced beef sirloin, tomatoes, cucumber,
mint leaves, cilantro and lime dressing

*Tom Yum- Spicy and sour soup with galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves,
onions, tomatoes and fresh mushrooms

*Spicy String Beans (mild) w/ Chicken- String beans, bell peppers, basil leaves and
garlic in house special chili sauce

Everything was super tasty and flavorful. I especially enjoyed the Tom Yum soup, which was light and yummy. 

Our waiter was super friendly and super super happy, I guess he just really loves his job...or he was making fun of us for wanting "less spicy" spicy green beans haha. Either way, he made it happen. 

Before this outing, I ordered food from this place for delivery, and it came when they said it would. I was feeling very pig-like so I ordered lots of food, including one of their lunch specials. Everything was also very yummy, although the Tom Kha wasn't as flavorful as I would've liked. The Thai BBQ Chicken was yummy as well as the Pineapple Fried Rice (although I like Thai Thai's better!)

I'll definitely be eating here more often!
author: Sonya D.

description: I absolutely love the good here. It is by far my favorite thai good place. The decor is nice the food is delicious and thru keep the place clean. I love the peanut sauce, they have good red curry, and they have this spicy calamari dish that is so yummy! I have been going here for years and every time i try a new thai food place I end up being disappointed.
author: meme s.

description: One of my favorite places to go to on my lunch hour.  Friendly, prompt service that can accommodate large groups. Good selection of tasty Thai dishes with lunch specials under $10.  Plus, free Thai ice tea if you check in on Yelp!
author: Mad B.

description: I am a fan of its lunch menu, and in particular its pad seew.  The restaurant is nice, service depends on the wait person, some good some just OK.   I live close to the restaurant, so it is convenient.
author: Meiko S.

description:
The service is great! The food is very good! I was very impressed with green curry. The shredding pumpkin appetizer was delicious! Lightly fried like sweet potato fries but much better. The Pad Thai was good but not super impressive. The mango black rice wasn't as good as the food. The black rice was part was a little harder than most sticky rice. 

Pros:
Service
Great Atmosphere
Green Curry
Shredded Pumpkin

Cons:
Dessert
author: Marissa P.

description: I ate here today, everything was fine until an Entree was not how I ordered it and when i tried to explain that was not correct the manager got an attitude because I would not accept to eat something I didn't want, and she was really rude. Restaurant etiquette is a negative. Plus there was a $4.50 Service charge for a party of two....this place is a must avoid in San Francisco, good thing I only drove 600 miles to have bad service.
author: Alma H.

description: Great place to visit many choices too pick from the menu the staff is very friendly and polite i brought my gf here on our first date, and I hope she enjoyed it
author: Oswald m.

description:
Me and a date split the Fresh Spring Rolls, Spicy Seafood and Jasmine Rice. It was all great and plenty of food for the two of us. The Spicy Seafood (which includes calamari, shrimp, mussels and scallops) was not at all even remotely spicy! It was in fact rather sweet, but tasty none the less. The peanut sauce for the spring rolls was also sweet and not too peanuty (which is actually how I like it). I also liked how the spring rolls were already cut into sushi roll bite sizes. This made them easy to eat.

The restaurant is really cute and fun on the inside, really tall ceilings, brightly painted walls, heated indoor/outdoor patio room. Though the bathroom was insanely dark, I couldn't even check my makeup! 

Service was prompt and the prices were quite fair. This is a great place for a date or to eat out with a group of friends. I'd definitely come back here.
author: Vivian A.

description:
Food here is excellent! My friends and I went here before our show at The Regency Ballroom; enjoyed each entree and had so much leftover! And a free Thai iced tea for checking in is a treat!!
I don't recommend coming here for lunch as service is a tad slow but taking out is super easy.
author: Abby R.

description: Without question, I recommend modern thai big time.  My girlfriend and I are huge fans of thai food, and we keep coming back here for more awesomeness.  The red curry is to die for.  The papaya salad is also great (and if you ask for it hot, they make it super spicy).  Go here, you won't be disappointed.
author: Cyrus K.

description:
Came to Modern Thai for our first night in San Francisco. It was somewhat busy on a Wednesday Night. Overall we liked it - the food was good, the service was pleasant, and the restaurant was nice - but not enough to go back anytime soon with all of the other great places in the area.

We had the Massuman Curry with Chicken, which was tasty, and the Spicy Pumpkin Curry with Tofu. We were a little turned off by the rind that was still on the pumpkin (making it chewier than expected), but once we realized and cut it off, the dish was also quite good.
author: Alden Q.

description:
I love this little place. The food is always fresh and delicious, and the service is always on point. I'm a particular fan of their pad thai, and their combination fried rice. Plus, I love that you can get a side of steamed noodles instead of rice to go with your main courses. 

I almost always get takeout from here, so while I can't necessarily comment on the in-house service, I can tell you that their takeout is super speedy, and the staff is always really sweet

Oh, and did I mention that they're Michelin recommended?
author: Gabby Z.

description:
Really good. Stopped in as we were walking by and was pleased with what we found. Pleasant, quiet dining room and friendly staff. 
The satay was really good. Peanut sauce could have been a bit chunkier. 
Masman curry was amazing. 
Mango chicken was very good. 
Pleased with the price.
author: Paul G.

description: Came by this place it was delicious. We ordered the pumpkin curry, pad see ew, pra ram and we loved it all! The service was awesome, they were really friendly and the atmosphere was great. We sat on their outside patio and had it all to ourselves. Highly recommend this place!!
author: Leah R.

description:
Not very good.

Service: Somewhat attentive, at least in refilling our water glasses. Food came out fairly quickly, except for one of our two pad thais, which the waitress apparently forgot to put in, which meant one of our group had to wait for 10 minutes to eat after the rest had received their food.

Food: Themes: Sugar, and heavily Americanized. 

Aside from the papaya salad, which was an interesting interpretation of the classic appetizer (it was good), every dish was much too sweet, like a large amount of sugar or syrup had been added to each. The "thai basil" ground pork's juices reminded me of Aunt Jemima's pancake syrup.  Pad Thai- probably the worst I've sampled. It was edible, just way too friggin sweet.

It's a completely mediocre spot, probably fine for those unfamiliar with authentic Thai. For those that are, look elsewhere.
author: Adam M.

description:
Dishes are very very reasonably priced, so are the wines.

The food is delicious. Instead of the typical greasy and heavy, it is light and airy.  Highlights of the meal included the delightfully spicy and tangy crispy papaya salad, and the mango red curry.

the dining room has a moderate capacity, and the environment is very casual. The arrangement of the tables can easily accommodate nicely sized parties.

I will be coming back.
author: Peter T.

description:
Came here once for dinner. 
We were seated in this outside patio like area. It was freezing! - star
Overall everything was great. They give a lot of food and its pretty yummy.
The decor is nice. I especially liked the small daisy they have on each table.
Great bathrooms from what I remembered.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Pretty good Thai joint overall.
Pumpkin curry is a must try
author: Robert F.

description:
The food is good, but the people working there are idiots.  

I understand English not being a first language - was there myself, and now an ESL teacher.  But if you are going to run a business, the people working should be able to understand basic words.

Example: "No pork, just vegetables, because I am a vegetarian."  Dish comes, full of pork.  

Another example: ordering online, asked in bold large letters and clicked the box for no silverware and napkins - still got them.   Also online, asked to add something in the notes (website says they will charge you for additions).  Go pick it up: not added, and the girl said they didn't read the order.  Come on!
author: Stacey R.

description:
Excellent Thai place. Good atmosphere, decent service, and delicious food.

Started out with the crispy papaya salad, as many other Yelpers recommended. Flavor was great, and the texture of the crispy fried papaya was a nice change from your regular papaya salad.

Also had the pineapple fried rice with chicken, duck and lychee curry, and pad kee mao. Loved the duck and lychee curry... I would have never thought to cook with lychees, but it went with everything so beautifully.

The only reason I'm taking off 1 star is because sometimes the service was a little bit slow. Also, in the crispy papaya salad, they included chopped green beans AND Thai green chilis. When everything is mixed together, they look identical. 

After extracting 2 green things from the salad, I cautiously tested one out. It was a green bean! Great, I was in the clear and assumed they were all green beans, so I popped the second green mystery object in my mouth. Erm... it was not a green bean. It was a super hot Thai green chili. It was really painful and kind of killed the mood for the first half of the meal, and I have a decent spice tolerance. I just..... don't know why anyone would do that. Either mince the chilis, or put them in whole, or don't include green beans.... just do something so there is a clear distinction between chilis and non-chilis.
author: Rhea K.

description:
Bad: insipid 70's easy listening remakes. Both my Tom kha and duck curry were mostly onions. The Tom kha even had at least two or three different kinds. Sadly, I don't care for onions. 

Good: excellent price, good food value, good service. I would return.
author: xx x.

description:
Happened by this lovely Thai restaurant on a busy Friday night. They creatively regrouped to seat us right away, rearranging for the large group coming in at the same time. Quick thinking and very accomodating customer service.

The food was excellent surpassing all expectations! Crispy basil tofu appetizer! Brown rice, Green Curry w shrimp and the Cashew Tofu!  Everything was cooked, seasoned and presented with perfection!

Service was prompt and respectful. We appreciated the quick turn and friendly service, reasonable prices!
author: Terri H.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city.  There is a nice partially-outdoor area in the front and the staff is always quick and friendly.  

There are three things you NEED to try here:

1: the beef sirloin salad.  It's grilled sirloin sliced thin over cucumbers and lettuce and soaked in this deliciously acidic herb-lime dressing.  The portion is huge and I still can't get enough.

2: pumpkin curry.  Large chunks of pumpkin and meat, peppers, and basil in a really flavorful, creamy, coconut-based red curry. 

3:  roasted duck and lychee curry.  The idea of sweet lychee in a curry sounded so strange that I had to try it.  It was amazing.  The fruit compliments the spiciness of the curry and the richness of the duck very well.  It is now one of my favorite guilty pleasures.  

The lunch specials are also fantastic, since you get a generous portion of yummy food plus an appetizer for around $8.  I recommend the thai basil with chicken and fresh spring rolls with tofu.  For the peanut sauce lovers, the pra-ram is rich and delicious and the veggies are always cooked to crunchy perfection.
author: Holly E.

description: Modern thai is great!! The service is speedy fast and the food is delicious!  I always get the crispy fried tofu & sticky rice and the veggie pad thai! Very tasty. Their thai iced teas are amazing as well! Can't go wrong here!
author: Tara W.

description:
I LOVED this place!!

One night, my fiance and I were craving crepes...delicious chocolate crepes...for dinner. We were so sad when we got to the crepe and it was closed. Instead of trekking all the way to another crepe place, we reluctantly decided to find something else.

We stumbled about Modern Thai and woo hoo! So glad we did! You would never think it was a nice place based on the outside... but once you go on, it is so super charming! There is an enclosed outside area and also an inside section. Both are really cute. We sat inside because there was already a couple in the outside, heated area and it was way too quiet to have a conversation. 

The decor was so cute and again..charming. I'm trying to think of another word to describe this place, but I can't. The bathrooms were clean and again..cute.

I order Pad Thai- hands down the best Pad Thai I've ever had. My boyfriend had some sort of mixed meat fried rice- again...best rice ever!  it was tiny and had so many delicious spices! i don't want people to read this review and pass it off because I'm raving about everything..but really..GO TRY IT! Or don't and leave this wonderful place to me. :) AND I haven't event talked about the best part yet...

THE DESSERT. FBI- Fried Bananas and Ice-Cream. Holy crap. HOT, fried bananas with some sort of raspberry/pineapple syrup and ice-cold french vanilla ice-cream underneath. SOO GOOD. On a scale of 1 to 10 of best ever, with 1 being the equivalent of trash and 10 being like the best dessert ever, I'm giving it a 9.9. my boyfriend and i split it and although it was plenty, i definitely wished we had ordered two.  We've already decided we are going back just for dessert..and soon. 

So glad I found this gem!! I can't recommend it enough!
author: Katelyn E.

description:
I love unexpected adventures. 

My buddy invited a few of us to come to SF on a random Tuesday night after work...to a random bar we've never heard of, with random strangers. Despite living in the south bay, we had enough adventurous spirit to embark on this a journey. 

We went to McTeague's Saloon first, but decided to be responsible and eat before drinking. We were totally unfamiliar with the neighborhood and didn't know where to eat. Luckily, my friend pulled out his blackberry and yelped it! Yelp to the rescue! We discovered that the restaurant RIGHT next to McTeague's (Modern Thai) has 4 stars and 177 reviews. Score!

We ordered the Duck and Lychee Curry, Basil Chicken and Pad Thai. The Duck and Lychee curry was the star of the night. I was really impressed that the curry was flavorful and full of spices, but the lychee and cherry tomatoes made it light and fresh as well. Most currys can be very heavy and starchy with potatoes. This curry pared completely unexpected ingredients together in a very innovative and tasty way...modern indeed. 

I have also been searching for a good Pad Thai for ages. I think I've found it at Modern Thai. The color of the noodles were just right...not too orange, not too pale. The noodles were a nice consistency, not too gummy. Tofu, crushed peanuts, carrots on top. You would think that it's not hard to make a good Pad Thai, but I have not been able to find a good one in the bay area so far. That being said, I still miss the Pad Thai from Thai Nakorn in Davis, during my college days. But maybe I'm holding on to just a memory and I'm pickier with food now? I'll have to go back to Davis to see if it's as good as I remember. 

The Basil chicken was just a simple stir fry, nothing special...reminds me of home made stir-frys. Still tasty, but not particularly memorable. 

Service was good. With 1 bottle of wine and 3 dishes, it only came out to around $65. 

All in all, I will definitely come back for the duck curry and pad thai if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Jeanne S.

description: Hella good!!! friendly servers too, and good location, nice place t go to after a few drinks from one of the several bars close by.
author: Sammy D.

description: Free thai ice tea with check in :) Waitress is very friendly!! Not the best thai food but also not the worst. Quiet and clean environment.
author: Janet L.

description: Update: the Thai fried rice is probably one of the best items. The beef salad was tasty but not the traditional style/flavor. Crab moons were good but very standard, and the pad Thai noodles are very skinny and the flavor tangy.
author: Piper W.

description: Singaporean Noodle gets my vote! Tea in a big glass instead of a little cup is also a plus.
author: Heather W.

description: The food at this place was great. The atmosphere was somewhat awkward. The service was horrible and none of the servers were able to speak any English enough to get our order correct. There was a $5 service charge for eating with 4 people and a mandatory tip of 20%. The waiter actually chased us to our car in the parking garage, demanding us to pay the addition 5%. We were never informed of such rules and it was quite embarrassing.
author: Timothy S.

description:
Friday night reservation for 8- no problem.
This is a very nice Thai restaurant, with a very romantic, low-lit ambiance. I was here for a birthday dinner and the waitress recommended we order 5 dishes for 7-8 people. 1 less star for the cold breeze that kept flowing in whenever people entered and exited to the outdoor seating area. Other than that, this is a good dinner spot before a night out on Polk st.
author: Kari K.

description: I love all things pumpkin, but this pumpkin curry was just aiite. The service was also mehhhh, despite there being only two other people in the restaurant. Just blah.
author: Neftalí J.

description:
Since my office moved from lower SOMA to the financial district, I've missed good Thai. The Westfield Mall foodcourt is mediocre at best and since it's not really a restaurant, there's not a lot of customization if you have specific diet limitations. I've tried three other locations in the downtown/financial area and each were kinda on the meh side. As a result, I've not been getting my regular diet of tasty pad thai or pad see ew or anything of that sort. 

Imagine my surprise when my friend brought to Modern Thai, located around a convenient corner from where I live (in my defense, I don't really go out to eat on my own so unless I'm with someone, I don't explore the amazing restaurants near my place and usually when I do go out, it's to SOMA/financial district/mission).  

As it was a restaurant I hadn't tried before, I decided to go with one of my favourites, the pad see ew with tofu. First off, omg what a large plate of noodles. I easily had leftovers to take home since there was no way I could eat everything. Second, there was a distinct lack of grease and oil, something I'd found in other restaurants which wound up wrecking the dish for me.  Third, the food came out fast and the waitstaff was attentive and polite and refilled our drinks quickly.

Only thing I didn't like was the lack of chopsticks available at the tables. Yeah, I probably could have asked, but I usually expect chopsticks automatically in Asian restaurants, either supplied at the table with the other cutlery or brought out with your food.  I wouldn't deduct any points for this, as it's more of a little quirk for me (I try to use chopsticks whenever I have Asian food, just because). 

I would highly recommend this place so far. I'd definitely go back and would like to try some other dishes while I'm there. I'm glad that one of my favourites was done really well though and I can always fall back on them when I'm craving it!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
The service was a bit slow... but, they were nice. 

The serving sizes were great for the price. I will 100% go back.
author: Gina H.

description:
Pad Thai and Curry both looks very nice but tastes...hmm..not too bad..
The fried banana with icecream was good!
They also hv happy hour specials with 10% or 20% off on different dishes. I'm thinkin abt tryin the mango curry in the future..but probably not very soon..lol
author: Mia S.

description:
Admittedly, I was not running on empty for this dining experience. I arrived a little late in the evening and wanted only to check out the caliber of the pad Thai. I indulged and ordered coconut shrimp - I know, not really Thai.  But in fact the Thai appetizer menu was a little limited and predictable.  

Anyway, back to our story.  The coconut shrimp was just ok.  The shrimp was somewhat over cooked and bland. The pad Thai was not bad.  A little sweet for my taste and I fault myself for not requesting very spicy. I fault Modern Thai for not asking.

Service was fine. Seriously - I tried, but this is the best I can do.
author: J T.

description:
Just looking for somewhere to eat nearby and found that there are a lot of Thai restaurants in this area. Decided on this one, and yum, was it good.

We sat "outside", which is still an enclosed area with a heater. It had a much quieter ambience than the inside dining room and I actually preferred it more.

We started with an appetizer of the crispy pumpkin. This is a MUST get. I'll definitely be craving these -- they're similar to sweet potato fries, crispy, sweet and savory with a hint of sesame. Served with a side of Thai chili sauce, I could not stop munching on them. 

I split the choo chee salmon with my boyfriend and ordered rice to go with it. Two things I must note: the waitress brought us *warm* dinner plates, which is a plus, and the rice was molded into a heart shape. How cute! (Yes the guys did start rolling their eyes at it.)

The choo chee salmon is grilled salmon with a red curry sauce and some veggies over it. It was delicious! I must admit that the sauce is a tad bit on the sweet side, but the sweet taste did not offend me like what some other Thai places offer -- you can still taste the curry -- and I stirred in some Thai chiles in fish sauce to compliment the sweet taste.

Overall a very satisfying meal. My friend who got a noodle dish didn't seem to enjoy hers as much though, and looking at other reviews, I'd say stick to the non noodle dishes at this place.
author: Alice C.

description:
Great food and great service, what more could you ask for?!

Checked the Specials menu and there it was, Massaman Curry. I would get this in college at one of the Thai restaurants near my college and it was always amazing, hearty, and kept me coming back. I haven't seen it on a menu in an SF Thai restaurant for a while, so when I saw this, I had to have it! I got it with tofu and brown rice, and I finished the whole thing. It was that good.

Food is served family style, so you definitely get bang for your buck.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Crispy basil tofu - awesome. 

Pumpkin curry - wonderful balance of sweetness and spice. 

Beef pad kee mao - savory, tasty, and incredible. Made extra spicy on request, the beef was tender, the veggies crisp, and the rice noodles perfectly chewy. Proooooobably what I will crave every time I've had eight IPAs (or whatever you do at home on a Tuesday night). 

Two entrees and an app, plus delivery, for under $30? We'll most definitely be back.
author: Bradley M.

description: I've come here often since it's so close, and offers a wide variety of menu options. The Pad Thai has a great flavor, and the crab moon cheese is delicious. My only complaint is it's a bit on the pricey side compared to other thai restaurants nearby.
author: Ali H.

description:
We came in for lunch and sat on the covered patio section. The decor is super cute and the lunch specials are $7.95 a plate. Great portions and delicious food! The Thai basil chicken & white rice was really good.

We didn't get to order this, but our neighboring table ordered fresh coconut juice with these nicely decorated coconuts. There was a pretty umbrella and cute straws. They complimented the juice and advised that we should definitely have it next time... and we will!
author: Mina H.

description: I think I like almost all the dishes we've ordered. Very very good. Just the service needs to improve because it's horrible. I think they are only there to write your order down, bring your food, and give "I hate my life" expressions. All well, food is good, thats' why we're there.
author: Elaine N.

description: I like Thai food so This restaurant is my favorite, the restaurant looks nice and clean I got the Tom yum soup and red curry some more baby corn and mushroom,oh well  it  was really good food. I will go back.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Got the mango red curry, pad see ew, cream cheese wontons, and sticky rice. It was all pretty good. I thought it was a little weird that the sticky rice came in a small, super dense patty thing, but everything was tasty enough.
author: Emily F.

description: Flavorless pad thai. The lime was the only flavor to the dish. Waitress had attitude. Just a bad experience all around. I didn't get food poisoning so I'll give it 2 stars. But  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Cee T.

description: Love this spot, coconut shrimp was killer. The noodles are perfect and balanced with tons of chicken! TL has so many hidden jewels.
author: Christopher H.

description:
Modern Thai is one of the better 3 star Thai restaurants out there, and this city is full of 3 star Thai restaurants.  For one, it has a surprisingly inviting interior compared to other places in the neighborhood.  It also has good prices and nice service.  I'd love to claim that the food is stellar: it's not, but it's perfectly good and they have a broad range of options on the menu.  

Most recently, we had the fried green papaya salad (fun -- and fried! -- but you ultimately don't taste the green papaya due to all that yummy fryness), mango red curry with chicken (lots of good vegetables and flavor, but not terribly complex, and they overcooked the poor chicken), and pad thai (grossly oversweetened).  They have brown rice too, which is always a nice option for the health conscious.

Good, not great, but still much better than the other Thai options on Polk.
author: Laurence W.

description: Ruh-row, I'm writing the dreaded nego Yelp review.  My boyfriend toolk me in to this place as a special date, and I had high hopes because of the cute vibes... hearts and orchids, Top 40 radio, etc.  But 2 hours later, bf DEFINITELY GOT TERRIBLE FOOD POISONING from eating aa duck and lychee curry, and my vegetarian tummy felt awful, too.  AVOID!
author: Rachele H.

description:
I enjoyed my dinner here.
it's rare that I don't plan my dinner ahead but we got seated right away. 

we ordered the followings;

appetizer:
fried pumpkin fritz: pretty good! it's like sweeter version of sweet potato fries. not bad, but nothing special.

entrees:
special salmon dish & spicy seafood:
the spicy seafood was really good! I couldn't ask for more flavor and sea food. the flavor worked so well with rice and it really surprised me. 

the salmon was very good as well.

we tried one of their desserts (exotic something). I couldn't have much because it was huge and I was full but we enjoyed the dish overall.
author: Sung C.

description:
I get Modern Thai delivered (via Grubhub) almost every week.  Normally I would be quite embarrassed to admit to such spendthrift behavior, but Modern Thai is quick and very, very satisfying.  With one click of a button, I get delicious food delivered to my door in less than an hour.  

I particularly like their fried trout dressed with lovely vinegary apple salad -- a clever little combination of sweet and sour, crunchy, and meaty.  If you're daring (or just Asian), order their tilapia, which comes with the fish head and tail and all.  Dip it in a little tamarind sauce and enjoy!
author: Elaine Z.

description: Red curry with duck, bomb. Fried tofu with basil for appetizers is a must
author: Derek W.

description:
This used to be our go-to Thai restaurant when we are near Polk Street, but I'm afraid to say that we will now go elsewhere. We liked it because the food is good, there doesn't tend to be a wait, and the prices are reasonable. Unfortunately, our last two experiences - which happen to have been accompanied by a coupon - were poor. 

We attempted to use a Restaurant.com coupon here, only to walk in and find that they had tackily posted "Not accepting Restaurant.com coupons" all over the windows and inside the restaurant. Not sure what happened, but when I called the Restaurant.com customer service people, they gave me a credit and said something about how the Modern Thai manager wasn't cooperating....?? We ended up dining there that night anyway, and they gave us a couple of coupons giving us a discount towards our next visit.

We went back to use those coupons last week. The service was prompt, and a bit curt. I turned the coupons in with the bill. The server disappeared with the coupons and bill for 20 minutes, and then returned to tell me that the new policy is that the coupons are only for take-out. I asked the server if she would be willing to honor them partially, at the very least, since this was not indicated on the coupon. She took a measly $2 off our bill, reluctantly, and then failed to give the rest of the coupons back.

Sorry, Modern Thai, we like your food, but you are just a little too sketchy for us. We will not be back.
author: Anne Y.

description: Fantastic setting, great food. Make sure to order the Tom Kah soup...
author: Sean C.

description:
I like this place.  I've been here a couple of times and every time I walk away satisfied.  For appetizers, we ordered the friend calamari which I thought was amazingly good.  Their noodle dishes are also amazing (pad see ew especially) and I really enjoyed their rice dishes.  I'm usually not a thai-curry fan, but I think it's starting to grow on me.  We ordered the green curry here and I thought it was excellent.  

The other added benefit is that it's so close to Playland Bar, McTeagues and Lush Lounge that you can easily grab a drink after a great meal!
author: S R.

description: Solid thai food.  I had the green curry seafood fried rice, and it had some serious spice even though I didn't ask for it.  Good stuff.
author: Chad T.

description: Typical spot for West Coast Grade-A Thai food.  The large portion of duck red curry was not put to waste.  Neither was the coconut water.  Service was very good.  What can I say?  Delicious.  Oh...make sure you check in here!  They will give you a free Thai iced tea.
author: Jeff P.

description:
I love this Thai restaurant in SF!

The service is fine, and the thai food really rocks!

Love their curries, and their appetizers.
author: Christelle C.

description:
On your Yelp listing, you even have a Restaurant.com ad.

We went to have a group dinner at Modern Thai and was quickly taken aback by their large signs stating they do not accept Restaurant.com certificates.  We went there solely to use these certificates and were told our business was not welcome if we plan on using the certificate.  Bad business practice.


I am reporting this to the SF County weights and measures department. You will be fined.
author: Rosie O.

description:
I keep coming back, which means one of three things:
a) I'm dumb.
b) I get free food.
c) I like it.

(a) while true, is not relevant to this yelp review.
(b) is false.
(c) it is. Also, the food's pretty good at a fairly reasonable price.
author: Max R.

description: We ordered crab rangoon, crab fried rice, and red curry delivery via Seamless tonight, first time eating from here. Delivery was quick, right about 40 minutes and food came hot which was great. One downfall, and I am pretty disappointed about it, is that curry doesn't come with rice which I've never heard of - I always assumed it was part of the dish. But the flavor of everything was fantastic and I'd definitely eat here again. Tip to management, just add $1-2 to the curry and have it come with rice so customers don't get surprised.
author: David B.

description: Golden Bags (sounds so wrong but tastes oh-so right!), Chicken Satay, Panang Curry (Sweet mother of curry get the PANANG), and the Crispy Papaya Salad...ALL FOR THE WIN!!!
author: Tessa M.

description: Review for chicken Tom Yum soup. Hands down the best I've ever had. Sour and spicy soup with chicken, mushrooms and lemon grass. This will heal your soul. Must get.
author: Mark C.

description: Great service! Great food!  I will come here again.  This will be one of my new routine restaurants.  Their pad thai is one of the best-very authentic.
author: Peter C.

description: Solid thai place and friendly staff!
author: Sagar G.

description: Ordered for delivery, I got the MT mango entree with Thai iced tea and blueberry roti. Lived the roti, and enjoyed the mango entree as well. Would order from here again
author: Alyssa L.

description:
Service was terrible here. The waitress kept passing by our table but never stopped to pick up the check or refill water to check on us. The place wasn't that busy but it was hard to get their attention. 

Place itself is nicely decorated, quite fancy even though the food is on the cheaper side. Most of the dishes are around ~$10. I got the Green Curry Fried Rice, which is supposed to be "medium spicy" but was really really spicy for me. I couldn't finish and had to take the rest home. 

This place is: meh.
author: Connie C.

description: I love this place! The pumpkin red curry was amazing and the crispy tofu salad was really good- perfect amount of sweet and spice. Also, the pad kee mao was tasty, not too sweet like other places. Food was quick and service was good... very happy with this place!
author: Vinitha R.

description: Best Pad See Ew I've ever had! Some places make it dry and bland, this one the noodles have just the right amount of sauce and it comes with plenty of vegetables. My roommate tried it for the first time this weekend and couldn't believe how good it was! And they bring out your food really fast, even on a Saturday when there was a fair amount of customers. I've been here loads of times and it's good comfort Thai food. Also, the Thai Iced Tea is delicious and comes in a fun glass. Can't beat that!
author: Angela R.

description:
4 stars for the decor, and 4 stars for the food.

If you want a nice sit-down Thai restaurant with takeout prices, this is the place to go.  Came here late on Sunday evening and had the best combination fried rice.  As I live only a block away, Modern Thai has the potential to be a recurring favorite.
author: Kent Q.

description:
The Lemonade Thai Iced Tea is to die for!!!

the food was ok... I've had better though.

One thing I do like about this place is the semi-outdoorsy seating. It's definitely a nice place to take a break from the day and enjoy the weather.... while sipping on a lemonade thai iced tea of course. ;) The lunch specials aren't bad either.
author: Marie T.

description:
Giving Modern Thai an update for how they run their business. We went for a second visit in October, toting our wonderful restaurant.com certificates. On the door they posted no coupons/no certificates as of 9/30/10, but as of earlier that day they were still selling certificates on restuarant.com. I figured we were safe.

Apparently not. They completely ceased honoring certificates, which is strange because I've gone to restaurants that simply stopped issuing new certificates, and they still honored old ones.

We decided to eat there anyway. The food was good overall, as we remembered. While not memorable, it always tasted very fresh. My two young children were with us. You would think it was a quiet Friday night at 8pm, and not an early Sunday evening at 5:30pm, because the other people in the restaurant seemed to stare at us like "how dare you have your kids eating here interrupting our quiet meals." Funny thing was...my kids were very well behaved on that evening and we weren't sitting right next to a bunch of intimate couples or anything. Whatever.

I contacted restaurant.com after our visit (Modern Thai's manager even gave me the phone numbers) and let them what happened. Refusing existing certificates is explicity against restaurant.com policy, and my guess is that if I'm not the only one getting denied by this restaurant that is still open and seemingly hasn't changed ownership, I wouldn't be surprised if they pursue them for fees or whatnot. Needless to say, they could have handled it better.

Will I return without my discounts in tow? Eh. The food was fine, but probably not.
author: James W.

description: Great food but the service can be poor. A little lazy when it comes to service. Would've given them 5 stars otherwise.
author: Mui M.

description:
I really wanted to agree with a lot of these reviews, but perhaps in my single experience there, they were just off.  Doubtful I'll be back to see if they can redeem themselves.
