Ambiance - pretty cool place, indoor/outdoor area, high ceilings.  Music was odd, not sure why romantic latin music was playing, didn't help at all for me.

Service - adequate.  Got my food, nearly no attention otherwise.  Food came out pretty quickly once ordered.

Food - this is where it all fell apart.  Noodle dishes were supposed to be great, so I tried the special, Singaporean Noodles.  Presentation was good, and I had high hopes.  The flavor was not only blah with no spice, but reminded me of the days of ramen packets for dinner.  There were pockets in the noodles where the spice/salt didn't mix and made for a horrible bite.  The noodles were overcooked, and the green onions helped minimally to add something to the dish.  Washed down with a skunked Singha and I was done.

Price - standard price for standard thai, no complaints there.  

Sorry all, this place didn't pan out for me.  And what's with the signs all over saying no restaurant.com coupons?  Didn't affect me, but gave me a second thought.
author: J P.

description:
Good Thai in the Gulch

Not exactly my kind of neighborhood filled with he-women with fake boobs and chronic wailing of fire engines taking off.  However, when the bite hits and I'm suddenly craving some of my fave Pad See Ewe, Modern Thai is the next best thing when I'm out of my neighborhood.

I was running a bit late but starving, so I ran in to pick up my order of Pad Thai and some Penang Curry.  The portions were huge and since these dishes were typical, tastewise they delivered in comparison to my fave Thai place I fell in love with in Noe Valley.

Prices are right and the staff quite friendly.  They are open late, so for a quick order before they close, I would totally recommend this place before having to step over California and walk on the trendier side of Polk where prices go up and so does the snootiness of the clientele.

I can say that.  I'm snooty at times too ;)
author: Miika M.

description: I have been to this restaurant couple of times. It is my favorite restaurant. Some of the dishes need to be improved. Sticky rice were not well cook. Fried tofu not hot and soft enough, feel like eating plastic. Fried coconut shims have not coconut taste at all.
author: snowwhite w.

description:
Be Warned: If you don't like spicy food, this is not the place for you!!!

I ordered the drunken noodles and the ginger tofu dish with brown rice. 
The Brown rice and Drunken noodles are great spicy dish. The ginger tofu, I wasn't really a fan of. This is somewhere in the middle of a list of places in the city I would recommend for thai food. 

Cautions:
1. Order the place mild, if you don't like spicy food.
2. When you get delivery, the guy asked for a tip before I even gave him money.....did not sit well with me.
author: Chirag V.

description: Gave this one another try... I was physically  accosted by the delivery person. I will never ever order again!!!
author: Nana W.

description:
After using Yelp for a few years strictly as a means to identify places I'd like to visit, after my Modern Thai experience, I actually felt strongly enough to join Yelp as a reviewer.

This is because the six of us never got a chance to eat at the restaurant.  We wanted to explore Polk street area over the weekend, and MT seemed like a great option for us to start our night with.  I was very excited when I also found a Restaurant.com $50 certificate for the place, which pretty much sealed the deal in my quest for a dinner spot.  I was very excited and told my friends all about it, made a reservation, etc.

When we showed up for our dinner, as one reviewer stated below, the first thing we noticed was a sign on their front door stating that they do not accept Restaurant.com certificates.  When I tried talking to a server about it, she just said that those were the instructions from their boss and she can't do anything about it.  When we sat down, every menu had the same sign about not accepting the certificates.  Of course, the boss was not on the premises for an explanation.

At this point, we felt that it was complete crap that a restaurant would not honor their own certificates that, mind you, are not FREE.  To me, that is not a good way to do business.  Their suggestion to me was to take it up with Restaurant.com.  Well, had I known that, I wouldn't have bought it in the first place, and now wouldn't have to waste my time calling their customer service and figuing out how to get a refund.  Needless to say, after all of that, we did not even feel like staying there, but instead, took our business to a nice Italian restaurant down the street.

Way NOT to do good business Modern Thai!  I will not be back.  Plenty of other good Thai restaurants in the city.  Moreover, you lost the business of six people that know how to tip well.

Now, back to trying to figure out how to get a refund, which judging by the fact that neither my phone call nor email to Restaurant.com customer service has been returned yet, will prove to be not such an easy endeavor after all.  Sigh.
author: Marina S.

description:
I was introduced to Modern Thai by a friend who spoke highly of the restaurant.  We showed up about an hour before closing time.  The atmosphere and decor of the place is impressive, affirming 'Modern Thai' as an appropriate name.  I've never been to a Thai restaurant as upscale as this one.  Tablecloth, fabric napkins, candles on each table, etc...

The customer service was great and the menu items included a variety of dishes catering to anyone.  With that said, a lot of the options were not traditional Thai dishes.  Instead they were spin-offs of traditional recipes.  Nonetheless, the restaurant is called "Modern Thai," and as a result, I don't regard this as a negative aspect.

Why did I rate it as a two star?  Because I ordered Pad Thai, and what I received was, to be blunt, the worst Pad Thai i've ever had.  Let me explain.

When the dish was placed in front of me, I was blown away by the presentation.  It was the best 'looking' Pad Thai i've ever seen.  Unfortunately it was all downhill after that.

To start off, there was WAY too much peanut sauce.  Don't get me wrong, peanut sauce is great, but let me explain.  Pad Thai is NOT supposed to have peanut sauce PERIOD.  It should have had fish sauce and, in most cases, crushed peanuts.  What I received was a Pad Thai with no fish sauce at all, but instead smothered in peanut sauce AND crushed peanuts.  I wouldn't have been surprised if Mr. Planter himself was the chef in the kitchen.

Second, this was the mildest Pad Thai i've ever had. It was so minimally seasoned, I didn't even feel a bead of sweat form. It's as if there weren't any red chili peppers whatsoever. On a positive note, the other flavors of the dish were quite noticeable, tasting fresh and of good quality.  Alas, some key ingredients were absent to the palette.  The eggs, bean sprouts, and tofu were definitely present, but I tasted a lack of other key Pad Thai ingredients, most notably coriander and lime.

Lastly, and most unfortunate, because of all that peanut sauce, I had the feeling of being 'full' after about 4 bites. I tried to press on but just ended up feeling sick.  Quite a disappointment.

To Modern Thai's defense, I will give them the benefit of the doubt and eat there again.  After all, I arrived an hour before closing time.  Perhaps they were out of the missing ingredients, or purposely screwed up my meal in anger.  Regardless, it's very disappointing to eat at a Thai restaurant incapable of making a proper Pad Thai.
author: Alex S.

description:
I've eaten here a couple of times in the past few years and I've ordered the take-out. Yet, I've never yelped it.  So, today is a MOMENTOUS occasion.

The menu is very inexpensive for really good, fresh food.  There is a large menu to choose from including House Specialties, Noodle plates, Rice plates, Salads and Soups.  

They have a great lunch special before 3 PM of $7.95 for any dish and $13.95 for appetizer, soup, entree AND beverage.  

Today, I opted for MY FAVORITE comfort foods a la cart, and not off of the lunch specials menu, from Thai restaurants:

Chicken coconut milk soup (tom kha soup on some thai menus) - it gives a combo of SWEET and SOUR.  It has mushrooms, tomato, a hint of basil and tastes tangy and comforting if you cannot handle HOT thai chili spicy (but if you like Thai Spicy, then try the TOM YUM SOUP).

Roasted Duck Salad (LARB) - my ULTIMATE favorite quicky Thai dish.  Yet, I must say the roasted duck here lacks flavor and is MOSTLY fat.  I prefer the roasted duck larb at Thai House Express :'( b/c the skin here is not crispy, it is very soft and squishy.

The service is so very nice and not OVERLY attentive, so you can enjoy your meal in peace.  

I recommend this place for a quick lunch or a inexpensive, yet filling, dinner.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
I was hesitant to try this place, based on the some of the reviews, but it was a grubhub-or-go-hungry kind of night, and I was sick of pizza and indian food. I wish I had gone hungry. I only managed one bite of the papaya salad, which tasted like the way a tide pool on a hot day smells. The drunken noodles with chicken was a slimy, gooey mess (I had read about the "single blob of noodles" and this was the same), and the chicken tasted fishy. It was so greasy I was having trouble swallowing after 2 or 3 bites. The only thing that was decent (but barely so) were the chicken skewers, but I'm not giving an extra star because any man, woman, child or restaurant ought to be able to grill a plain piece of chicken.

Because I'm from the south, I can't just post this without finding something positive to say as well, so... The delivery was really fast, 25 minutes when grubhub had estimated 55.
author: Katie P.

description:
People, people. I understand your frustration (most Yelpers have been there, too), but this is not really the place to complain about Restaurant.com issues. And it doesn't seem fair for an issue that may not even be the restaurant's fault to bring down the ratings of their food and service.

And so I un-lurk...

Not only is Modern Thai delicious, but the staff is consistently warm, yet professional (delivery guys included) and you can almost always get a seat quickly. We all have bad days, but this is a good place.

Next time you're in my hood, check it out for yourself. The chicken wings, eggplant (with beef), pad kee mao (drunken noodle), pumpkin curry and brown rice are my faves, but I've never had anything that wasn't tasty. And you can handle full price; it's cheap!
author: Georgeanna S.

description:
I don't understand why this place continues to advertise their Restaurant.com affiliation on Yelp if they longer accept the coupons???

I was rather disappointed when I drove 35 minutes into the city to try this place out due to the fact that I had a coupon.  Upon walking in, they had signs plastered all over the place that indicated that they were no longer accepting the Restaurant.com certificates.  Ok.. fine... since I was already there, I decided to stay and eat anyways.  Sure beats trying to find parking again in the city.

We asked the waitress why they were no longer accepting coupons.  Her reply was that they cancelled their membership with Restaurant.com, but the site has neglected to take down their restaurant from the list.  Although I wasn't happy with her answer, I was content and decided no to hold a grudge against them for something that probably wasn't their fault. 

With the three of us, we ordered a few dishes.

- Chicken wings ginger sauce - Chicken was ok.  Nothing to rave about.
- Beef sirloin salad - I didn't enjoy this too much. The beef was tough to chew and the dressing on the salad was kind of blah.
- Chicken Pad See-Ew - This noodle dish was the best out of everything we ate.  Although the flavors could have been a little sweeter, I was happy with this dish.
- Crab fried rice - All rice and not much crab.  For the price.. I could have had this dish much better somewhere else.

Overall, my experience here wasn't too great on the first try.  Maybe they were just having an off day.  Don't know.  But Yelpers please note... if you plan to go here with a Restaurant.com certificate.. please think twice because they no longer accept it.  I guess this would be a good place to visit if you live nearby the area... but if you had to drive there from somewhere farther.. it's probably not worth it.
author: Vindy C.

description:
I actually really like the food here and have been several times; however, I'm going with the rating of "A-OK" because I just can't get excited about the ambiance, the service, or, the wine.  I usually go with a tofu dish - had the eggplant and tofu with a side or rice last night....it's always delicious.  Also tried the pineapple salmon curry last night for the first time.  It was quite tasty, but the salmon was pretty well done and a bit tough.  They don't give you a knife as a regular course of action here, but for this dish, I specifically requested one after my elbow got a bit tired from mashing the side of my fork back and forth to get to each bite.

This place is very reasonably priced, consistently nice flavored dishes, and it is clean environment, full of bright colors (each wall is painted a different neon shade).  On the other hand, there always seems to be something a touch depressing about the place when I'm eating there.  Will keep coming for well priced food, I'd suggest beer or soda over the wines though, and if you live in the neighborhood, I think it's a fantastic regular option for take out!
author: Janelle C.

description: I'm torn because I love and hate this place at the same time. The food is excellent. It just took 45 mins for us to receive the meal. Yes I was a little upset by this but I have to tell you honestly the quality of the food made the wait worth my while just this once. Every time a fried suggests we go here and it is a weekend evening, I decline if I'm already hungry. I suggest going on an early weekday to avoid the incredible rush that occurs on popular nights.
author: Davida B.

description: Nice place, friendly staff.  Easy walk in the Tenderloin district, and easy to find.  Nothing fancy, but good food.  I would go back.
author: Matthew B.

description: Very nice ambiance!  The Kaprow was pretty good and the chicken satay was juicy!  Thai ice tea with a checkin!!!
author: Akiliano T.

description:
I have probably ordered Modern Thai once every other week, if not every week, for the past 2 years...and yet I realized I haven't written a review! Every once and a while I will stray and try another Thai place in the area, but I inevitably just keep coming back here. VERY quick delivery. I live 10 blocks away and they literally show up in 10-45 minutes, average under 20 minutes, so if I'm hungry and want food ASAP this is my go to. Even with substitutions they're super quick. And they give us coupons for next time! 

The usual (all with chicken) is:

1. Thai fried rice - better than anywhere else I've tried

2. Drunken noodle - perfect amount of spiciness & veggies

3. Red curry - substitute the eggplant for broccoli and it's the best curry ever tasted, not all watery (like Thai Spice's..)

One minor complaint is their shrimp is a bit chewy, so I tend to stick with chicken. They are super accomodating though - Panang Curry wasn't on the menu and they made it special for us and it was just as amazing as everything else. 

I've also eaten in the restaurant, which is an awesome airy space with a semi-outdoor patio area. Lunch deals are great, and they are always full but there's never a line for a table at dinner even on the weekend. They were super-friendly one time we sent back a bottle of wine (think it had gone bad), and brought us a new bottle AND gave us 2 free glasses of another wine that they were "testing" for the menu. 

I highly recommend takeout, delivery, lunch, dinner, drinks etc!
author: Natalie H.

description:
Gross food, lame service, wouldn't accept coupon. 

We went there with a Restaurant.com gift certificate and the first thing we saw when we walked in the place were (what felt like) hundreds of paper signs taped on the walls indicating they don't accept the coupons any more. Lame. Why? They wouldn't tell us. A server just said there were problems, or something vague.

Starving, we sat down anyway - we received menus (which of course had the No Coupon notice tapped to them) and ordered Tom Kai, Pad Kee Mau, and a Green Papaya Salad - pretty much what we always order at Thai restaurants. They all were gross. The salad had WAY too much fish sauce, the soup had a funky spoiled taste and the Pad Kee Mau was served atop lettuce leaves. Umm, who puts a steaming plate of noodles on fresh salad? Needless to say the salad was wilted beyond belief. 

The only mildly decent parts? They have brown rice and didn't mess up a Thai iced tea.
author: Catherine C.

description: 4.5 stars!  My friends introduced me to this place (I had seen it while walking around before but never went inside).  So many yummy food choices and very reasonable prices.  I got the non-fried spring rolls app and the drunken noodles with chicken - yuhhhmmy!  Even better as leftovers later.  Nice, attentive service, water glasses and tea filled regularly.  Loved it - I will definitely be back!!
author: Maile N.

description:
Not bad! Not bad at all.

I came here with a friend for dinner. He raves about this place and told me I had to come. Considering that Thai food is one of my favorite foods, it really isn't too hard to get me to go.

Service was pretty good. We walked in and were seated immediately. The waitress gave us enough time to pick and choose, as well as converse.

I ended up ordering the yellow curry, which is a bit of a staple for me. Soooo good. It was kinda cold outside and it was perfect for filling my soul. I also had a cold and the spice was perfect for me trying to get over it (somehow this cold made me eat a lot of spicy food). I cant remember what my friend got, but it was something with nuts and was also very very good.

So excited to have this place in my hood! Will be coming back.
author: Diana R.

description:
I love Modern Thai.  I notice a few negative reviews which honestly hurts my feelings a little.  My husband and I have been going here since they first opened and we lived a few blocks away.  Now we live in San Mateo Co. but still come here whenever we are in SF.  The restaurant itself is in a cool space and I love the decor.  The food is great too.  We always get the basil tofu appetizer, it is so good!!!! I've tried to order similar dishes at other Thai restaurants but this is the best.  I often get Pineapple Fried Rice which is also amazing!  Again, it's heads above other restaurants.  My husband (who is Thai btw) gets Pad Se Ew (hope I'm spelling it right) usually and it is always very flavorful.  Last time we were there, I got a special salmon curry that was so freakin' good.  

This place is not your ordinary Thai place, they really take pride in providing great food in a cool atmosphere.  I LOVE IT!
author: Sam N.

description:
I was very pleased with their food! :)

MUST HAVE IS THE COCONUT CHICKEN SOUP!! :)
author: Callie S.

description:
I came here with a group and we ended up sharing some dishes. One dish I wish I had all to myself were the spring rolls.  I am dreaming about the spring rolls. I really need them. 

I like that I was able to find simple dishes with healthy brown rice.  Loved the chicken and basil.  There is a beverage happy hour where drinks are 1/2 price. The Thai ice tea lemonade is addicting also. 

Service was attentive and take out containers were provided gladly. I will be back.
author: Infodiva B.

description: The pumpkin dishes here are great. I actually tried some of the pumpkin curry and ordered the spicy pumpkin entree. Both came with large chunks of pumpkin, which I was a huge fan of given that I love all things pumpkin.
author: Greg D.

description: Excellent. Nice on a weekday evening. Loved the mango curry. Balue and flavor much better than I remembered. I'd vote it most improved!
author: t k.

description:
Out looking for a restaurant for lunch, we met an friendly Samaritan on Polk who quickly recommended us 7 or 8 restaurants, each accompanied by yelp-like reviews and detailed instructions of how to get there. She was herself off to have lunch at some Thai place. After she took off, we realized we couldn't really remember anything she told us, and decided to follow her to her favorite Thai joint. But we lost track of her very quickly and found ourselves standing in front of Modern Thai, which we decided to enter in to.

A large clean place with wide windows and lots of light. Justifies its name through an almost aggressive omission of the usual thai-restaurant tropes (photographs of the royal family, etc). 

Good service, but the food was merely ok. Two of us chose the duck lychee curry based on a review pasted on the menu. An interesting idea, not a run-away success. Decent tom-kha and tom-yum soup and all that. The drunken noodle was rather on the heavy side.
author: Bangali K.

description:
I recently returned here after a more-than-one-year hiatus (for no particular reason other than convenience) after reading a strong and stealthy update from my beloved and befamed Yelper Marsha Z. Unfortunately, I did not discover the same satisfactions that Ms. Z did in her recent re-acquaintance nor did I embrace those highs I've enjoyed in the past. 

The salad was off-the-hook. We started with a tofu cashew salad. It was crazy yum. The fresh spring rolls were good -- even better than I remember (though my memories of the fresh rolls here weren't memorable). It was in the entree department that Modern Thai suffered, and man -- let me tell you -- it suffered pretty bad.  Without fail -- out of the ten or fifteen times I've dined at Modern Thai -- these entrees were the very worst.

To clarify, the ingredients are fresh and crisp. They represented on that, but the flavors were not present. Unconscious, really. The Basil Tofu -- the Ka Prow -- was anything but basily. The tofu on this latest occasion wasn't fried (it should have been, and has been in the past), and while the dish is normally spicy, this wasn't. Oddly, I had asked for it spicy, but instead of using real peppers, they only used a paste. My girlfriend, in contrast, ordered the tofu vegetable with cashew nuts -- which was better than the ka prow -- and she got dried hot peppers in her dish even though tofu cashew is not known to be (or supposed to be) spicy. No, it wasn't a mix-up. She didn't necessarily find her dish spicy; I'm simply saying that my dish would have been better with those peppers rather than those canned pastes.

It's not as if this was my first exposure to ka prow at Modern Thai. No sirree. I've ordered it numerous times in the past. This was, undoubtedly, the worst. It wasn't good -- but not in the way of a crappy Thai msg-laden place with substandard ingredients. It wasn't good in that the beauty of the execution so evident in the tofu-cashew salad with the delicate balance among the sweet, the salty, and the spicy simply wasn't present. Neither mine nor my girlfriend's. 

I wouldn't say that this will be my last time to Modern Thai. I'll give it another chance.  Perhaps tonight was off in the entree department?  It's hard to fathom because the salad was spectacular. I have liked the curries at Modern Thai in the past, but in my vigilance to avoid MSG, I was instructed by the waitress to not order a curry which is prepared from pre-made curry paste. 

Note that Modern Thai is no longer open until 3a on weekends. How I loved those days. Instead, it closes at 10:30p on weekdays and 11:30p on Fridays and Saturdays. Last order is fifteen minutes before closing and for takeout only.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description:
Why oh why did I not read the yelp reviews!?!?  I was excited to try this place w/ my restaurants.com $25 coupon and was unpleasantly surprised when the restaurant indicated that they were no longer accepting the coupon.

That aside, we decided to still dine there in hopes that it was still a worthwhile try.  Wrong!!! 

1.  Ordered the duck lychee curry (sounded very interesting and have never seen it in any other thai menu) but was disappointed when we were served a few lychees w/ duck skin w/ fat and practically no meat!  A rip off for $14.95!!
2.  Pad thai was too sweet - not authentic.
3.  Beef w/ red curry and pumpkin - there was pumpkin but not much.
4. Chicken eggplant - ok, but have had better.

Service -  the waitress was distinctly unfriendly with a hurry-up-and-order  style.  

All in all, we were VERY disappointed and felt suckered to try this place w/ a coupon when there were sooooooooo many better choices in SF.  What a bummer.  Would NOT recommend.
author: FoodJunkie S.

description:
Hands down the best Thai food I have ever had! Everything is fresh! Their Yellow curry noodles are to die for! V Rolls are freshly made.

Brought my boyfriend and his friends their when they come down and they agree...it's the best!

Service is slower than I would like, but if you have the time, it is worth every minute of the wait!
author: Jamie Y.

description: The pad ke maw special is excellent with the mung bean noodles. I haven't had it like this before anywhere. After feeling disappointed with a lot of Thai place tried in SF. I have a new found hope for Thai food here. Will definitely come back here to eat.
author: H H.

description: Food and service were decent but nothing exceptional. The place was really quiet but perhaps it's normally like that on a week night.
author: P H.

description:
It's my fault. I should have taken a closer look.

How did 2 entrees and rice come to $29?


Pad See Ew -- fair
Red Pumpkin Curry with duck -- fair


It's an interesting idea: Modern. Then why not make it "modern"? Do something different, intriguing.

It was standard Thai food. Considering the neighborhood, there's better places to choose from. Either make it really inexpensive or make it different.
author: Yasi S.

description: Came here with my husband last weekend.  We had spent the day moving in to our new apartment and by 8pm, we were starved.  I had to convince him to eat here as his #1 complaint about Thai is small portion sizes.  It is close to our apartment and there was no wait, so he went for it.  Servers were very nice and attentive.  Portion sizes were actually good - big enough for my ravenous hubby! Dinners tasted good - not crazy salty but still yummy flavors.  Will definitely return!
author: Meaghan P.

description: I ordered this off grubhub. I was starving at the time and immediately chose the red curry with duck and lychees from the "most popular dishes" section. If I had scrolled down to look at individual curries, I would've seen that none of them come with rice. But I didn't, so I got a large tub of curry with no rice delivered to my hotel room. I wasn't sure what to do with it, but decided on trying my best with a spoon and plastic fork and went for the duck. The duck was weird, though -- it seemed very fatty and it looked like weird pieces. Maybe I'm normally distracted by all the rice, or maybe it was subpar duck. The curry itself was good, but my curry and a spring roll appetizer was almost $40 and I was still hungry after picking out the good pieces of duck, and on top of that (!), my daily travel dinner limit from work had been reached. I'd probably try something else next time, although maybe curry with a few adjustments would be good.
author: Elizabeth Y.

description: It was a beautiful sunny day and decided to walk my dog on Polk.  Before i knew it, I was getting hungry.  So I was just going to order food to go, but then I saw the charming sun room.  And thought, the worse thing they could say is no... so I asked if I could sit there with my dog.  I was so happy that they were cool with it.  I like the overall decor and customer service was great which would deserve at least 4 stars.  But the food was just ok.  I ordered the Pad See Ew with beef and spring roll.  I didn't care for the spring roll... it was pretty tasteless.  The Pad See Ew was decent.  I would definitely be back to check out the other dishes.
author: Myra M.

description: Overpriced. Bland food, painfully inept service. Will not be returning unless it is under pain of death.
author: Dusty P.

description:
OH MY GOD!  If you had 6 starsssss, you'd get it Modern Thai!
After being away from SF city & stuck in the OC for 6 years & after eating this meal, I know I was Baack!  (thank you Mike - I will always count on you)

Plus - Good wine list (yes I said it).  When I go out for Thai they must have good pairings & I wasn't disappointed.  Great staff; they got my jokes.  Rice was puuurrrfect.  Pumpkin appetizer good.  Vegi items great.  I had the chicken red curry special (it needed more spice - but that's me).

Plus Plus - Great location (worrisome parking).  A great local joint!
author: Lisa J.

description:
This place just might be the love of my life as far as Thai food goes. It's quite possibly the BEST Thai food I have ever eaten... and I've had my fair share of Thai food. I love the yellow curry with tofu and vegetables and the Pra Ram tofu. My friends love the pumpkin curry and their Thai ice tea is pretty delicious, too.  I've never been disappointed by a dish at this restaurant! So good! 

In a neighborhood with several Thai food choices, this is my #1 go-to location when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Stacy B.

description:
I have only ever ordered delivery from here, but I have yet to be disappointed.  You can even order online, which is nice when I am feeling anti-social, and generally leads to a more accurate order completion.

Someday I'll get un-lazy and go to the actual restaurant...
author: Allison D.

description:
I went in today for the first time because I was in the neighborhood, it looked clean and I love Thai food. All good reasons. Reasons I won't go likely go back:

1. The spicy basil chicken noodle dish was lame. Steamed flat noodles require a sauce thick enough to bring it all together. What I got was a flavorless mound of noodles atop a thin watery sauce. Blech.

2. I ordered it off the lunch special menu but there was nothing special about it. No little salad or cup of soup to go with it - just a pile of soggy noodles. Lame.

3. The so-called lunch special was a hefty $7.95, exactly one dollar less than the dinner rate. I would have been happy to pay it if it had come as a smaller portion with a little sumpin extra. Alas, way lame and expensive.

4. About 5 mins into my visit they cranked up the house music... as in 'unka-unka-unka-woot-woot unka-unka-woot-woot' Gold's gay gym steam room kinda house music. If I'm high enough to enjoy that music, I sure as shit won't be hungry enough to eat. This alone is reason to stay clear. 

Why did I give them an second star? Because the green beans amid the fray were fresh and crispy, the heat of the spice was spot on, the place was clean, and the portion I did eat didn't disturb my intestinal tract. I imagine they have potential, but there are too many other good Thai places in SF for me to give them another try.
author: Prattle P.

description: ordered the beef curry and there was a lot more vegetables than meat. not my thing. but overall the food was good.
author: Frances-Danielle G.

description:
They should rename "Duck Red Curry with Lychee" (or whatever it's now called) to "Lychees and Heirloom Tomatoes in Red Curry Sauce with a Dash of Duck".

On the bright side, the ube (purple yam) and coconut ice cream with bits of coconut jelly and jackfruit was excellent. On the dark side, this dessert was outsourced.

The venue is big and airy but the color scheme's off.

Fast and courteous service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
My love for Thai has waned over the past couple of years when I was a more regular reviewer on a mission to hit just about every Thai restaurant I could, but Modern Thai has always been consistent in serving excellent food.  Their brown rice is dark and nuttier (and is served in a heart shape formation, aww), and my staple dish, pra ram, is always full of delicious vegetables, fried tofu, and a generous splattering of thick peanut sauce.  I still get cravings for it once in awhile, and it never lets me down.

Their menu has slowly expanded; their dessert menu is now a booklet (see previous update for suggestions). 

The service, whether dining in or out, has also always been prompt and friendly.

It's within walking distance (all the better for me), and has become a delightful meeting spot for one of my dear friends when we want to play catch up.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Some of the best Thai food to be had on the West Coast, with extremely polite servers, very moderate prices, and very nice atmosphere.  Go there.  Neighborhood sucks a little, but if this place was in a better location, you would pay more.

I have taken out of towners to this place, and they have stated "you cannot buy Thai food in Boston any where near this good at ANY price."  When the bill comes, considering the quality of the food and the wonderful ambiance, you will be pleasantly surprised.

One of SF's restaurant gems.
author: Joe S.

description:
Hands down the best Thai restaurant I've ever been to. I had their Tofu Salad which was really tasty (despite my dislike of tofu), and their Beef Pad Thai was delicious. 

In terms of drinks, my friend and I got Thai Iced Teas (he'd never had one and I love them). They were quite good, not as amazing as at a place I know in Portland, but still four stars. 

The waitress, noticing I liked the drink, offered me a free Thai Iced Tea Lemonade, which she said was on the menu but most people weren't familiar with it. I have four words for you: You Must Order This! 

For dessert I ordered the Creme Brulee and my friend got the Fried Banana.  It was okay but the banana was amazing, and the waitress was happy to give me my own banana for free. If the Iced Tea Lemonade was good, that Fried Banana was equally incredible. 

I'm a pretty skinny guy who doesn't usually eat everything on his plate. I left this place absolutely stuffed, amazed I had enough room for the entire fried banana. I will absolutely go back the next time i'm in SF. 

The food at this place is enough to get me to drive into San Francisco (it's not near BART), and I hate driving into the city for anything. Suffice it to say that I envy all of you who live within walking distance.
author: Chris N.

description: Wow. This was some of the worst service I've ever had matched with the sub par food made this a place I don't need to ever go back to again. Doubles charges on our bill and mid-charges to boot make me want to punch babies and spit in eyeballs.
author: Dutch G.

description: Food is good, if they get your order right. Pricing isn't very good. They are EXTREMELY cheap with rice. Their double serving of rice is a single serving at most places -- not to mention many places serve rice WITH your meal. Staff are unfriendly and don't have much of a grip on the English language. They screwed up a delivery order I placed online, and didn't want to admit their mistake until shown the confirmation e-mail showing what I actually ordered. They brought green curry instead of yellow curry; green curry is substantially spicier and was essentially inedible to me. They insisted on being shown the mistaken food, and didn't bring complete replacement food, either. Even when I specifically requested a new order of rice for my curry, they didn't bring one. After two highly unsatisfactory experiences in a row, I won't be back.
author: Matthew M.

description:
During my recent trip to San Francisco, I had a meal punch list and Thai was near the top.  When we were yelping around for dinner one Thursday evening - Modern Thai surfaced.  After reviewing their menu, we decided this was the place to hit given the glowing positive reviews.  

When we arrived, they noticed they had a really nice enclosed "outdoor" space but given the winds that day, it would have been quite chilly so we sat inside.   

We ordered Calamari as an appetizer and it was not bad - a slight bit just too chewy for my tastes.  We also selected the Crispy Pumpkin slices which were cooked in sesame seed and coconut butter - quite tasty!   I also sampled the Fresh Spring Rolls and they were also good - well above par!   

For the main course, I ordered the Pad Kee Mao (Mung Bean Noodles).  This was a combination which have not seen before on the many Thai establishments I've visited.  Overall the texture, with the ground chicken, calamari, shrimp and mung bean noodles was interesting. It was not too heavy on any one item - nice balance of meats and basil!  

When returning, I will likely limit myself to 1 appetizer and then the main entree. We boxed at least 1/2 of these dishes for home.  The portions were generous so getting 2 or 3 meals from an entree with a bit of rice is easy. 

Because I checked in using Yelp, I also got a Thai Iced Tea at no charge - that was a nice treat.

Our service was good.  We were there on a TH well before the crowds normally arrive.  When we were leaving around 19:30, the place had gone from just us to 7 or 8 other tables.  

Overall - the Modern Thai serves a well executed meal without being overpriced.  I'm returning the next time I'm in San Fran.
author: G M.

description:
I'm such a huge fan of Modern Thai! The food is excellent - I highly recommend the pumpkin curry, coconut green curry, and Thai basil. It's 2 in the morning as I'm writing this, and my stomach is grumbling just thinking about the deliciousness that is Modern Thai.

The ambiance is cute - everything matches their mint green theme. A nice place for a first date or dinner with a friend! The service is prompt and friendly, and they also play good music. I was contemplating asking the waitress if it might be possible for me to get a copy of the list of songs they were playing, but I thought that would be a little weird so I refrained.

The lunch special is also fabulous, so check it out if you want a fast, fresh, DELICIOUS Thai meal for lunch. They also deliver nearby so if you live around there, lucky you.
author: Amy D.

description:
I ordered delivery from Modern Thai on Friday evening, May 24. Unfortunately, the delivery never arrived. I called and the restaurant said they didn't receive the order, although my card was charged. They are refunding the charge.

The person I spoke with was apologetic and polite, but clearly the restaurant needs to fix its online ordering system.
author: E S.

description:
I bought a $25 gift certificate for Modern Thai on restaurants.com because it had 4 stars on Yelp. Big mistake.

The place is clean and the staff is friendly, but the food and length of wait was very questionable. We ordered chicken satay, tom kha soup, red mango curry and the king crab pad thai.

Then we waited. And waited. And waited. This was on a night that was barely 1/3 full. Finally, our tom kha soup came. It was fantastic, but unfortunately would later prove to be the best dish of the night. We waited about another 15 minutes before another dish came out - but it was our entrees, not our appetizer! We asked the waitress about the chicken satay and she had forgotten to put the order in.

Onto the entrees. The red mango curry itself was fine, but the beef in it was super chewy and tough. Yuck. The rice came molded into a heart shape, so that was cute. My pad thai was awful. It was undercooked of all things! I literally had to chew through the noodles with my front teeth, sawing a bit to get through it. After a few bites, we left the pad thai alone.

About halfway through our entrees, the chicken satay came. We weren't hungry anymore at this point.

Yeah, so I was completely underwhelmed by this place and given that it's a few blocks from amazing and way cheaper Thai places in the TL, I would suggest not coming here.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Not sure what is so modern about this place, unless you consider neon modern. Neon walls. Neon accents on the uniforms. Lots and lots of neon. Don't hold it again them.

Because once you move past the colors, you get good food. In my case, a generous serving of chicken and pumpkin in a delicious curry.

Color was kind of neon, but let's just say it goes with the theme.
author: Jason B.

description: I like the food here, good service. I wasn't impress with the green curry stews, they need to thicken it up, it was very runny n sauce was weak. Everything we had was terrific, duck special, Thai fried rice , string bean seafood.  I like the level of spiceyness, pretty spicey! Will definateley come back soon!
author: Demanding T.

description:
Stumbled on to Modern Thai because it was near my hotel and looked interesting.  What a pleasant surprise!

I arrived early because I had skipped lunch due to a late flight.  The decor was very inviting and staff very attentive.  I started out with the pumpkin crisps appetizer and a nice glass of Cabernet.  For an entree I had the Yellow Sea and was very impressed.  I wouldn't say this is the most authentic Thai, but for the name "modern Thai" I would say it was great!
author: Chris M.

description: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! I ordered yellow curry (DO NOT EVER GET)  when the food got to me it was green curry. I called to have them bring me the right one and instead they argued with me for 20 mins about how they were right and I was wrong. I paid almost 40 dollars and the manager acted like I was trying to rip them off rather than attempt to fix the situation. Instead of refunding me only the yellow curry (NOT THE REST OF MY ORDER THAT WAS CORRECT)  they told me "YOURE WRONG. SO NO" WORST PLACE EVER!!!!!! IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE A NEGATIVE RATING I WOULD
author: Jesse S.

description:
Great, great food. Really enjoyed their fish.

The service messed up the bill though, which prevents me from giving them 5 stars.
author: Eric F.

description: Best thai in the city hands down. My boyfriend and I love this place and get delivery from there frequently. Their pumpkin curry is delicious and they have the best mango sticky rice.  It's a little more expensive than other thai places but the quality and proportions are well worth it. I love this place and it has made me have a love for thai food! Soooo good!
author: Callie O.

description:
I've been here multiple times and the food has always been delicious.  Of all the Thai places I've been to in the city (and there are plenty of them), this is easily in the top 2.  The restaurant is nice and clean, the staff are friendly, and the food tastes great.  And on top of all that, it's super cheap, especially compared to what some other "upscale" places charge.

If you like great Thai food in a nice setting for a good price, it doesn't get much better than this.
author: Matt N.

description:
stumbled here the other night for some good pad Thai. Ordered their pad Thai with tofu and pumpkin curry with chicken. Both were delicious. I ordered a glass of their malbec which was pretty gross, but improved with food. 

I have a sneaking suspicion that the owners are the same as osha, but can't confirm it. The Osha pins the staff wore tipped us off.. but no one can be sure...   :P
author: Analisa S.

description: THEY DELIVER and it's GREAT!  I usually order $50's worth of food and kept it in my fridge all weekend when I was recovering from a hard work week of eating and drinking.  The food is great and I love their sweet sticky rice with mangos.  Did I mention that they DELIVER and it's GREAT?!?  Extra star for their fast delivery!
author: Suz L.

description:
One of the best Thai places I've been to.

I came here with some family that was visiting from New York City. We were in San Francisco and came across this quaint little restaurant. The decor was very colorful and Ikea-ish.

We had the Pumpkin Curry and Mango Curry, and also a spicy shrimp dish with Basil. My favorite must be the Beef Larb salad. It was so flavorful and packed with a punch. The spicyness was just right and it was tangy and aromatic.

I was very satisfied with this place, and the service was super-friendly. Have been trying to come back to this place!
author: Mendy _.

description: This has the best pumpkin curry I have had in a long time. It also has pretty nice ambiance, so you should hit this up if you are in the area.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
I was really impressed with this place. This is actually the second time i came here, The first time (unfortunately) was not impressive. However, i like to give it a second try. This time, i came for lunch with a friend, and we went burske! We ordered, two lunch items, and had to have dessert. Realizing our similarites for the love of dessert, we ordered the fried banana, and blueberry roti.. YUM!
Also, the not just the regular pad thai, but the u-don (chicken) pad thai.. yum! 
So my impression of this place upon giving it a second chance, it was 
D-E-L-I-O-U-S.....
author: Monika T.

description: Rude delivery people. If you dont/won't simply say thank you when someone gives you a generous tip, then please understand i wont be ordering from your restaurant again.
author: Kevin G.

description: Found this place on yelp when I was visiting the city! Amazing food lots of flavor. Def would recommend it to anyone who like Thai good.
author: Rachel M.

description: the pumkin curry is a must try!!!! I also really like the coconut shrimp skewers
author: Annette E.

description: This restaurant is close to where we live, so we decided to come here after reading all the great reviews.  The food was good, yes, but I wouldn't return because of the service or lack thereof.  Hubby and I walked into the main dining area.  There were several waitstaff walking around, all looked at us but none came over to help seat us.  This went on for at least 5 minutes, and we were able to leave when a waitress came over and finally seated us without a smile.  After that, two people came by to take our drink order but neither one of them actually brought our drinks until we asked for them.  Our entrees didn't arrive at the same time, and our appetizer was the last dish brought to our table.  I would've recommended take out to avoid the bad service, but I don't have any confidence that they'd get your order right.
author: Julie P.

description: Food was good. I like the fried pumpkin a lot. It tasted so good with the sauce. Beef larb was good too, not too spicy and the amount of onion was just right. Roasted duck and lychee curry was interesting and I would order it again but it's not something I would crave for. Also tried the Thai sake and the raspberry sake-mosa. Both are just ok, not something I would order again. Next time I want to try their pumpkin curry or mango curry.
author: J L.

description:
Just next door or so to Lush Lounge, I personally thought Modern Thai was pretty good. I liked the high ceilings, the clean white of the walls which contrasted nicely with the dark wood tables and chairs. So decor was definitely pleasant.

I was surprised to find it pretty empty though. No matter, our group of 6 didn't want to travel far and we were easily able to be seated here.

We shared a few dishes:
- Tom Kai Soup: tangy clear broth with tomatoes, mushrooms, and lemongrass undertones. I like how it was served in a modern square bowl. Maybe it was the inspiration to the restaurant name.
- Pad Thai with Chicken: pretty basic. Not an overly big portion but filling. The noodles didn't stick together so that's a good sign.
- Pineapple Fried Rice: one of my favorite dishes, this was nicely prepared with cashew nut and light raisin inclusions. Yum.
- Pumpkin Chicken Curry: sweet with nice soft mushy chunks of pumpkin and soft pieces of chicken too.

Dishes averaged about $8. I found it to be decent food at a decent value. My friends disagreed but I thought overall it was a nice place to grab a last minute meal. Besides, they have nice dishes.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Best thai place in sf, in my opinion!

heart this place.

awesome veg options. def recommend their curries! also, the crispy tofu salad is legit.

+ great service, excellent atmosphere, hilarious music choices, sweet lunch menu, rice that comes in the shape of a heart...

what more could you ask for?
author: Jennifer S.

description:
We were headed to 'Crustacean's' ....it was going to be a 2 hour wait, and we probably weren't dressed up enough for that. So, we wandered down the street, 'Yelped', and found 'Modern Thai'. 
   It is a nice little restaurant. The appetizer was a combo that was hit and miss. Golden Basket....looked incredible, tasted ok.
            Fried Tofu...it's fried tofu, so it only matters what you put on it.
                                 Sauces:    Satay sauce...good.
                                                    Cucumber salad....good, but not as flavorful
                                                                                       as I'm used to.
                                                     Sweet Chili sauce....good.
           Satay....Delicious!
           Fried Sping Rolls....good, but don't remember much about them.

   Next, on to the entree. I had been looking for Som Tam (Papaya salad) all week long. Wow! This is the best Som Tam evar!!! (Yes, I spelled it evar.) This is supposed to be so hot it makes you sweat. I asked if the could make it super hot and they did! This is why you order Thai tea and sticky rice. The tea was great. This is traditionally served with Bbq chicken and sticky rice, so that's what we ordered. Perfect! The chicken is normally a reprieve from the heat. However, this chicken had coriander, which was a nice suprise. But, it didn't help relieve any heat. Thanks to this place for a great meal!
author: Todd C.

description:
I went here tonight on a family dinner. We were looking for a new good Thai restaurant in the city. When in the city we normally go to King of Thai. The result...Modern Thai is a winner!

We ordered the Red Pumpkin Curry. Very tasty and it also had chicken and squash. The pumpkin was silky smooth and wasn't too spicy. The yellow chicken curry was your traditional dish. My brother had the roasted duck with red curry and lychees. Very good mix of sweet and savory. The pad Thai was also served the traditional way. The Pineapple Fried Rice was also prepared nicely. The cashews differentiated it from other versions at different restaurants. 

My only gripes were the Fried Calamari appetizer. It was crunchy but lacked salt. The sweet n sour sauce was on the bland side. 

Overall: mostly awesome food and friendly service=4 stars!
author: Paul C.

description:
I was not greeted when I walked in the door. I was not shown my table. I did not feel at all welcomed entering this place.
At the table, the waitress just showed up with her notes out and didn't say anything.
When the food came, it tasted alright. So that's a plus.
While everyone is eating, the waitresses stand, leaning with their backs on the front of the bar towards everyone who is eating. They are standing there gazing at the customers and talking amongst themselves. These people have zero customer service skills.
Then, towards the rear of the restaurant (at least it was the rear) it seemed like the owners family, kids, daughters husband, their babies, them selves and the rest of the staff, were all eating and making a lot of noise. That's unprofessional.
I did not feel at all welcomed here. I felt as though I was just in their way.
The food wasn't bad, but the customer service was horrible.
author: michael l.

description:
Good place! The service was great and it's a pretty chill restaurant to go to with friends. The curries (eggplant and green curry) were tastier than the pad thai, but, overall, everything was very tasty.
Just a note--if you are a large group splitting the bill, they don't accept more than two credit cards on the receipt, so make sure to bring cash.
author: Maneeshika M.

description:
I went here a few weeks ago. I really enjoyed it. The decor of the place scared me at first, I thought it would be really expensive, but for a modern looking place, the prices were very average, $8-9 for a dish.
The food was amazing, I had the pumpkin and tofu stir fry. Spicy and delicious!
author: Maciej M.

description: Food was excellant. Nice atmosphere. Gets loud when packed so not best place for conversation during peak hours. Loved pumpkin curry, but wished I had ordered it mild as it was very spicy (despite waitress advice to contrary). Pad Thai was also great with shrimp (added chicken). . . Large portion, very filling!
author: Chad S.

description: My friend and i stopped in craving some spice and good grub while also escaping the rain. Red and green curries were flavorful and the pineapple fried rice refreshing. Checked in and got a free ice coffee. Overall satisfied at a good price.
author: Chris C.

description:
Real short. Food was good, maybe even very good. Service with a smile. 

Only thing is they included a little more tip than I actually gave them on the bill. I didn't even notice until I checked my credit card statement a few weeks later. Not sure if this was on accident or some sneaky dealings, but since it is SUCH a hassle to open a dispute, I let them get away with it. It was a 20% tip too, so definitely not justified if it was on purpose.

I'd still go again, but if it happens once more, I'll never return.
author: Giancarlo G.

description:
We stopped in to Modern Thai before the Cranberries concert on 12/05/2009.  Simply delicious.

We started out with fresh Spring rolls; tasty and fresh!

My wife went with the Tom Kai soup w/ chicken and it was amazing.  I opted for the Tom Yum w/ chicken and it was very well seasoned.  A little on the spicy side which is always good.

Wifey got the Pram Ra or something to that effect; it was basically a delicious mixture of vegetables and chicken COVERED in a freaking amazing peanut butter sauce.  MMMMMM!

I went with the traditional green curry and was very pleased with the flavors.

Prompt, polite and kind service.  Water always filled.  Walked out of there with full bellies for less than $60 including tip.  Can't beat it.

Recommended.
author: Zach E.

description:
4.5 stars. This is super close to my apt and I love just running here when I'm craving good Thai food. Consistently tasty with friendly service and a small but nice interior. I have yet to be disappointed.

I always get the pumpkin sautee w/ tofu (or pumpkin curry), and I've tried numerous other dishes as well. Their curry seafood is really good, and of course the usual Pad Thai is great. I love pairing an off-dry Riesling with my Thai food too since it complements the taste so well. 

I've only come here for dinner, but I always see lunch specials when I walk by that look very tempting (and cheap!). Obviously this isn't going to e super fancy schmancy, but come here if you're just graving some yummy Thai food with satisfying portions at inexpensive prices!
author: Natalie W.

description: First time in with my girls last night. Great food! I loved the yellow vegetarian curry. May be the best I have had. I tried the girls non curry dishes and they were also amazing.  The rice was a beautiful rich brown. Good drink specials. I can't wait to come back!
author: Patricia M.

description:
Excellent! Really pleasantly by this place we happened upon while strolling down Polk.  Clean, modern space and helpful, polite, attentive service.  

Pad Thai had a great variety of flavors - not just your standard spicy sauce - and came with tofu in addition to all the typical dressings.  Coconut shrimp appetizer was perfect. The waitress suggested her favorite dish at one of my fellow diners' request, which was delicious as well.

Entree prices are very reasonable (most under $10) and they offered us wine bottle specials for only $15! All in all a good value and really enjoyable dining experience.
author: Lindsay N.

description:
I believe in benchmarks to evaluate popular food styles against each other.

When it comes to thai, for me, my benchmark is Prad Kra Prao (Spicy Tofu Basil), while for bf, it's Pad Thai.

Def the best Prad Kra Prao- just slightly pan fried as opposed to deep fried as most thai restaurants cook this dish up.  Noodles in pad thai are al dente perfection

Great location for us on polk st- looks like a renovated hotel lobby- awesome colors with a covered veranda in front makes for great people watching on polk st.

With the plethora of thai food on polk st, Modern Thai is a standout (not to mention open late - 10:30 i believe on weekday, 11:30 on weekend nights...)
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Wemt here for my 50th birthday with my family and it was fantastic!! If tou like Thai food this is the spot. The Coconut Shrimp appetizer was excellent along with the fried Calamari. The dipping sauces are the bomb.com. From the Khao Soi to the Sirloin Beef Salad it was all so GOOD. They brought me out the most adorable birthday dessert. It was crispy fried bananas surrounding a mound of delidious coconut ice cream. Just take my word this place is GREAT!! Definitely going back. Bon Appetit.....SCRUMPTIOUS
author: Dina T.

description:
Thai is my favorite food ever. I can eat it for breakfast lunch and dinner and never get sick of it! BUT I'm really fussy how it's made and Modern Thai does an ok job of it. 

I like their Green Curry, Tom Yum Soup, Thai Basil and Basil Tofu. I don't eat meat so get tofu or seafood options instead and find it works really well. 

Modern Thai stays somewhat true to the flavor of authentic Thai cuisine. Good service and presentation FOR THE PRICE. 

I get delivery often. I've tried other Thai restaurants around the area and nothing quite compares.... in fact I've ordered delivery now! Pls come soooon!
author: Ishara K.

description:
Green curry--nice and spicy just the way I like it! The pad thai was as good as some of the reviews stated!! I ordered the pad thai with shrimp and dang those were some serious prawns!! It went well with a Tsing Tao ;-). 

The patio in front is super cute! Overall the place has a cozy feel to it. The service on the other hand is a 2-3 star. We waited a very long time to even order. I ordered brown rice and they never brought it out. We did family style so you'd think that they would bring all of your dishes at once but they didn't. I was pretty annoyed. The server(s) would speed to the table and then whisk themselves away. We had to yell 1/2 way across the resto to order another round of beer. 

The food is definitely good but be weary of the service.
author: Adriana G.

description:
I wanted ginger and I happened to have a Modern Thai menu at hand, so I decided to have a lunch special of Sauteed Fresh Ginger and Tofu for lunch today ($7.95 - BARGAIN). It was delicious. I'm not a Thai food expert. I ordered the food to go. Service was fast and friendly. The serving size was generous (I have leftovers). If you have a super big appetite, you can add an appetizer (V rolls, fresh rolls, golden bags or crispy tofu) for $2, or add, an appetizer, soup (coconut or Tom Yam) and a soft drink for an additional $6). 

I will be going here again when the Thai food bug hits!
author: Writer G.

description: Don't bother with delivery. It takes more than double the estimate time, and arrives cold and soggy.
author: Brigitte B.

description:
My girlfriend and I decided to try someplace new on a whim one afternoon walking down Polk St. and we happened to be right in front of Modern Thai's A-Frame advertising their $6.95 lunch special. 

We walked in and the girl at the counter motioned for us to seat ourselves. We had bags and jackets and the place was empty so we sat ourselves down at one of the many moderate sized tables so we could comfortably spread ourselves out. When she came back out with menus she snapped at us that the table is reserved for four and made us move! We looked around quizzically since the place was dead empty except for the two of us...I wanted to say "well, when you get nine parties of four in here we'll move to make room for the 10th!" but I refrained since as a rule I don't spat with people handling my food, and service work is tough so we cut some slack and crowded ourselves and our stuff into one of the two-seaters against the wall. 

The food was also quite bad, not even decent...bad. My noodles were soggy and limp, the chicken was rubbery, stringy and flavorless, and the brown sauce was too salty. My girlfriend's entree was inedibly sweet with mushy overcooked vegetables... 

To round out the experience our waitress acted put out because we asked to have the drinks, which we'd ordered but never received, removed from the bill. I'm sorry, but where do you get off getting upset with me for not wanting to pay for services I requested but never received?! 

Judging from others' enthusiastic reviews of this place maybe we just caught them on the wrong day at the wrong time, but we both agreed upon leaving that Modern Thai was a mistake neither of us would care to make again.
author: Brandon S.

description: Good. Really enjoyed the coconut shrimp and pumpkin curry. Eggplant curry tasted pretty good but there were only two bites of eggplant which seemed odd given its name; however, there was plenty of meat in both dishes. Good service, fairly cute environment. I'd go back if I had a craving for Thai but I don't think I'll develop any special penchant for this place.
author: m t.

description:
I've eaten in the restaurant once and called in an ordered twice so I can safely say this is one of the best Thai places in Nob/Russian Hill. 

Tom Yum Soup is perfectly spicy and sweet at the same time. What a delectable treat for your tongue. 
Tom Kha Soup is a little too sweet and filling for my liking, especially for a starter, but still quite tasty.

Beef Pad Thai was good, decent, but not great. 

Pumpkin Chicken Curry was perfect!! That says a lot as it's by far my favorite Thai dish. Just the right touch of sweetness, the pumpkin (or squash) was perfectly cooked without being too mushy or too hard. I savored every bite of it. 

They're pretty quick with the delivery...I don't think I waited more than 45 minutes and everything came piping hot. Moderately priced so it wont break the bank. 

Me likey!!
author: Kristy M.

description: Great place. I enjoyed the patio and colors. The chicken Pad Thai i ordered was good and my only complaint was the chicken was a bit dry. Good service and enjoyable atmosphere.
author: Brandon S.

description: This place never fails to impress! Their various fried rice dishes are nearly perfect. The same goes for the calamari, which comes with a carousel of sauces, and Thai iced tea! Go for the basil rice if you're into spicy! This chic little spot is great for a late lunch/early dinner. This is my go-to restaurant before shows at the Regency =)
author: Berna G.

description:
After the bay to breakers race in Sf, we were all mighty hungry. My friends and I stayed at the Embassy Suites on Polk (if I'm not mistaken) and we yelped a Thai restaurant and this one was actually the second choice. Our first choice, which I don't remember the name to was actually closed. 

So we drove less than a mile away and quickly found parking on the streets which was great since good parking is hard to come by in SF.

It was around 2:30pm and the place had about 5-7 other patrons and 1 waitress but we were greeted and seated right away. We had a friendly and polite waitress who served us water and took our orders within ten minutes. She spilled our water on the table but all of us didn't seem to mind since we were still feeling the good vibes from the bay to breakers event!

All 5 of us ordered 2 items each since we were all pretty hungry...the only thing we ate that morning was a Burger King whopper after the race and we all biked/walked back from Balboa to Polk. That's probably more than 14 miles combined!

Here's the food review from what I remember:

Pad Thai-too sweet for my taste and the noodles were rubbery textured. If you're a first timer at this Thai restaurant...order something else. I had one bite from my friends' plate and both of them did not finish their pad plates.  If you like it, then great-more power to you.  I've had better (read my Thai-Riffic List). 

Basil chicken-good amount for one person and comes with a serving of rice. Make sure to let your waitress know how spicy you'd like this dish to be as mine came out regular...good thing they have chili flakes/jalapenos/etc. They serve this with a side of salad with a house vinegarette dressing which was light but very good.  

Green curry with chicken-perfect, a must order. Savory and delicious!

Thai fried rice-simple yet tasteful. It went well with everyone's dish. It wasn't greasy and neither was it bland. Although a couple of jalapenos added a kick to the rice.

I didn't get to try the other items such as the shrimp dish and the 2 soups but all my friends cleaned their plates except the pad Thai. We also liked the fact that during happy hour the Thai iced teas were only 99 cents (from 3pm-6pm).  We were all satisfied with food quality, taste, portions and service.

I'm probably not going here any time soon  but if I'm in SF again and craving Thai, this will be the first on my list!!!
author: Maynard M.

description:
The food was delicious, and the place seemed very clean and neat.
However, as I was eating my brown rice, I bit into a pebble.  I brought this to the server's attention, but she told me that this was "natural" in brown rice!  Being an inexperienced diner, I accepted her explanation.
But later, I asked my "foodie" girlfriend, however, and she assured me the server was wrong, and probably just lying to me.

After this experience, I never went back to Modern Thai again.
author: Greg M.

description: I was impressed by their original menu items, but was worried that the "fusion" theme would take away from the spicy bliss of Thai cuisine.  Luckily I was pleasantly surprised. The only negative is that the large open space felt cold (figuratively and literally).    I will be back to sample more of their specialties.
author: Jo J.

description:
I love this place. One of the best thai restaurants in SF, and there are a LOT of thai restaurants in SF.

I'm a vegetarian (mostly) so that influences my recommendations.

Best dishes are tofu pra-ram, spicy tofu salad, pumpkin curry, pad see-ewe, and the other curries.

Don't order the pad thai, as it is disappointing. 

They accept credit card and do delivery. 

The restaurant has a really classy little front area, which is where I usually sit.
author: John C.

description: They serve decent Thai food but services suck.  One time I went there by myself, the waitress never came by to my table after I ordered the food.  I even have to went up to the cashier to pay.  I looked around and didn't see a sign indicates "Please pay at the cashier."  Also they failed to ask "Hows everything or add more water to my glass."
author: Jade P.

description:
We got delivery from Modern Thai and weren't very impressed. Maybe the delivery time didn't do their food any favors. The pad Thai was lacking in flavor: mostly just sweet. The other dishes were okay; not bad, just okay.  Meh. I doubt we'll be ordering from there again, unless we have one of those episodes where we forget we had their food and do this whole thing all over again.

Given the volume of good reviews for this place, maybe our experience was an outlier? If anyone knows of a great Thai restaurant that delivers to Hayes Valley please feel free to message me.
author: A A.

description: My boyfriend and I used to come here and order take out all the time but the quality has just gone down. We got pad Thai several weeks ago and it was just bad! There wasn't any flavor and the noodles were oddly slimey. No thanks!
author: Phuc N.

description:
Reasonable prices, pretty good proportions and  yummy food! 

They have a lunch special that includes a lot of food priced a bit cheaper than dinner from 11-4 on weekdays and from 12-4 on weekends. Dishes include pad thai, chicken noodle soup, and thai fried rice to name a few.. but my favorite is the sauteed eggplant (also in the lunch special) 

They give a pretty good proportion and the customer service is ok. 

Four stars because of the location and lack of ambiance in the restaurant..but if you're in the area and hungry for a deal, Modern Thai is the place to go!
author: Jen L.

description:
The food was so good.   We went there on Saturday morning, and we were the first customer.  We were so hungry, so we ordered so many foods.  It was very delicious.
I can't wait to go back there.  Thank you for the nice food and service
author: Lily Y.

description:
I get dirty looks for admitting this all the time, but I'm just not that into Thai food.  I just have this thing where I don't think peanuts should be ground up, made into a pasty, saucy mess and plopped on top of noodles.  I just don't think it's right.  Peanuts belong on the ground of The Homestead, at Giants games and in the comics section of the newspaper.  

But randomly, I really liked the peanut sauce at Modern Thai.  Maybe it was because I was kind of doing emotional eating to prepare myself for the finale of Lost, which I knew would be a bloody shitshow, but it really hit the spot and tasted awesome with the chicken satay appetizer.  I also got the fried calamari appetizer, which was more Sparky's diner food than something one would find in Thailand, but who's judging?
author: Christy J.

description:
What a way to get my tastebuds gushing, and then dry up like a vagina in Las Vegas!!!

Called, asked if they accepted CC over the phone for delivery, she said yes. Took all my info, and my order... then she said *miss swan voice*
"ooohhh,  can't take credit card now. Cash? Yes!?"

I said I had no cash. she said "oooooh." Which is her way of resolving. I sad cancel the order and hung up!

Ugghhhh!!!! Don't these people know im living off student loans and credit cards?! Im writing Obama, something needs to be done!
author: Matthew Z.

description:
I visited Modern Thai today for lunch after another one of my other favorite spots was closed. 

The restaurant was clean and the wait staff was very friendly and willing to accommodate. Their lunch menu had tons of selections for $6.95. Initially I was going to get a curry noodle but my curiosity got the best of me when I saw Udon Chicken Phad Thai. I mean, I love Udon noodles and who doesn't like a quality Phad Thai? So I figured their marriage must be even better. 

Contrarily, the dish was decent but it lacked anything brilliant. So I gave the restaurant just three stars. However, if you are on Polk street and want a good lunch for your dime then I recommend that you stop by.
author: Mitch C.

description:
I'm a total douche for never having been to this joint before this past weekend.

For years I've prided myself on my extensive knowledge of Thai joints in SF. 

Seriously, if you've eaten at more Thai restaurants in this city than I have I'd be shocked. Let me put it this way, if you have and 1.) you're a dude, I wanna fight you 2.) you're a girl, I wanna bang you... capiche?

Anyway, Modern Thai is great. The food was delicious, it was really inexpensive and they served us after midnight, which was cool.

Crazy bonus points for a really great Pad Phrik Khing!
author: Jason R.

description:
The first time I came here, I was not a huge fan of my overall meal. Service was great, but my beans were not fully cooked, a boy was telling me how I was awesome but...(aka spilling the bad beans), and then the rice came out in the shape of a heart. Things weren't looking great for the heart-shaped rice. I didn't know how to react to the boy or my beans, so I stabbed my fork into the rice. *stab stab* I would've given the beans and service 3 stars though.. Usually the undercooked beans can be easily fixed, and it's not their fault for giving us rice shaped in a heart. 

I didn't come back for another 5 months, even though I was in the general vicinity. This time I shared a Roast Duck Noodle Soup and Yellow Curry with Chicken. For me, it's not that cheap, but it is decent for Thai cuisine. -- average $8+ per dish. Service is always friendly and when I was curious about the music selection, they even wrote down the cd name for me. Someone get me the "Popsanova Vol 1" album. mmkthx!!! Great date place.. heh.. Ambiance/decor is nice. I highly recommend the duck noodle soup. It was delicious and came in a big portion. There are chunks of meat.  You don't have to worry about it looking more like duck fat noodle soup like King of Thai Noodle *shakes fists*. It was excellent and definitely worth the 5 month wait. 


So was the boy. 


=====

ps. ordering to go gets you larger portions.. think about it

(banana_dance)
author: Donna H.

description:
Terrible. Just terrible. The food was awful and delivery took way too long.

We ordered spring rolls, red curry with chicken, and drunken noodles with beef. Because there was no listing on the menu for rice, we didn't order any. Imagine our surprise when the red curry came with no rice. Is this how food is always served here? I can't imagine that's the case. My roommate said the taste of the red curry (which was really a soup due to lack of rice) was terrible.
The drunken noodles were passable, but not by much.
The spring rolls had no taste at all. Even with tons of sauce, they were bland and unappetizing.

Delivery:
We ordered from Foodler at 8:24pm. Foodler (which almost always overestimates how long it will take for food to arrive) said that we would get our order at 9:10. At 9:30, we called to see where our food was. It arrived a few minutes later.
"Maybe they were really busy and took a long time to make your order!" you say, full of disbelief? Not so. We had to microwave our entrees because they were barely lukewarm by the time they were delivered.
author: Evan B.

description: Absolutely the best chicken pad thai in the city. The staff is friendly and the decor of the place is clean, colorful and tactful. The fact that I eat there almost 3x/week is very telling of how much I love their pad thai.
author: Monique T.

description:
Very good lunch special.  6.75, and you get to choose from at least 15 different options.  This is unbeatable!

I love their pad see ew, especially the brown sauce is awesome.  I used to order their roasted duck fried rice too (before I became a vegetarian), and their fried rice is sooooooo delicious!

Green curry is a must try.  You can choose the type of meat or tofu you want.  I liked it with chicken and now I usually get fried tofu.  Though you can see they just dump the meat option you choose into the curry, but they actually cook it first so it's not obvious that the meat was placed inside the curry afterwards.

If they could improve their staff's services, I would give them a 5-star.
author: Helen M.

description:
eh.  it's ok.  I love pad thai after a long drinking weekend or just a long week.  Sometimes, all you want to do is crawl under a blanket and watch a bad movie on Friday while scarfing down some solid pad thai.  

I was hoping this would be my go to delivery thai restaurant for the area.  It's not.  In fairness, their delivery is fast and accurate.  Their food is good.  It's just not great.  

The spring rolls are fresh as is the cucumber salad.  But, the pad thai and most other dishes are relatively bland.  Bland thai food...ummmm....just does not hit the spot.  

I'll keep looking.  But until I can find something else, this place will do.
author: Emily G.

description: My friend and I headed here after a few drinks over at Lush and got the pumpkin tofu curry and fried rice. It was delicious and she raved about how great the pumpkin curry was over the rice. I loved it just as much though I admit, I wasn't entirely thrilled with the pumpkin chunks. It was still VERY good, mind you. What really had me sold on this place was the OH SO DELICIOUS blueberry roti for dessert.
author: Shauna S.

description: Can you say bomb Thai food and decent prices!  This takes the cake as best Thai in my area and is freaking delicious. Service was good too.
author: Ryan J.

description:
A group of 5 of us had been debating for a solid 45 minutes over where we should eat on a recent Sunday night. When Thai food was brought into the conversation, I couldn't help but give a nod of encouragement.  We ended up on Polk Street at Modern Thai.  They've got a bright patio area up in front, but it can be a little chilly and loud from the street traffic, so we opted to sit inside.  We realized that it was Mother's Day, and the restaurant seemed deserted.  We figured that most people wouldn't take their beloved moms to the TL for a celebratory dinner.  Good for us, I guess!  We had the main dining room to ourselves for the better part of an hour.  I liked the ambiance, with its vibrant lime and fuchsia accent walls and its high ceilings.  It was simply yet elegantly appointed.  

The food was good, but not extraordinary.  Since there were 5 of us who were game for eating family style we had a chance to sample a variety of dishes, including Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, Mango Curry with Chicken, Eggplant and Tofu, Scallops over Bok Choy, and Papaya Salad.  One of my dining companions whom I had just met earlier that day was Thai and thought that most of the dishes were too sweet for her tastes.  I was very liberal with my usage of the hot peppers, so I didn't really find sweetness to be an issue.   

We also tried the mango and black sticky rice and the blueberry roti for dessert.  

Overall, it was a pleasant meal, but I think I'll probably be inclined to be adventurous and try my luck with another restaurant in the area.
author: Evelyn K.

description: Definitely our favorite Thai restaurant in SF. The food is always flavorful and fresh. When we order delivery through GrubHub, they typically beat the projected delivery time by at least 15 minutes. Our favorites are the pumpkin curry and the crispy pumpkin (like pumpkin french fries!), as well as the spring rolls and pad see ew. We eat a lot of Thai food and almost every time we decide to stray from Modern Thai, we wish we hadn't.
author: Rebecca E.

description: This is a good solid thai place. Their pad kee mao is pretty good, but could be a little more spicy. I especially like their fried tofu salad. The reason it's so awesome is because they deliver for free on grubhub! I still like Jitlada more, but this place is pretty solid.
author: Ashley H.

description: a-ok, nice place, service was decent but nothing really stuck out (food). panang curry was good but shrimp rolls were bad. tasted like oldish shrimp.
author: Tiff W.

description:
Ok people, just pay attention here to what we ordered recently at MODERN THAI and you can't go wrong. I swear it. Here goes:

Spring rolls and coconut shrimp for first course.

Tom Kha Soup with coconut milk, chicken, lemon grass, onions next.

Pad Thai which is perfect by the way.

Red Curry with duck, mango and green beans (the best).

Also of course have Thai iced tea and you've got an amazingly tasty and satisfying meal. I can't vouch for any other items on the menu but the ones above will make you very happy. Try Tony's picks and let me know what you think!  Great place and great food. Extremely reasonable prices too. I love Modern Thai.
