author: Tony G.

description: I had Tom Yum Fried rice (not very spicy, was ok), Black Sweet Rice with Mango (very good:), and Coppa Caffe (should've tried modern Thai sundae instead...).  Don't know if I'll try this restaurant again but if I do, it'll be for the Black Sweet Rice with Mango.
author: J K.

description: The spicy string beans with chicken and brown rice are to die for!!!
author: Melissa J.

description: This place is our neighborhood used to be our favorite.  But the past 2 times, something has been off....not quite sure what it is but still highly recommend this place.
author: Britt B.

description:
F*ck yea.  

Aside from the eye searing wall paper and random Roman art, I recommend this place.  Good good good.  Yum.
author: Christine M.

description: Excellent authentic thai cuisine. A highlight on Polk street. Would definitely recommend.
author: Lesley G.

description:
"Modern" ???

The place looks like your aunt's parlor, if your aunt were a crazy antebellum south heiress.  The room is fussy, old, dainty but large, with a 60s-70s era multi console electric organ for a centerpiece.

The menu is conventional American Thai -- curry style, not noodle style -- with some upscale additions like salmon, prawns, pineapple or mango curry.  With some light classical music and a large heated deck overlooking Polk Street  it's the perfect old school antidote to the electro-beat Thai chains sweeping the nation.

What sets this one apart is the friendly, cheerful, and attentive service.
author: Gil S.

description:
I love the decor, it's bright, beautiful and fresh!  
This is a great place to have a nice dinner for a reasonable price. When all you have to spend is ten bucks, it feels good to be able to go somewhere pretty and not be forced into a dingy, cracked, florescent hole in the ground. 
I love it, I come here all the time with friends.... oh yeah, deserts at Modern Thai are bomb.
author: Shanna H.

description:
I love Modern Thai(so much that I had to write my first yelp review)! I order from this place via phone or eat24hours.com a lot and I've never been disappointed. I use to think I didn't like Thai food, but a friend kept talking about his love for it, so I thought I'd give it a go. I started out with the chicken thai fried rice and have slowly started venturing into other menu items. The fried rice is awesome; i love the fresh slices of tomatoes and the portions are very generous! The coconut shrimp skewers are pretty good too. Tom Kha soup is my fav, but it's not listed on the eat24hours.com menu, so you'll have to call to get it. I enjoyed the seared scallops with bok choy too. I just wish the bok choy was sliced into smaller pieces. I get cravings for the lemonade thai iced tea... so good!

The FBI is my favorite dessert item.. well, i love the blueberry roti too! I've tried the Thai ice cream sundae, but not for me. Good, just more of an acquired taste I guess. And don't worry, they know how to package the order, so your ice cream will not be a soupy mess.

Delivery is alway pretty quick, food is perfectly warm, and the delivery guys are pleasant. I'd say give them a try if you are in the mood for Thai!.. or ready to venture into trying Thai food!
author: c j.

description: The Mango Curry was one of the best thai dishes I've had in SF.
author: Paul C.

description:
My work buddies often ask me why I put up with all the bums, parking tickets and general annoyances of living in the city.

The reason is that when they're paying $7 for a Whopper value meal, I'm having a huge plate of tasty ethnic cuisine in a beautifully decorated restaurant for a dollar or two more.

The restaurant itself was really nice inside this old building.  It had high ceilings and eclectic and brightly colored walls, modern paintings, and plenty of plants.

The portion size was huge, and the waitresses were so nice.  I ate there after the gym, so they had to come back like 50 times to fill up my water.

My only gripe was that my food was practically drowned in a heavy peanut sauce.  The peanut sauce could have been a little more subtle for sure.

On weekends, they're bravely open till 3AM for all you drunkards on Polk St.

----
update: I had an upset stomach for a few hrs after eating here.  Not pointing fingers, but this and a protein bar are all I ate today...

but I don't see anyone else complaining about that, so maybe it was something else?  hmm.
author: Rocco B.

description: LOVE this place... Their mango curry is the best I have had to date. Really nice staff, quiet, clean and really cute. Great for a small group or date night. Must get some chilled sake too!
author: Sarah A.

description:
This is one of those experiences where the sum of the parts is greater than the whole. If I was to rate this restaurant solely on its food, I would probably give it three stars. Everything is tasty enough, but nothing blows me away. 

However, dining experiences aren't based on food alone. One must also consider the ambiance, service, and value. And this is where Modern Thai earns an extra star. 

I've been here a couple of times, and I think the food is decent. Their papaya salad and spring rolls are quite tasty. But I've ordered their yellow curry a couple of times and it seemed as though their potatoes were a bit undercooked. And although I'm aware that yellow curry is the mildest of all curries, theirs is beyond mild... while it's not bad or inedible, I recommend trying something else. 

On the other hand, the ambiance here is really pleasant, in a low-key kind of way. I like the bright lime green color on the walls, and the fact that every table has a bud vase with fresh flowers. The service is efficient and friendly, and their prices are incredibly reasonable.

Modern Thai is a smart choice for the neighborhood, providing good food and excellent value in a clean, cheery environment. A solid four stars.
author: Jasmine W.

description: Tasty food, terrible service. Especially for larger groups. That said, the pumpkin curry is pretty tasty.
author: Apurva P.

description:
I thought this place was excellent.  Sure a bit more in price than the many Thai resturants in the are, but only by a couple of dollars. And those could extra dollars totally worth it. 

Went with 6 total and everyone loved their food. Service was excellent and friendly waitress. Maybe we got lucky by getting there early cause the place was packed by the time we left.  My favorite and I am picky my soup Tom Ka Gai.  Also my friends got  Pad Thai and even the best places can't seem to make this well, but my friends loved it. 

Will totally go back next time in the neighborhood. Great food, Good wine selection that is not too pricey and great service.
author: n d.

description: Okey so I have to update my review. I ordered from them last night and I must say it was great si I owe them an update.
author: Kajal P.

description:
Summer is a great season for dining at Modern Thai.  The reason is because they have semi-outdoor seating (you don't want to get too much closer to the folk on Polk than this), in the form of a roof-covered veranda.  

The staff is very smiley and friendly and the prices are reasonable.

I'm here about once a week, year round, and my favorite dishes remain the same:

- Basil Tofu - this is the Big Mac of Thai dishes for me.  So delicious, so caloric, and you enjoy each and every fabulous bite.

- Duck/Pineapple Curry - sooooo good.  Sauce so creamy it rivals creme anglaise.  Big chucks of skin-on duck, falling off the bone.  

- Crab Pad Thai - it's been on the "specials" board for about 2 years straight now.  Huge portion.

- Catfish Eggplant - also a longtime "special".  Savory eggplant and tender catfish.  Why don't we see more catfish on menus?  It's so cheap and so good!  Sea bass should be replaced by catfish from now on.

Drinks include Thai iced tea/coffee, and young coconut (in season), served in an entire coconut shell.  If you squint your eyes really tightly, you can imagine you're on vacation in Koh Samui...now, if only you could drown out the crazy yelling man in the background...
author: Liz S.

description:
I recently ate here for my birthday dinner with a group of 11. My party was seated in the outdoor area, where all of the crackheads &residence of the Tenderloin could see you eat, which was kind of disturbing to me. haha. Anyways .. for a group that size, it was GREAT SERVICE! The waiters were very friendly &efficient. Besides their great service was the GREAT FOOD. I ordered the Thai BBQ Pork. It was pretty good. It is also a really clean restaurant, especially that it is located in the Tenderloin. Parking is kind of a bitch though; there is a parking lot across the street though, but you have to pay. Street parking is kind of hard to find. But overall, a great Thai place to eat at if you're in the TL.

Pros: Great service, good food, reasonable prices.
Cons: Parking, location.
author: BrendaJoy G.

description: Pretty awesome thai takeout near my house! The yellow curry is pretty good, and they aren't super slow or anything.
author: Aditya M.

description: I've eaten take out and delivery from here, so I can't speak on the ambiance or waiting service. The food is good and priced fairly. With so much competition it's hard to say if i'll come back or not.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Definitely the best Thai restaurant I ever went to. Everything was excellent: chicken satay (really tender), coconut shrimp (crispy and not greasy), pad thai was perfect (so many times is too greasy and has no taste... Not here!!)

We were there for lunch and prices are REALLY affordable considering the quality of the food. They have lots of lunch special too.
author: Jerome L.

description:
BEST THAI FOOD IN THE CITY EVER!

We strolled in here last night after our GPS told us the wrong place for crepes. It was a toss between here and the busy Chai-Yo down the street and I have no regrets for making the right choice.

The interior reminded me of Macau for some odd reason but it's very cozy somewhat upscale but not too up scale. Since it wasn't packed like the other place, it was definitely the good choice.

We started out with appetizers, we ordered the fried wonton, chicken satay, and hoi jor. Fabulous I must say! Though the fried wonton was a little too fried, my boyfriend enjoyed it. Love the chicken satay, the sauce was a mix of peanut sauce and ginger and the chicken was not dry (like King of Thai) but very juicy! The hoi joi, definitely better than other Thai places I've been to; the meat was packed and it fit well with the plum sauce. 

Our drinks were Thai Ice Tea, not much to say about this one since they're the same-ish to me. It wasn't too sweet which is the way I like it.

Our entree was chicken Pad See Ew, the veggies were cooked but it was still fresh crunchy cooked, the noodles were not too sweet and not too salty. The chicken, very juicy indeed! Mmm one of the best I've had in Thai food.

We wrapped up our meal with a special order of Strawberry, Banana, Blueberry roti. I'm not much of a fan of blueberries but I liked it!. 

The service at Modern Thai is very warm and friendly. The decorations in the restaurant looks upscale but food is moderately inexpensive (which is a +). Food presentation was also very neat and classy. The bathroom, very clean! 

Overall, if you want really good Thai food with great service and food presentation, I highly suggestion going to Modern Thai. Best of all, it is inexpensive! The food and service was worth more than the price. I sense that we will come back here often =P.

Edit: 10/10/07
We've came here about four times now, each time on Mondays after Youth Commission for me and the service and food has still been great! I suggested this place for my fellow commissioners for a meeting and they accommodated us very well even with special orders.  Last time I came here with my bf, they messed up our order by accident but then went the extra mile to fix it even though we would have still been ok with the food. Again I emphasize on the great service they have! I'm going back for a joint birthday dinner this Saturday!
author: Natalie G.

description:
Oh man....I JUST discovered the search feature on yelp where you can check the type of food you want and then select only reviews on places that deliver!!!

I needed Thai delivery in SF for 25-30 people and that is just how I stumbled on Modern Thai. My CEO requested Thai or Chinese for our meeting and shit, given that choice, there's no question.

So I went by rating and location and Modern Thai in Nob Hill had great reviews and was close enough for delivery. Plus, the guy who helped me, Derek (and he just called to make sure we liked it!!!), was super helpful in making decisions on what to order for a large group. 

I ended up with fresh spring rolls, chicken satay and basil tofu for appetizers. Then we got papaya salad, crispy tofu salad, chix/shrimp pad Thai and tofu pad Thai. For main courses we ordered basil chicken, ginger chicken and spicy green beans with beef, with rice for all.
Everything was not only delicious it was devoured. We have a total of 2 vegetarians in our group, but since the majority is pretty health conscious I thought it might be good to order a bunch of tofu dishes. The great part about that is, my meat and potatoes boss sort of complained until I insisted he taste a piece. He actually thought it was tasty!

Not only did they deliver, with plates napkins, forks and serving spoons, their customer service is tops and the food is outstanding for a working luncheon or a lazy "don't feel like cooking" dinner. We'll be ordering from them again.
author: Devileen C.

description:
Our favorite Thai spot in sf! My boyfriend and I studied abroad in Thailand and definitely had our fair share of authentic Thai cuisine.  Modern Thai takes us right back to those Days.

We usually go overboard here and get Tom Yum, Som Tom, Pad see ew, and pumpkin curry.  The curry is divine :)

Staff is always friendly and the ambiance is great for any kind occasion. This place is our go to place!
author: Megan N.

description:
"It's Friday and we ain't got no job and ain't got shiet to do!" - Friday 

The guys and I definitely had nothing to do Friday night, so we decided to cruise around the city and try a new place. After an in-car "Rock/paper/scissors" match to determine the cuisine for the night, we decided to go for Thai. I pulled out my trusty Yelp app on the Iphone and found the closest Thai place to our "Current Location." 

Four stars based on at least 150 reviews? Lets go for it! 

Walking into Modern Thai, I noticed the reasonable prices on the menu posted right at the door. The atmosphere was a little intimate but the guys and I picked a table in the corner away from all the cupcaking couples. 

We ordered the Fried Calamari to start, Sauteed Eggplant with Beef, Thai Fried Rice with Duck and the Green Curry with chicken for the main dishes. 

The food was decent; nothing really spectacular or short of amazing. Honestly, I would have given this place a Meh rating if it wasn't for the Duck Fried Rice. They really outdid themselves with the amount of duck they included in the rice; +1 star for the fried rice. 

My real gripe is about the curry. Generally, when I order a curry at a Thai restaurant, the curry has two distinct characteristics. It is either strong in curry flavor or rich with coconut milk flavor. The green curry at Modern Thai was neither. It blended into a rather runny, bland sauce that I just didn't really enjoy. I'll have to try the yellow and red one next time in order to make a fair review. 

Other than that, the service was great, the decibel levels were acceptable and we left with full bellies. 

I'm not going to give up on this place just yet. Updates in the future!
author: Curt L.

description:
I like this place :)

Super cute decor--this place would rock for an inexpensive date.

Of note, the Tom Kha Gai soup was AWESOME. That chicken was incredibly moist and the soup was perfectly seasoned. I want to buy gallons of this and freeze it for rainy or sick days.

The Crispy Calamari dish was amazing too but it was on the specials menu so not sure if it is a regular item. Had to knock off a star because their king crab items should probably have the cartilage removed before being served.

But, I'm still thinking about that soup...
author: Cindy P.

description:
I find it refreshing when I go to a thai place and they honest about their ingredients. Our server at Modern Thai was really honest about what has fish sauce and what we can eat, etc. 

We had the crispy basil tofu, papaya salad for appies - both of which were great, in fact my friend said the papaya salad was the best she's ever had.  

We ordered soup (eyes were bigger than stomach) and it was perfectly tart!  

Then we ordered 2 other dishes.  Drunken noodle and veggie stiry fry something.  Both were great.  My stomach was totally hurting afterwards from consuming too much food!
author: Bhumika K.

description:
We found this spot by coincidence, while looking for a good Thai place in SF last night and were quite pleased. The attention was superb, I had a couple of glasses of Merlot that were both inexpensive and pleasant to drink.

The food was very good: we had a couple of dishes with tofu in them and another plate based on salmon. They were not too big and not too greasy: just fine. The following morning, my blood sugars were at 123, so that's gotta count for something.
author: Manny H.

description:
Solid Thai, but nothing special. The decor was more interesting than the food. 

I got the Pad Kee Mao with chicken, and I felt they skimped on the portion and the noodles were kind of gummy and congealed. A certain amount of gumminess is unavoidable with the pad kee mao I guess, but this seemed a bit too gummy. I also prefer my noodles spicier and these didn't hit the mark. My friend got Pad Thai -- a heaping portion, but again, nothing out of the ordinary.
author: Annee T.

description:
The area of Lower NobHill / Upper TL is littered with thai places.  I mean...they're EVERYWHERE.

As such, I eat thai a lot.  

My take on Modern Thai is that is a tad more posh inside.  They care more about actually making a nice sit down restaurant which definately sets them apart from the typical thai joints around.

Bright colors, dim lights, simple plants  and clean white tables create a light mood inside.  Their menu is a tad more thai and bit less American.  By saying that I mean it's less greasy, lighter, tastes very fresh.  The chicken has no fat on it and is perfectly cooked.  I feel like nothing is just thrown together here, they put a lot of time into making good dishes.
author: Mary R.

description:
Yummy, yummy in my tummy. 

I totally stumbled onto this place after a boozy day of Oregon Football at the R Bar. It was so good, we ordered the Pad Thai and the Pra Ram, and a few other dishes that I can't remember. I woke up the next morning considerably less hung over than I should have been, and I owe that to Modern Thai.

I was happily surprised to find their To Go menu shoved in a coat pocket a few days later. I ordered delivery, it was at my apartment in about 25 minutes and steaming hot. I order something from them every other week-and last night I branched out and ordered the spring rolls (3 stars out of 5) and the green curry rice (10 stars out of 5). Ican't wait to try something else next week.
author: Leesa P.

description:
Modern Thai has the best beef noodle soup I ever ate! Complex flavors like that of the broth only come from long slow cooking. The BIG bowl was  loaded with flavor and  included beef, beef balls, greens, rice noodles and more. I loved every drop. For $6 it is a bargain that can be enjoyed day and night (they stay open till 3am Friday and Saturday night). 
The new owners made the decor bright and cheery, and is kept very clean. There is a regular menu, and a specials one that changes every few weeks. Enjoy small touches like candles at your table in the evening. This is a place you not only can enjoy great food but can also bring a date and can hear when they talk.
I am blown away each time I go, you will too.
author: Bill B.

description: I don't eat alot of thai food but I find the Curry here extremely delicious.  It's not too salty, sweet, or spicy.  The taste is just right and has a great aroma.  Please try the yellow curry here, it's great.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Good solid Thai food.  Very open and airy place.  Minimalist decor with very good service throughout the night and is a very good value for the location it is in.  

I love Thai food, and green curry (stated yet again), and it did not disappointed here.  I do understand that not all places make it the same, but I like my curry thicker then the watery stuff that they have here.  Nevertheless it was good and it had the perfect level of spiciness in here.  My friend got the pad see ew and it was GREAT.  These portions are HUGE, which makes it an even better bang for the buck.

if you're in the area and looking for a casual restaurant or even a classier one, Modern Thai caters to a wide variety of patrons and has good, cheap food to boot.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Another Polk St. favorite....try the Pumpkin Curry!

I placed an order for about 100 servings for a curry event and it was one of the most discussed dishes among guests. The manager Neil is very polite and delivered everything on time and ready for our appetites.
author: Charlene A.

description:
This is the best thai restaurant I've ever been to. 
The food is quickly served, the delivery time is not bad when you live in Nob Hill area.  
The place is cozy, with splashes of green that makes you feel like you're in a restaurant in a tropical place.
Plus, the price of the food is really good! It depends on what you order but it ranges from $11-$20 (plus tax) per person
I recommend:
Papaya Salad
Tom Kha 
Green Curry (amazing choice for eggplant lovers like myself)
author: Miss C.

description:
As far as Thai food go, there's nothing wrong with this place.

We came for lunch and we marveled at how nice it looked, and the enclosed balcony is awesome.  They have a mango red curry which is good. My favorite is red curry.

Well worth coming to if you're in the area.

Four stars cuz I'd come back if I'm in the area and having a meal with someone.
author: Robert L.

description:
I've walked by this place TOO many times and said "Nahhh, not today."  But for some reason this afternoon I had a mad craving for some thai noodles.

Walking in, the place looks great.  I don't know what it was before, but their redecoration  paid off and it really takes advantage of their space.

I started out with the Chicken Satay which was DELICIOUS.  And the cucumber salad that comes with it served as a great palette cleanser before I got my soup.

I'm always surprised at the portion size whenever I'm served thai noodle soup, the bowl's huge!  I dug in and again, I was amazed.  I usually throw in a ton of hot sauce because I like my soup spicy.  But this time, I didn't wanna spoil what spices were already there making it taste so delicious.

I highly recommend this place.  It looks quite classy, the food is cheap, and the service is swift.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Tasty food and excellent service. 

The papaya salad was fresh and light, the curry was flavorful and had lots chunky veggies, and the pad sew was fresh tasting. Our food arrived hot, and in about 35 minutes, about 10 minutes before the ETA .
author: Jennifer K.

description: The crispy papaya salad here was one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten!   I also had the han lemonade thai iced tea which was a great mixed drink with the meal.  I will definitely be back!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Delicious pad thai and pineapple fried rice, generous portions. Service can be slow but would still recommend
author: Brian S.

description:
I am not sure I can write a better review than Gil so I won't even try.
I found the decor to be a bit much to be sure but coming from the outside were a real estate agent might sell it by calling it a "neighborhood in transition" this interior transforms your experience.

I have never been here when it is really busy which begs the question, how can it not be busy at key hours and still stay afloat?
Well its certainly not like they improving the decor so I guess as long as they keep the basil crackly like they do and the peanut sauce punchy and the curry o so tasty, then this place will continue to be a tendernob institution.
author: Sean S.

description:
Modern Thai gets five stars for what it is: a really delicious thai meal and a pleasant dining experience.

I have passed this place 1.5 million times and never went it - it just didn't look inviting and I already have my polk street faves. But they just enclosed their little porch and it made me take notice and want to go there. 

Went last night and enclosing that porch was a great first move. The front room is enclosed with lots of windows which gives a nice outdoor feeling without eating directly on Polk street, which few would want.

The interior is nicely painted and nicely appointed with plenty of space for every diner. It's a great atmosphere. We sat under a palm in the corner which was cool. 

The food was deeelicous. I had pumpkin curry which I heart and theirs was not as creamy as Oshas and was more pumpkiny and more spicy. Bf had the pineapple fried rice and loved it. We stuffed ourselves. AND still had leftovers! POW!

Plus the waitstaff was friendly and awesome. Always attentive without bothering us constantly. Perfect. 

The prices are great on the food and the wine. I am definitely headed back asap.
author: Andrea S.

description:
I've searched all around this city for great fried rice.  This is the best place for fried rice I've found, in fact when I'm craving fried rice I don't even waste time trying new places I just get it from Modern Thai because I already know it's the best!   This is not just white or brown rice with soy sauce and some pork, this is fried rice like it should be...  kinda greasy, with egg, some veggies, pork (or chicken/ shrimp/ tofu). Large dish, always leftover for lunch tomorrow.

Oh, and my partner has her favorite dish here, the pumpkin curry, apparently it's quite amazing... not that I would know because I always order the fried rice.

Service is fast and friendly.  I will continue to go back, for eat-in and take-out.
author: Sandy M.

description:
Cool space to have dinner. You get the feeling, though, that it would serve better for restaurant in the French Quarter. 

Pretty good drunken noodles and yellow curry.
author: Megan S.

description: Delicious, but not hot enough.  I like my thai food spicy damn it!
author: Michael G.

description:
3.5 stars

Ok, anyone who thinks the tip calculator is wrong is slow for 2 reasons:

1. Unless they've fixed it since you when, it's spot on. I never tip based on those suggestions because 20% of anything is sooooo simple to come up with in your head. 

2. Why are you getting mad at their "suggestion". It's not like they added the tip on for you. You can still tip whatever you want. 

Anyway, those reviews were the dumbest excuses for 1 and 2 stars I've ever seen. 

Anyway, the green curry with pork was tasty. We said we like it really hot but they brought it out a little less than medium-hot. The duck fried rice was tasty as well but could've had a little less oil in it. I really loved the fresh rolls, though. They tasted more fresh than most I've had and this is coming from someone who has Vietnamese fresh rolls every day for lunch. All of that plus a large Singha made a nice weeknight dinner for $31 + tip (we tipped $6.50 based on our own math and the quality of the service - not the suggestion of the piece of paper). I would definitely go back.
author: Natalie G.

description:
Doesn't look like much from the outside- bars on the windows... after all it's in the TL.  Yet, when you walk inside, it's just lovely.  Colonial inspired decor, high ceilings, nice choice of colors.  

The waitresses are super nice, service is fast.  When I came here, there was only one other party there having dinner.  However, I did see a few people come in to order take out.  

We had a tempura shrimp salad that was on the "Specials" list.  Spicy, a lot of flavors going on... maybe too many?  I felt it was a bit strong and overwhelming- the cilantro, onion, garlic, pepper, spices, etc.  However, I have more of a bland palette.  We ordered an eggplant curry with beef that was delicious.  

Total bill including tip was $27- not bad!  Cute place, great for a quiet dinner or date.
author: Sarah F.

description: We can't stop raving about the Crispy Papaya salad! This is definitely something I have NEVER seen offered at any Thai restaurant.  The strings of papaya were lightly deep fried and dressed with a tangy lime sauce, with green beans and peanuts, we loved this so much we went back again just for the crispy papaya salad!  The food was tasty, portions we're good, service was lacking a little but not enough to be complaining and ruined our dining experience or anything.  The only thing is, I hate going to Asian restaurants that charge you for a side of rice, especially when their entrees are served family style!!!
author: Liz P.

description:
A cornucopia of substantial evidence that my food obssesion is soaring into uncharted arenas has paved the way for new plateaus of guilt and disgust. Let's divulge! IM SURE YOU'RE THIRSTING! 

So, i typically enjoy a finely leavened bread discus as my main utencil, which thai has defiantly shunned with gravitas, so i thought i'd step into darbar and procure a cracker thin roti to expedite grub devourment. Circular, providing tha' texturals to my temporal, yah smell that? 

I then notice that brown rice is not an option at my chosen eatery, so i thought i stop at chai-yo to pick up a carton (their's is the zenith-don't ask me why). I had to wait a certain amount of time, because we all know fools be ordering the steamed jasmine exclusively. ( i figured, why go to a place that has it prepared in about a 1/4 of the time, and that fibrous wallop which gives it extra character and subsistence? yeah, right? brown rice is fucking sanitation debris!)

I finally make it down, nearing the completion of my lunch break, to unmask the coveted thai buy- panang curry with tofu and pumpkin w/o fish sauce. And as they add a pescado double shot (not confirmed  :o)   ) , my salivary floodgates orchestrate obnoxiously technical arrangements, it feels like im engulfed in gluttonous anticipation.

Oh, it corrected my form, it stultified my sensibilites, it buttonhooked my gelato cannon and cluster-circumsized my fourth wall with a trio of blood-hungry, crack addicted orcas. Quite frankly, an exercise in how to paint my house correctly. Meet your new polk haunt, ass hats. But unlike the surrounding streetwalkers, they ain't down with the brown. Ah, but an easily queled tiff, as long as you abstain from fostering an admirable, noteworthy life.
author: Christopher J.

description:
I recently went to Modern Thai with my friend Dianna. I had passed this little restaurant for years on Polk at Bush Street but never actually stopped to eat there. When we first walked into Modern Thai I was a little taken back to see the entire restaurant was empty on a Thursday night at 7pm. I eventually figured out they do a lot of take-out compared to eat-in as the delivery guy was constantly on the go. The inside of the restaurant is simple and clean. A few of the walls are painted lime green and bright red, lending the "modern" to Modern Thai. Other than the colorful walls, the restaurant isn't modern or hip. It's just a basic large Thai restaurant but it does have a few tables outside on Polk Street for those rare warm nights. 

Modern Thai offers all the popular specialties you would find at any average Thai restaurant. Main dishes cost from $7-12 and appetizers $5-8. The menu has a large selection of pan fried noodle and fried rice dishes in addition to entrees that come with your choice of tofu (vegetarian); chicken, pork or beef (for $1 extra); or shrimp (for $2 extra). I was particularly impressed with the Pad See-Ew (flat rice noodles with egg and broccoli), Thai basil with chicken, spicy green beans with shrimp and vegetarian egg rolls. The flavors were good but the dishes didn't stand out from any other Thai restaurant. I did have one major problem with the food in that it came way out too fast and I mean within 2 minutes of ordering. The waiter didn't have time to open our wine and pour our first glass before our entrees arrived. I found this a bit unnerving that the food comes out so fast. When I questioned why the food was done so quickly the waiter told me it was "fresh" whereas I call it "pre-made". I was a quite disappointed that the food wasn't fresh nor made to order. Next time they should wait at least 5 minutes before bringing out the food so that you think it was made special for your table. As for the wine, Modern Thai offers wine specials during the week, $15 for a bottle of cheap red wine. It's pretty good too, but it will produce one heck of a hangover in the morning. 

Modern Thai on Polk is an average Thai restaurant. The food is good but not exceptional. I would recommend ordering take-out rather than eating in. The actual restaurant doesn't have much to offer in the way of ambiance or service.
author: Alice S.

description: Good, solid Thai food in Russian Hill/ Nob Hill. Fairly reasonable prices too
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
I work around the corner from Modern Thai.

Service here is the best in town.  The workers here are nice and friendly.  I usually call and order to go.  They always have my food ready in time when I get there.

I always get the Thai Fried Rice with chicken.   YUM!

Best of all they have this item on the lunch menu which is cheaper than the other items on the menu.
author: Jeff Q.

description: I usually judge a Thai restaurant by the Pad See Ew, very hard to screw up but even harder to get it exactly right. Modern Thai was a comfortable little place on Polk, with pretty average Thai food for pretty cheap prices. Great for a late dinner since they open until 11PM.
author: Debbie C.

description:
I am playing hooky from work today since I'm feeling under the weather.... what will cheer me up?  That's right - THAI for lunch!!  I hop on Yelp to find a new place that will deliver during lunch.... Just my luck I see Modern Thai, and I can order online via Delivery.com... So far, so good right??  Well it just got a whole lot better.  Within 40 minutes I received the following at my door: 

1) Thai Iced Tea - still ice cold even after delivery, and not too sweet
2) BBQ Beef with a fab yummy sauce
3) Thai fried rice
4) Pad Thai with King Crab - the crab didn't taste that fresh, but noodles still yummy
5) Spicy mango chicken with steamed rice

I love it!!!  My Thai obsession continues, with a new place!  Now I am sick for a different reason (tummy too full).... :)
author: A B.

description:
Favorite Thai take-out!

Their brown/red/wild rice combo is stellar. Also, their food is not greasy, and I could believe that it is actually healthy in addition to being delicious.

This is four stars plus for take-out... never been to the restaurant, which I would certainly judge on a different five-point scale.
author: Sahra H.

description:
I've never eaten on-location, but I order from them quite often and they are reliably fast, precise, and polite - plus, they never complain if I want to substitute ingredients. :) 

They make a great Drunken Noodle and I have it on good advice that the pineapple fried rice is to die for.
author: Nicole L.

description:
This is our favorite Thai place. All the friends we have taken here love it.

 Start with Tom Kha soup to cheer you up right away. With mild coconut taste and mix of vegetables and tofu/meat it never lets you down. Then go for fresh spring rolls.

We follow above with fried rice, pad see ew, pad ki mao or green curry fried rice. Make sure you tell them the spice level you want.

The employees are super friendly and eager to please you.
author: m m.

description:
If I could give zero stars I would....

Some friends and I were going to see some music at Kimo's and needed to eat beforehand.  We figured we would give this place a try, I mean, how can you mess up Thai food right?  First off we were seated by the front door on the "patio" which was continually left open by everyone walking in and out.  I continually had to get up to shut it.  It was freezing.

After ordering, our WARM beers were brought to the table.  Shortly after, two of our dishes came immediately, while we waited on the other three.  Do we start without everyone having their food?  I tried not to but once I realized the food was close to cold I had to go for it.  It took forever for the other dishes to be delivered.

The food was GARBAGE.  Nobody enjoyed what they had.  Seeing as we all eat Thai food regularly there was no hiding the displeasure.  While in line for the restroom, someone clogged the toilet.  The busboy came running out yelling... "I need a fork... I need a fork!"  A FORK!?!?  Say What?  Could it get any worse?  Yes!

Our bill comes to the table and I am adding it up.  What?  20% gratuity for our party of 5?  Our waitress said that it was a policy of theirs.  We checked the menu and it stated that 18% gratuity would be added to the meal.  I tried to explain to these idiots that gratuity is calculated from the pre-taxed total but all of a sudden nobody spoke any English.  

To make a long story short... STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE.  Luckily we had fun over at Kimo's, but the night sure started off badly.  If this is what "Modern" Thai is... I will definitely keep it Traditional.  What a waste of $100.
author: Errand W.

description:
Solid Thai food and very fast delivery.  These guys are the masters of under-promise, over-deliver.  Typically they will tell you 45 minutes, and they are at the door in 20.  

The people are always very friendly, and as I mentioned, the food is great.
author: King O.

description: Unbelievable how long delivery takes and than I had to go downstairs and get it. Don't bother and way too expensive for what you get.
author: Gary M.

description:
We are locals (Marin) staying a few blocks away after Zinfest.  We were looking for a good place to eat nearby and happened on this through Yelp.  Wow....this will become a new destination in the City!

My husband and I started with the Chicken Satay and the Golden Bags.  The Golden Bags were outstanding.  Completely delectable.  The Satay could have had a bit more kick, but the seasoning on the chicken was fantastic.

Next, we had a special friedl rice to share.  Initially wasn't excited....that was until the rest of dinner came.  Hubby had Duck with Lychee.  I had Seared Scallops.  I am not  a huge fan of lychee, but paired with the duck, it was delicious.  The seared scallops were outstanding.  Both were in red curry, but the one with the duck was more savory and the one with the scallops had a sweeter flavor.  The Thai basil on top of the duck was perfect.  The scallops were tender, perfectly cooked and had bok choy with it in the dish.  Seriously, these were dishes to return for.  They were fantastic.  The rice paired beautifully with both.

As I said...it will be a new destination for us.  Pros....food is excellent...good neighborhood and the ambiance on the patio is fine.  Server was friendly.  Cons...service was a little slow, rice was brought out a fair amount of time before the other entrees and the server had a hard time with English.  Overall....I would come here again and again.....good thing we don't live nearby or we'd go broke and get fat(ter)...lol.  Already recommended it and  can't wait to go back.
author: Jon D.

description: Great restaurant.  Very tasty menu.  They take their time with delivery so I'll have to give them 4 stars.
author: John W.

description: I wander down to Modern Thai whenever I am in the area and hungering for Thai food. A fun spacious place to sit with friends. Love their staarter called golden bags!
author: Vanessa G.

description:
I went here on a date at the beginning of November; it was early so we were the only ones in the restaurant at first. The service was good and the staff was very attentive; they always had a smile on their faces and they did not rush us. We tend to talk a lot so dinner can easily take an hour or two. I like the extremely relaxed atmosphere and they even have some seating on the front patio so you can entertain yourself with the people that walk by.

He had the curry over brown rice and I had the roast duck with steamed rice, both were tasty. I will definitely be going back.
author: E P.

description:
In one word: solid.  This place is great for its inexpensive, dependable, consistently good Thai food and friendly service.  No frills or panache, but it is the one restaurant in Polk Gulch/TenderNob that won't skeeve out friends or visiting parents.  In addition to the good food, it has a patio and wine and beer.  You can't ask for more in the area.  

Well, maybe you can ask for the local crackhead denizens to act extra "cracked out" for your amusement but that is up to you.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
This past weekend i went to San Francisco with my family for my sisters 20th birthday.....
We went to Modern Thai on saturaday @ 9pm and it wasnt full...it was nice eating like that...
The food was delicious! my parents loved it. I would totally go there again if I'm in SF....
the fried bananas were the BEST! 
I got pad see iw....and Thai fried rice and cucumber salad...which my sister loved. In all we had fun and enjoyed our Dinner.
author: Evelyn A.

description:
Ordered some nice, simple yellow curry. It gets here, and it turns out rice is sold separately. This is like going to a burger joint and having to order the bun on the side. Guess I'm stuck with curry soup for dinner.

EDIT - Very good curry soup. Two more stars for you.
author: Chuck H.

description: This has become my go-to take out thai.  Good appetizers like spring rolls and crispy pumpkin, great noodle dishes.  I've never had something like the Singapore Noodles, they're great and so's their pad thai.
author: Ian S.

description: Ate lunch here while attending a conference.  Great food at a decent price.  Service was a bit slow though.
author: Chummy S.

description: walked in here and I really liked the decor, high ceilings and bright walls, makes the place seem bigger than it actually is. Had the Tom Ka soup, and beef pad Thai, the soup was very good, not cluttered by bamboo shoots and giants pieces of Ginger like at marnee Thai, the pad Thai was pretty good as well, could have been more flavorul but I liked that the pieces of beef were thick and not just little strips. In conclusion I would definetaly come back to this place.
author: Sergey A.

description: One of two places I'd really recommend in the neighborhood for Thai. Jarin on Ellis just down Polk is sick, but this place is just a small step up the ladder when it comes to creativity and atmosphere (and price). I'd also say that each have their own specialties. From what I've tried so far the curry and noodle dishes here are the way to go -- downright tasty.
author: k g.

description: 3.5 stars. Good prices, a few standout dishes and in a happenin' spot. Why only 3.5? It still had me hankering for my beloved Plearn in Berkeley. Maybe I'm just nostalgic for that place, but Modern Thai's curried pumpkin did not beat Plearn's. Went with a large group and service was very good, but I didn't like having to pass those heavy white dishes all the time. They were so heavy that a few of us mentioned it. What did stand out was the Mango Roast Duck with Lychee sauce and the chicken larb. Duck was fresh and meaty. The chicken larb was flavored quite nicely and I liked the brown rice. It was more of a purple rice, but it went well with all of our dishes. Pad Thai was overpowered and soggy with sauce. The seafood dish didn't stand out at all. So still not as good as my fave hole in the wall in Berkeley, but I would go again if I was in this neighborhood.
author: Farah S.

description:
I have been eating at Modern Thai since November of 2005. There was a time when I would drive from Half Moon Bay at least twice a week to have their Crispy Tofu Salad and Thai Iced Tea. Luckily, I work up the block now and don't have to commute to feed my habit. 

An overall review of the establishment would indicate consistent and delicious food, outstanding and friendly service, a great atmosphere, and  in a clean environment. 

I have NEVER had a bad meal here.

Special menu items to note:

Crispy Tofu Salad
Mango Sticky Rice
Fresh Spring Rolls
Pineapple Fried Rice
Pad Thai 
Thai Basil
Coconut Curry (any color)

PS They do great with groups. They did my brother's birthday, and my graduation flawlessly. Even picky eaters left satisfied on both occasions.
author: Laura M.

description: Thai food is supposed to be spicy, especially Pad Kee Mao (drunken noodles), which should be almost uncomfortably spicy. The Kao Soi here is fairly good but I think that Thai House Express has better.
author: David J.

description:
So for my first Thai restaurant it was alright.  The food was pretty good, i got egg fried rice w/fried chicken...but I could have walked down the street to the Chinese food place for that.  It was a lot like Chinese food, and I thought Thai food was nothing like Chinese food (or so I've heard).  I was more so looking for a place very authentic and what not, but i guess this is a somewhat Americanized Thai food place.  Well we ARE in America after all, but whatever.
ANNNNND i do have to agree, the tip calculator they use or i don't know what they use...but its MESSED UP.
They scam you on the freakin tip.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Super bomb kign crab thai, and marinated tofu plates. The thai tea is amazing, the music makes youw ant to dance, and the service is spectacular.
this place is a great compliment to CMC, if you've got the munchies.
hollar
author: Allen W.

description: Good, cheap Thai food. Excellent service. 3.5
author: Jimmy M.

description:
Wow.  What a nice little surprise..

We were walking through the 'loin before a show at the Great American Music Hall looking for a quick and easy place for some chow.  We decided it was going to be either Modern Thai or some sketchy burrito place on a corner.  We chose Modern Thai.

Yeah, yeah I don't know WHY this place is called Modern - it definitely is a little antiquated on the inside, with some weird mirror-like lattice on the walls. 

Decor aside the food was surprisingly delicious.  I had never heard of this place so I was a little nervous.. but yeah, very very yummy.  I was boring and had chicken fried rice, but it was good... friends had cashew chicken which was good and then I don't know what my other two friends had :) but they said both dishes were good.

Yum!  If you're in the 'loin, check out Modern Thai!
author: Derek B.

description:
Props to this place for getting me out of my green curry/pad thai shell. I consider myself adventurous with flavors, but when food is that good, you just stick to what works, right?

I ordered a pumpkin/tofu dish, and when I asked the waitress if it was wet enough to enjoy with rice, she said that it was. It didn't really work out  and ended up pretty bland, though I'm sure a lot of their other dishes are way better. I eyed Rye G's soupy dish the whole time, wishing I had ordered whatever it was instead. I might come back if I'm in the area, but there are a ton of Thai restaurants between there and my house.
author: Amy Z.

description:
A regular for me, after my yoga practice at close-by shop or after Alliance Francaise activities.

Singha + Trout lui-suan. Other choices too, left for you to fill in yourself.

Their tap water tastes awesome. I always shamelessly ask them to refill my water bottle from my yoga class :-)
author: Zehr S.

description: Probably the worst Thai food I've had in the city. I know this will probably get filtered but I've never had such a bad experience to be compelled to write a negative review. The food and service were both terrible. If you want bad food and bad service for a hog price, this is the place for you.
author: Monica G.

description:
This is a cute little spot on Polk St with a quirky room, brightly colored menus and walls, and some decent food.

But I'm not really loving on Modern Thai.  Upon arriving, I beat my two dining companions and mentioned to the person who greeted me that I was just there to have a drink, so I had a seat at the bar that is just inside the entrance.  No one asked me if I wanted a drink (someoe else at the bar had a glass of wine in hand), but I just sat there.  Eventually, I was brought water.  Thanks.

I ended up staying for a meal, which was prety standard Thai food - nothing to rave about, but also not poor.  The crispy pumpkin appetizer was not all that crispy, and the chicken satay subpar.  We had a green curry (very spicy, but pretty darn good!), a Thai basil dish with shrimp (though they brought us pork the first time around - oops), and the pad see ew/iew/eiw featured overcooked chicken.  Ups and downs, you might say.

Wine selection by the glass is a bit limited, but they have a decent selection of south Asian beer.  

I've heard that this is a better spot for lunch than for dinner, so keep that in mind.
author: Evan G.

description: Great place to go.  We went with five people and they had no problem fitting us in.  The crew there is always very kind and helpful.  The place has high ceilings so not a lot of conversation bleed. We ordered the combination appetizers.  Very tasty, and I think just enough for four people to get either one item or a half of one item.  We ordered the pumpkin curry with chicken - excellent as always. Lots of flavor, great texture - thick and creamy. The pad thai was just right, not too sweet.  We also got the vegies and peanut sauce.  Decent dish, but a little on the bland side. As for Spicy, I asked for one dish to be Thai spice and I think they thought I was joking becuase the food was only somewhat spicy. I didn't even breakout in a sweat.
author: Ryan A.

description: I think the pumpkin curry and yellow curries are amazing; however the fried rice was just "ok". The service was excellent and ambiance is great:).
author: claire F.

description: Love the Pineapple Fried Rice!!! The pumpkin curry is also good, the coconut shrimp, pineapple curry. So good! And the restaurant is super cute, with bright color painted walls, with cute flower arrangements on the table. Great place to have a casual date in.
author: Nic P.

description:
I'm going to start by saying that this place serves rice in the shape of a heart, and I find that utterly charming and wonderful. Mostly because this is where my boyfriend and I come for our "date-nights"...when they happen. 

Modern Thai feels really clean and bright. I love that they have covered outdoor and indoor seating, because sometimes the weather is too nice to 
be inside. My boyfriend is veggie, so this place has a ton of options for him (almost anything with meat can be subbed for tofu and veggies). We are both a huge fan of the eggplant and tofu, as well as the pad thai. The service has always been incredibly prompt and the waiters give you space without feeling like they are inattentive. I think this is what makes the atmosphere so nice. It feels like you can have a normal conversation without the awkwardness of listening to other people/having them listening to you. Also, we choose the eat the meals family style, and find that ordering 2-3 entrees is enough for us to have leftovers for later, plus it lets you sample more of the menu when you are splitting everything.  

Overall, great quality food, and even if it isn't my favorite thai food in the world, it is definitely my favorite thai place within a 5 block radius of my house :).
author: Jessica B.

description: Update: This place has changed a lot since I lived in the neighborhood. The interior's been totally redone, the bathrooms are way nicer now and it's got this colorful vibe going on. What's really impressive though is that the prices and the recipes are still the same.
author: Maxine Y.

description: Actually, Modern Thai is good even with high expectations!  I am hooked on the ground chicken with chinese olives over rice at the moment.  Delicious!!
author: Wakako U.

description: Lovely atmosphere, wonderfully delicious food, prompt and thoughtful service.  When I want Thai this is where I go, and I've been coming here for several years.  I'm fortunate, too, because I live in the neighborhood.  I met Don, one of the owners, today and he is a delightful gentleman who sees to it that guests are comfortable, feel welcome and have a great dining experience.  Nice chatting with you Don!
author: Michael T.

description:
Wouldn't order again ... we waited over an hour for delivery and when it came, the food was not good.

I find that I judge Thai places based on the tom kha gai soup, and I didn't even taste the soup when it came. Usually we get chicken, but we opted for veggie/tofu this time...bad decision. Weird veggies (broccoli?), no mushrooms, and overpowering tomatoes. 

The red curry with mixed seafood tasted decent, although the "mixed seafood" included a lot of calamari (slightly fishy) and empty mussel shells? For $5 extra dollars! 

The cashew chicken was lightly fried I think. Couldn't quite figure out what was going on with the texture. It tasted OK though, but it was a bit on the dry side.

Bottom line, it was edible but nothing great.

UPDATE: I appreciate that I got a message on Yelp from the restaurant and that they take suggestions/criticisms from the community seriously. Half star added to my review for their offer of a discount for my next order should I want to try them again!
author: Jen W.

description:
My boyfriend and I enjoyed this place.  The decor was different from any other Thai restaurant I have ever been to (fancier with bright paint on the walls).  The service was great and the food proved to be pretty good.  I wouldn't say it was the best Thai I've had, but, like I said, it was pretty good.

The portions are large--my boyfriend and I split an order of vegetarian rolls and the Pad Thai and we were good to go.  Prices were reasonable too.
author: Claire S.

description:
I'd probably classify this place as being in the TL more then Nob Hill. Regardless, the food was excellent, the service was fantastic and the prices were beyond reasonable. 

The decor and ambiance of this place was really nice, so it's nice date place (if you're on a budget). 

Oh and you must check out the bathrooms. So clean and very modern.  A bathroom really tells a lot about a place.
author: Rana A.

description:
The staff here is incredibly nice and the food is great too. The food is full of flavor and an incredible value. My only gripe with the food is that it is never as spicy as I'd like it to be. 

If spice isn't your thing, this place is probably a 5-star.
author: yoni s.

description: Quite good food for the price.  The noodle dishes were good but not spicy enough for me.  The curry dishes were flavorful.  The space is pretty nice for a relatively small restaurant.  The service was friendly and attentive.
author: Josh H.

description: YUM. YUM. and MORE yum. I've tried thai places all over the city and these guys are one of my top 2 (Tong Yong Thai Cafe is my other)  :)
author: Meg C.

description: I definitely recommend this place. We ordered the fresh spring rolls, then beef pad thai and yellow sea (seafood yellow curry). The service was very good and the price was very reasonable.
author: Gerardo A.

description: Very solid food at a fantastic price.  Service was prompt and polite, atmosphere was clean and professional.  Will definitely be visiting Modern Thai again some time soon.
author: Justin A.

description:
I forgot to take a pic of the heart-shaped rice serving...lol

I give it 4.5 stars; the 1/2 isn't really their fault...it's the parking, but parking just plain sucks in general in this neck of the gulch...

I'm so not mad at this place...I have yet to have a bad food experience here!!!  The food's fresh & delish...The pad thai's good, love the peanut sauce & the green curry (but you really can't go wrong with anything mixed with coconut milk; the yellow's pretty good, too!).  The portions are great for what you pay...I give this 3 snaps UP, with a twist!!!
author: Amoura B.

description:
I've been here a few times, dine-in and carry out, and have never been overly impressed. It's tasty enough, but nothing that a dozen other Thai places within 5 blocks can't offer. 

They do have a cute little outdoor seating area...though on Polk Street, I'm not sure I want to eat that close to the sidewalk.
author: Lara L.

description:
A reasonably priced menu and great service!  I live around the corner from them and I often go really late at night.  They never rush me out and that are always so attentive.  It's difficult to find a nice restaurant that seats people after 9:45 in SF, but this place does it!

The food is good.  It's def Thai food for an American eater.  Nothing too spicy or extreme.  It's mild.  But they always deliver great service and good food.
author: Iggy R.

description: You know what?  Yes, this place deserves five whole stars.  It's not super fancy, but damn is it good.  Every dish is delicious, they know how to pile on the spice, and it is incredibly, and I mean INCREDIBLY, affordable.  Probably the best bang-for-the-buck Thai place I have been to.
author: Steve G.

description: fresh ingredients, great sauce for the uber fresh shrimp spring rolls, pad thai was yummy and full of veggies and tofu.  the green curry was great, a little runny for me, but still awesome.  they delivered within an hour on a rainy san francisco evening
author: Laura M.

description: Best Thai on Polk Street (and there's a *lot* of Thai on Polk St.!) and possibly my favorite in SF.  I think I am addicted to their Ground Chicken with preserved Chinese Olive dish.  The ambiance is quite nice and the staff is very attentive while not being intrusive or obnoxious, making Modern Thai equally suitable for random drop-ins and for dates.
author: Will W.

description: Loud music, curt service, but a great pumpkin red curry.
author: Robert P.

description: Went here on a whim after watching a ballgame at McTeagues, and I would have rather saved myself the $20 I just spent as I went home hungry.  I ordered pad se you, and it was just plain awful.  I'm not one who wants to pay $20 for a dish that clearly has vegetables that came from a Del Monte processing plant either.  Likewise, it just didn't taste good.  My friends dish was equally as bad.  I ended up my dish and putting it out for a homeless person to eat, but I'm venturing to say that they too wouldn't have wanted to eat what was available to them.
author: Lisa M.

description: YUM YUM YUMMMMMMMMM. This place is everything that Osha Thai is but less expensive and less dressy. Way to go Modern Thai!
author: Olivia G.

description: 1 hour and 45 min  delivery... my curry finally comes and I discover there is no rice after the delivery guy leaves... prompting me to call: "rice is extra". "well why didn't you tell me that when I ordered? Rice has ALWAYS been included, EVERYWHERE I have ever gotten curry from"... "sorry, do you want rice now?".."yes"..."sorry we're closed"
author: Rebecca M.

description: Great iced thai tea! The food is good! Big portions
author: Patty V.

description:
A friend of mine took me to Modern Thai after a movie at AMC Van Ness.  She raved, and I have to say, it did not disappoint.  I try a new thing every time I go, but the spring rolls are a must.  

The best news, they deliver to Russian Hill!  Sorry Lemongrass, I've found found a new Thai delivery joint.
author: Julie E.

description: Great pad thai!  A lot of Thai restaurants have way too much sauce in theirs but this was just right.   The egg rolls were amazing and the prices were very reasonable.  I will definitely be coming back here!
author: Sireenah M.

description:
Excellent value for a weekday lunch, however the portions dwindle and the prices increase for dinner, natch. So I stick to the lunch or at dinner, I risk going head-to-head for that last piece of fried basil and tofu. 

They do no wrong in my eyes. Best bets: rice plates. Chicken with eggplant; chicken pra-gow and any of the "Tom" soups. Lemongrass... mmmmhrmmm...
author: Genevieve R.

description:
I think that Modern Thai is one of those places that seems pretty decent while you're in the restaurant but when stripped down of decor, presentation and service, the food just really isn't up to par....in fact, I'm getting a stomach ache as I write this.  

The pad thai was a bland lump of congealed rice noodles.  The calamari was extremely rubbery but gets points for its excellent fried-chicken-esque batter.  And the string beans --- once I got past the spice, I couldn't taste anything else.

If given a choice, I'd think I'd go somewhere else.   Prices were really cheap here though!
author: Guava C.

description:
Me and friend went to this place for dinner, and I have to say that it was a good choice.  Average prices and good lunch deals for those lunch time people. The decor is subtly sophisticated with fauna, and simple white and reds accenting the walls. The curry is great and the steamed trout is great and cooked perfectly.  Much like all Chinese restaurant I've been to, you can order a pot of white rice (which makes me feel at home).
The location is busy local spot without the cacophony of laughing and screaming some of the other places and the wait staff is attentive and quick (they told us that the trout would take 20-25 minutes, but they kept us update on it's status frequently). Great, great place!
author: Stan H.

description: Great food, Great price, nice open ambiance, will definitely be my first stop the next time I'm back in SF!
author: Derek W.

description: After a couple bad experiences with thai food, I almost gave up, until I stumbled across modern thai. The decor was so cute with bright vibrant colors splashed on the walls. The place was very clean and did not smell which is very important. The food was really good my favorite are the v rolls with this special sweet sauce, and the pineapple fried rice was good too, I love this place and will definitely come again.
author: Sadie L.

description: Great food, great service.  Pad See Ewe is terrific.  My 6 year old loved her Satay and the noodles too.  Love the decor.
author: Matt W.

description: We stopped by this place twice while in SF on vacation.  It was good enough to go back.   The food seemed to be standard Thai/American fare and it was clean enough.  Service was fine and the prices were Ok.  I think it's worth a visit.
author: A S.

description: Been here a bunch of times and the food has always been good. Drunken noodle, papaya salad, chicken curry and their brown rice is top notch.  It's located right on polk, so there are a lot of thai options but this along with ozone are my favorites.
author: Ka C.

description:
OMG. I've found my new go to restaurant for nights I don't feel like cooking. Not as cheap as some of the other places on polk, but the couple dollar difference is definitely worth it. Take out is fast (especially if you call it in!) OR they deliver. Can't beat that. 

Everything I've had here is awesome, and they are open fairly late on weekends. Win-win.
author: Lizzie S.

description: Ok, the food isn't all traditionally Thai but it's pretty good. I've especially enjoyed the stir fried vegetables with tofu or shrimp, which is spicier than you expect (though not volcanic, by any means). The pineapple rice is muy yum, the scallops special was tasty and well-prepared (and scallops are easy to ruin), and the fried pumpkin appetizer was yum, too. I've also ordered off the menu online and they're fairly prompt. The restaurant ambiance makes for a pleasant dinner and they're good for takeout when you're too tired after work to cook. I'm a fan.
author: Susan S.

description:
Ordered from Modern Thai tonight and was hugely disappointed.  The pineapple fried rice was extremely bland and had only 4 mini shrimp.  My boyfriend says the beef noodle soup was ok... but the appetizer was the worst.  We ordered hoi jor (ground pork and crabmeat wrapped in tofu skin) and it tasted like fishy deep fried spam and the plum sauce was missing.  

I'll never go here/order from here again.
author: Erin D.

description:
I really wanted to like this place but it just wasn't worth it. The decor is beautiful but the food was just so mediocre... green curry with brocolli and cabbage in it? Filler... dry duck... bad thai ice tea. 

Pass
author: Tiffany T.

description:
We picked this place out of 3 other choices from Zagat's guide, and I don't regret the choice -- given the other ones -- although it was nothing special.

I'm not a Thai food person, to start with, but I don't mind having it, and will always try to stick to the same place, so at least I can compare it to other places I've been to. So, again, I had the vegetarian pad-thai, and to my surprise it was kind of tasteless. To add some novelty, though, I also ordered the mild coconut soup, and that was a hit! I offered my friends to taste it, and so I wasn't able to get all the soup to myself, as they would keep asking me for more!

One of my friends ordered the salmon with mild yellow curry sauce. I tried a bit of the sauce (even though I'm a vegetarian) and it was delicious. My other friend had a shrimp dish with curry sauce, unfortunately too spicy for her taste.

The restaurant was mostly empty, so we didn't have to wait much for the food. The waitress were nice and helpful, considering that my friends could speak little english, and she was the most patient to get our order.

Not sure if I'd come back here, just because I'm not a big Thai food fan, but I'd recommend it.
author: Andrea G.

description:
Good Thai food in a very comfortable setting.  This restaurant is only a block south on Polk Street from another good Thai place (Chai-Yo), but is far more spacious and the staff seem nicer and more gracious.  Once inside, you are in a roomy and nicely decorated place with high ceilings, and not packed in like sardines, so you can enjoy a nice intimate conversation.  The food is terrific and so is the service.  I particularly like the pra-ram chicken and the beef salad.  They also have a nice assortment of desserts.  

It's not in the most upbeat neighborhood around, but my girlfriend and I have always felt safe.  Prices are reasonable.  We've taken visitors from out of town and they've all loved the place!  

They take care to make the experience appealing.  They even put flowers in the perfectly-mainained restrooms.
author: Bob S.

description: Loved the food, especially the crispy pumpkin appetizer. Really good thai food for the price and definitely worth going to at least once. Had the thai basil and green curry fried rice for dinner, both with shrimp. I've had a lot of thai food and this was definitely one of the better restaurants I've been to in all aspects: service, food, atmosphere, etc. Even the bathrooms were clean and nice. Good for a casual date or getting a small group together for dinner. Blargh so full.
author: Wayne B.

description: Great thai food, trendy decor, balcony sitting is nice.
author: vincent c.

description: Slightly better than middle of the road.  The one thing I noted was that unlike many other Thai places, the spices and saltiness was more controlled.  Too many people equate super strong flavors as being good food.  Those are also the same people who sauce up all their dishes with soy sauce and sriracha sauce...
author: Laurence H.

description: I did NOT expect Modern Thai to be as awesome as it was.  My Tom Kha soup was tangy, bursting with the flavors of lemongrass and coconut.  The green curry was the best I have ever had.  The experience of savoring the green curry was like drinking fine wine...Upon contact with my taste buds I could immediately detect the spicy green curry, then I could taste the basil with a subtle hint of lemongrass, followed by a smooth and creamy coconut finish.  All vegetables were cooked to perfection.  So was the rice.  I never knew rice could be so perfect.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  And they deliver (within a limited area and a $15 minimum).
author: Kandi K.

description: This was my first time trying this place and we ordered delivery.  We were told 35-45 minutes and it arrived in 30.  Impressed already!  We just had the beef pad see ew and the pumpkin curry with chicken and I thought both were very good.  The pad see ew had regular broccoli instead of Chinese broccoli which I thought was okay (I really love Chinese broccoli).  The pumpkin curry was really excellent.  Just spicy enough and they add green beans which I thought was a nice addition.  After craving pumpkin curry for a week, I was definitely satisfied.  Will absolutely order from them again.
author: Carrie L.

description: This place is great!  We ordered basil tofu for appetizers and Tom yum soup followed by green curry and chow mein.  Everything came real quick and tAsted very good.  I loved the food, service and the price.
author: Naren A.

description: Went to Modern Thai today for lunch with my fun lunch companion, Lien. Nice. Bright well furnished dining room, friendly, accomodating staff. We shared a  window seat and pad thai (tofu), thai basil (chicken) and V rolls. All were good if not a little basic. A good sweet basil taste in the chicken. Things were a little slow but that suited us fine since we were chatting away. All in all a nice lunch experience that made me likety to return if I'm in that neighborhood. Not the best Thai food in the city I am sure, but a good basic Thai spot.
author: Richard A.

description: Great find!  I tried this place because we were going to see a band nearby, and chose this based on Yelp reviews.  All of the food was very good, as was the sake.  The place is fairly small, service was attentive though not really friendly.  I do think it's tacky that they have notices all over the walls about not accepting coupons, that seems odd and even though I was not a coupon holder, I believe they should honor any coupons they had originally agreed to.  Besides that, we had a great dinner and I would return to try out more food.
author: Elizabeth F.

description: I'm so surprised to see a such high rating for this restaurant. I wanted to this restaurant for dinner on last Friday. Food is not good at all. It's more like American food. It's not really Thai authentic food. Yellow Curry is too sweet, Tom Yum soup is too plain. I'm really disappointed. I will never go back their again. Service is really slow. I waited for long time just for 3 dishes. Plus, it's not really kids friendly restaurant.
author: Jo Jo C.

description: I'd give this place 3.5 stars.  Although all the dishes were good--nothing really stood out from other thai restaurants I've tried in LA and Orange County.  I ordered the Thai Basil dish with shrimp and it had too many onions, not enough peppers and not spicy enough for me (the shrimp was very good and perfectly cooked).  However, I did try my friend's pineapple fried rice which I liked better than my dish.  My friends seemed to really like their tom ka soup and green curry.  Our waitress was very friendly and the decor is cute and clean.  With thai ice teas all around, the bill came out around $45.
author: Leslie C.

description: Food was so-so. Over priced for what we got. Everything was just sweet. Sweet over sweet over sweet. Kind of an overload
author: Yaj R.

description: Yay, I'm a fan indeed. It's located on the slightly sketchier end of Polk St., but whatever, once you go in, you kinda do feel like you're in a restaurant in Bangkok - they've paid attention to the interior design and architecture of the restaurant, and I love, love, the high ceilings inside. There are good Thai places along Polk from the Tenderloin to the Marina, but I really do enjoy this place - a notable favorite is their Mango + Chicken curry - highly recommended. I'm also very happy that the food is pretty cheap here compared to other Thai restaurants on Polk. Great neighborhood spot.
author: Sonja L.

description:
Modern Thai was not the best Thai I had ever had but all 8 of us really enjoyed our meal, the service was very nice, and I was quite content after the meal. I can't say I'd go out of my way to eat here again but if I was in the area and hungry I'd definitely drop in.

Get the brown rice, and go with a few friends and dine family-style so you can try a range of dishes. Two of our meals (a duck curry and the salmon with vegetables) were very plain and not that great, so it was really nice to have a range of options to choose from. The chicken larb was super tasty - I think if I had only gotten the larb and nothing else I may have considered a 4 star review.
author: Sari C.

description: Decent thai food but a little on the salty side. Their curries are flavorful, and their stir frys are also good. Just drink a lot of water....
author: Amy W.

description: I ordered in from this restaurant and really enjoyed my meal. Really fast delivery. The Wonton and BBQ pork Noodle Soup had a great flavor. The Pad Kee Mao was spicy and delicious.
author: Michael S.

description: stay away from this place. At first I thought their food was delicious- but after my second time coming here, I think they put way too much MSG. My lips were seriously burning and I was very thirsty after my meal. The headache I got when I got home from the restaurant made the whole experience even worse. There are better Thai places out there that are delicious and don't use MSG.
author: Christian E.

description:
Modern Thai is something of an overlooked gem along Polk Street. There are many Thai restaurants along this stretch but this is certainly one of my favorite ones. There are a couple of reasons why:

(1) Simple but delicious food. My favorite is the ground chicken with fresh olives, lime and basil (I think). It comes on a bed of warm rice and is absolutely delish. It's one of their specialties and is affordably priced (less than $10) as is the rest of the menu.

(2) Different seating options. you can choose al fresco dining if you so wish or if Polk Street traffic is getting to you there is always the tastefully decorated 'inside' of the restaurant.

(3) Friendly service. My favorite is the ever-smiling waitress who does not tire of trying to teach me to say 'thank you' in Thai. Let's just say I'm not the world's foremost linguist...

All in all, a very pleasant experience.
author: Felix P.

description:
Just got some delivery through Eat24Hours.com. I live closer to Thai House on Geary but decided to give Modern Thai a shot. 

I ordered:

a) Hoi Jor---  Gross. Supposed to be pork & crab wrapped in a tofu skin. 
                        Was actually a WAY overfried, probably prepackaged greasy
                        mystery meat / eggroll product hacked into 6 1-inch pucks. 
                        Pieces 2 thru 6 were useful however in tagging roaches 
                        from across the room.

b)  Rainbow Crispy Trout--- Funky. Was taking a risk with this one, but the
                       Yelpers seemed to like this place, so I wanted to put them
                       to the test. Menu says "deep fried whole rainbow trout with
                       green apple salad". While it may have been trout at one 
                       time, if you've had fresh trout you wouldn't recognize this 
                       bastard. Would have been better if they just took the original 
                       asian product they started with (sweet, smoky, bbq-ish) and
                       didn't fry it with a crappy batter and bury it under an over-
                       acidic, mutilated, raw garlic / ginger / onion "salad" that had 
                       no apples. Only partake if you're craving a salty-sunbaked-
                       roadkill-covered-in-compost experience. Steeeee--rike 2.

c) Roasted Duck Noodle Soup--- 1/2 inch of oil on the top, 3 pieces of
                      flavorless duck in a flavorless broth, spiced rice noodles on
                      the side. 

The total came to 33 buck (including a few coke, 2 comped for being out of palm juice). Not bad if they could cook. I'll give them another shot in a couple months, but for now I'm goin back ta Thai house for the #33 (ground pork soup 'n veg) and the yellow curry chicken.
author: Foolis H.

description: I have ordered from that place 5 times. On 4 of them they delivered something wrong or they missed smth. I am giving it 3 starts instead of 4 bc of that. Next time you order from them, make sure everything is correct! Also, the service on the phone is just terrible!!! Next time I'm finding a new Thai place to order from. Nice way to lose clients.
author: Emily M.

description: Good, cheap, reliable Thai food in the 'hood, with the added bonus of delivery.  Now that this place has opened I'll never overpay for take-out from Osha again!
author: Kelly D.

description: I came here with a group of 10 people and we all left full and satisfied! The food was amazing, the service super friendly and it all came out quickly. I got the Veggie red curry and I must say, having recently been in Thailand, it made me very nostalgic and ready to go back. Can't ask for much else in my Thai food. Pretty decent prices too!
author: Greg G.

description: OUTSTANDING Thai.  Definitely the best I've ever had, and I consider myself a connoisseur of Thai food.  Damn, I can't stop talking about it, and I told 2 friends about it already.  I ordered delivery so I can't speak to the decor of the restaurant, but this nice little Asian man arrived at my hotel room with a smile on his face.  Delivery was very fast, too.  The portion sizes are generous and the flavors are layered and so yummy.  I had the chicken satay and the Pad Se Ew with chicken (my good ol standbys).  I look forward to going back there and eating at the restaurant.  Way, way better than other restaurants in SF including Osha and a few other reputable ones.  Prices are very reasonable, too.
author: Jen M.

description: I wanted to like you -- I really, really did. But in the end, my love of 'modern' remains limited to my living room furniture. The menu descriptions all *sounded* delicious, but fell short. For example, the Hoi Jor was like cardboard, whereas the Pad Thai was sticky and gelatinous. I will say that they did an awesome job of adding some serious heat to the Tom Kha for me ... and if I were handing out stars for presentation alone, it'd be a fiver. But pretty food doesn't equal tasty food. Sigh.
author: Gregor G.

description: I stopped by here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised! They have great food, service & the ambiance is casual & room is airy. They also serve my fave brown rice.
author: Mamma B.

description: So there are about 4 or 5 thai restaurants in a one block radius. This one is at the top of the list. The ambiance was contemporary enough that their name is no misrepresentation.
