Vibrant colors paint the wall and vibrant foods cover the menu. The prices were good at about $10 per person for most entrees at dinner. How cool is that?! I had the pineapple fried rice with chicken and shrimp while my date had tofu with curry and noodles. I will be returning to this place.
author: Stafford J.

description:
Overall, Yelp has enhanced my life.  But there are the occasional downsides.  I've become crippled when it comes to trying new places, absolutely unable to try anything that hasn't got four or more stars from at least fifty reviewers.  I can't even order a dish I've had before at a restaurant I know myself to be good without wondering if somewhere in its reviews another Yelper has revealed a superior dish.  I was already on the phone giving my order when I read Cheryl L's assertion that the veggie pad thai was better than the pad see-ew I had planned on ordering.  I gave the rest of my order to the lady on the phone very slowly while I desperately scanned the other reviews for a second opinion, but eventually had to just go ahead and order the pad see-ew.  She was right, it wasn't that great.  But would I have even felt that way if I hadn't been prejudiced against it before it even arrived at my door?  Maybe I actually liked the dish.  I just don't know anymore!

One thing I do know for sure is that their sticky black rice with mango wasn't sweet enough and it was too dry.  I liked the black rice with its rougher texture, but it really needed some sort of sauce like they put on the sweet sticky rice at Osha.

The other couple of dishes I had were very unremarkable.  So unremarkable that, just a couple days later, I have no idea what one of them was.
author: Lauren C.

description: Just ate here with seven close friends.  We came kind of late, but they still accommodated us.  The food here is excellent!  I love the pineapple fried rice and the Pad Sew.  The decor is bright and colorful.  They have a little enclosed patio area which is a great place to sit and people watch.  I like that they play soft techno music in the background.  Nice place to go with friends or get take out.
author: Kate J.

description: Amazing cocnut shrimp, and yummy sticky rice dessert!
author: Audrey B.

description:
i've been to many thai restaurant in sf and this place is ten steps above the rest based on decor alone! with high ceilings and large mirrors, modern thai looks twice... three times as spacious than the average thai eatery. this doesnt even include the patio seating out front, great for summer lunching. 
besides the splash of hot pink and bright green on the walls (which by the way works.... it didnt hurt my eyes one bit!) modern thai is not over done and weight down by wall to wall ethnic art and ornaments indicating "authenticity"  ( however, i do enjoy because it's something to look at.) 

for all this roominess and loveliness, the price is still reasonable. we ordered:
* crispy pumpkin with sesame
* pad thai
* thai fried rice combo (comes with calamari, pork, beef, chicken, and shrimp)
* sticky rice with mango

everything was yummy... i would suggest skipping the combo plates (doesnt sound/ look very speacial) and ordering specifics dishes. the highlight was the crispy pumpking...it wasn't oily and it tasted a bazillion times better than Quickly's yam/ sweet potate fries (badly made, with sugar...are you kidding?)

Menu had lots to chose from...a delicious sounding vegetarian selection and on top of that several dishes that included pumpkin...and it's not even in season! i LOVE pumpkin!!!
author: Lynn T.

description: Stopped in here last night.  Damn, I think the whole staff was high on happy pills.  They seemed genuinely happy to see us walk in there and even happier to see us sit down at a table.  This made me suspect that this was a restaurant that wasn't used to having visitors.  The truth, however, is that the staff is very accomodating...and very, very happy for whatever reason.  The food was pretty good and also reasonably priced.  They have two kinds of Thai beer as well.  Good stuff.
author: Joe F.

description: This is the best Thai food in the city.  My wife and I have eaten at over 7 different Thai restaurants in San Francisco and Modern Thai is by far the best.  Our favorites here are Thai Fried Rice, Basil Chicken, and Golden tofu.
author: Matthew S.

description: I am a very mean nasty person when I don't eat.  I snap at everyone and can barely keep my sarcastic comments in check.  Thank goodness Modern Thai delivers delicious food quickly. This is my new go-to place for Thai delivery, a restaurant that actually makes the food extra extra hot like I like it (and not just the sorry excuse for spicy that I get at most places).  The Pumpkin Curry is delicious, but I usually opt for my comfort food of Pad Ke Mao.  In restaurant dining is good too as the restaurant has attentive service and is never overly crowded.  So when I am having a low blood sugar meanness fit, I turn to Modern Thai to fix me right up.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I like simple Thai food and found that not to be the case here. I think they take your preferences in their order, but it didn't over-impress me. My hubby ordered something "thai hot" and it was definitely spicy (I could smell it from my seat). I just wasn't impressed with their menu, although they had many choices.
author: Nancy B.

description: Came to lunch with my friends last week.  Service was slow.  The thing that you try at thai restaurants to see if they are good or not, you try their pad thai.  It's should be the signature dish.  The pad thai was thin and falling apart.  We also ordered a couple of rice plates and the chicken and beef was dry.  The curry flavor was not bad, but again, the chicken was too dry.  The crab fried rice had no flavor.  The cashew nut chicken was just too sweet.  I don' t think I'm coming back to this place.
author: AhLin C.

description: We came in for desserts and it was delicious, our waitress was very knowledgeable - ambiance was nice.  We will be back!
author: Liz Y.

description:
I love this place for the cleanliness and service.  Food comes fast, water is always refilled, and waiters are always checking on you.  This used to be my stop for late night bites, but they've revised their hours.

I love their blueberry roti dessert and that's mainly what keeps me coming back.  I also like the pad see ew here.  It tastes a little more eggy than most, and isn't so sweet that I get sick from eating too much of it.

Overall a great place for a quick and cheap bite!
author: jessica l.

description: Decent delivery food.  Pad See Ew was good, but I'll probably skip the tofu appetizer next time.
author: Katie S.

description:
The food was good, but not great; mostly because the flavors were muddled and lacked the dynamic spark I expect from great Thai.

Spicy basil eggplant was not spicy or garlic-y at all. It was only sweet.

Pad Thai was above average but nothing special.

Yellow curry was the best of the three, but could have been much more flavorful. But I'll admit it hit home in the comfort food department.

The portion to price ratio was pretty generous, but I'd rather spend a few bucks more at Thai Basil and satisfy my craving.

The restaurant was cute, the people were nice and my order was ready on time (pick up).
author: Sarah G.

description:
This is a lovely place to eat, a spacious high-ceilinged restaurant with bright decor and very good service. Many of the dishes are pretty standard Thai fare (pad thai, yellow curry, and pad see ew, for example, are going to be about what you'd get anywhere), but they have a few standouts: I love their crispy calamari stir-fry with cashews, and they use a special kind of brown rice with fat, almost purple-colored grains that's really delicious. They have a beef noodle soup that's kind of like pho, with a Thai twist I guess, and their barbeque pork soup with dumplings and egg noodles is super hangover food. They have lunch specials too.

So basically, what would be a three-star restaurant gets an extra star for lovely ambiance, very good service, and a few extras on the menu that make it worth a trip. We also get our delivery from them now, because we want to support the restaurant. There's a million Thai places in the neighborhood, but this one stands out.
author: Shannon P.

description: I love Modern Thai! The food is consistently good, the service is efficient and friendly, and the atmosphere is colorful and pleasant. With so many Thai options in the city I've tried several, but Modern Thai is by far my favorite overall...and when you ask for something spicy - they actually make it spicy :)
author: Dianna B.

description:
the deliver (later than other nearby thai restaurants).  the food is consistently good, and they hardly ever screw up my (off beat) order (more than i can say for other thai places).

i really want to try the basil tofu, it sounds better than the crispy tofu.

not my favorite thai place in san francisco, but modern thai is very convenient.
author: Karen R.

description:
Outside looks a bit run down but the inside is quite the opposite - nice and trendy.  We got here really late so it was really quiet and chill.  A nice environment to enjoy a really fufilling lunch.  The menu was unique.  So much so that it inspired me to be a bit more adventurous than I normally am and order out of my zone.  Between two, we went with:
-Crispy tofu appetizer with peanut sauce and sweet and sour
-Sauteed pumpkin with pork (It's pumpkin, garlic, chili, bell pepper, egg, and basil leaves)
-Pineapple seafood curry
There was something about the sauteed pumpkin that caught my eye and I never order pumpkin.  I was pretty impressed.  It was a good mix of ingredients.  I enjoyed the pineapple seafood curry although I must say the addition of peas was a little peculiar.  We ordered medium spiciness and it was pretty hot.  We were able to finish most of the food, which would explain my lack of appetite during dinner time.

As I've said before, the service at Thai restaurants are ALWAYS exceptional so nothing different here.  The waitress and busboy were really sweet, attentive, and prompt.  They gave their helpful input yet allowed room to decide as they had so many good entrees to choose from.  I would recommend this place if you're near the TL/Russian Hill.
author: Jess C.

description:
This is a review of their delivery service.  Basically, I had a pretty bad experience one Sunday night.  I ordered my usual favorites and was told that it would be 30 minutes, but may take up to 45 minutes.  

No prob, I think.  45 minutes go by, than an hour, than an hour, fifteen.  I finally call, just to check-in.  The mean lady on the phone doesn't bother checking any of my info (name, number, address) but insists it'll be there within 20 minutes because "they got busy."  I point out that this makes it over 45 minutes late and politely suggested they consider calling people if there's an unusual delay.  With no apology whatsoever, she tells me that I don't have to accept the food when it finally arrives.

Really, her big solution to serving me late food is for me to not get any food at all?!?

The food finally arrives an hour and 45 minutes from the time I called and a full hour later than she quoted.  I wish I had more principle but out of hunger, I paid for the damn noodles and ate them.  But I will not be ordering from them again.
author: amy y.

description: Not a bad lunch spot, they have all of these specials for one price (like $7 or so) that all looked very tempting. I settled on the green curry, which I have to admit, was a little lackluster and was lacking chicken. Now I'm super white when it comes to spices and curries, but man, this wasn't spicy at all. Which coming from me means it must have been kind of bland. Nobody was in the place which meant we got our choice of seats, and that was nice. But we only swung in here because we were running errands for work on lunch, so it's definitely a vicinity place, not a destination.
author: Michael E.

description: I love the extensive menu and salad choices. The interior is bright and garden-like. They have an old piano and framed pictures of national leaders as part of their decor.  Modern Thai is a nice choice for group dining.
author: Evelyn B.

description: My former go-to Thai place was Thai Spice on Polk. However, the last 3 times I ordered from there, the quality had slipped to the point that I couldn't order from there again (I so didn't want to admit to myself that I would need a new place). It was quite fortuitous that my next book club meeting was at Modern Thai. Everything I ordered was wonderful-delicious pumpkin curry, tom kha soup, and spring rolls. The restaurant itself is cheerful and the service was great. A week later I ordered delivery and was so pleased. The pineapple fried rice and the basil chicken were great. I was so happy that I found a new go-to Thai delivery place.
author: Noelle Q.

description: The service is impeccable, the restaurant and bathroom is clean, the take out is prompt and the food is SO good! Their drunken noodles are my favorite but really everything is good, including the best brown rice - it's nutty and full of flavor. I also love their shrimp lemongrass soup!
author: Emilia D.

description: Ran in here last week for a very quick dinner before a concert around the corner. We literally had about 45 minutes from start to finish and Modern Thai accommodated. We had fresh spring rolls ( very refreshing), panang chicken curry and drunken noodles with beef along with a beer. Food was a bit bland. Never asked if we wanted it hot or mild. Service was quick. Clean and "modern" looking place. Overall, very good. Just wish we had more time to sit and enjoy, but it hit the spot.
author: Tom B.

description:
This is definitely one of the best Thai places I've tried, especially for the price. I order from here all the time and the food is consistently fresh-tasting and delicious. I love that the green papaya salad doesn't come with shrimp, as it does at many other places, and it is perfectly spicy. The beef sirloin salad is also a favorite. My only tiny gripe with these dishes is that both sometimes border on being too sweet. 

Their curries and noodles are deliciously savory. I actually prefer the sauteed pumpkin with chicken over the pumpkin curry; it still has the creamy flavor and sweetness of the pumpkin and great texture, but I feel that it is lighter than the curry (important when you order as much as I do!). I also used to love the cashew chicken, which was nice and spicy, until they changed their recipe and started deep frying the chicken... the result is dry and unappealing. (I don't see them doing this with any of the other entrees... what gives?). 

Finally, this place wins on atmosphere. It's super cute inside and charming outside. Yes, it's in very close vicinity to an adult video store, but once you get inside, it's absolutely adorable.
author: Alisa N.

description:
I have a sneaking suspicion that their red curry tastes like the red curry in Thailand.  I can not find good Thai curry in the states and I dream about it all the time.  Ok, I haven't had their curry yet, but what makes me think this is that they have sticky rice, and Thai people dip their sticky rice into the curry.  And I ate there, had the tom yum soup, drunken noodles, and chicken prig king.... and they all tasted suspiciously authentic!  Also the decor reminded me of being in SE Asia (although Thailand was never colonialised and the colonial-ish places are in Vietnam, Cambodia, etc.)

So I will go back there and hopefully upgrade my review when I have the curry!
author: jessica d.

description: Good, quality, affordable thai food with some interesting flavors. Nice interior.
author: Mark A.

description: We've never actually been to the restaurant, we always order for delivery and usually have no issues. The food is pretty good and reasonably priced and delivery is usually prompt.  However, the other night we had a bad experience. We ordered for delivery and it was almost 45 minutes before we got our food and when it got here, the delivery guy realized that he forgot our rice.  Okay, fine, kind of annoying, but not a huge deal, especially since he told us he would run right back to the restaurant (not far from us) and bring us the rice. 35 minutes later, still no rice. We called the restaurant and the manager was rude and not even the slightest bit interested in helping us out.  He said the rice would be there soon and when we pointed out that now our food was cold and we still had no rice to eat it with, he exasperatedly offered to comp our rice.  (awesome! $3 off! NOT) The rice finally got here ( 15 min after that) but at that point our food was really cold, the rice was undercooked and I had somewhat lost my appetite.  Sad. I like this place but mostly because its decent thai food near me that delivers.  Now I'm just going have to stop being so lazy and go to the other thai restaurants in my neighborhood that don't deliver.  Sigh.
author: Swaicha C.

description: This place makes me want to redecorate my house in vivid colors just like their interior. But I have a hard time believing I could pull it off. Mainly because I'd see the bright, cheerful colors that remind me so much of this delicious Thai spot and then I'd feel sad, because my house wouldn't smell good like fried spring rolls and simmering curry. And I would end up leaving my colorful but empty house anyhow and come to Modern Thai to eat, because I'd always be craving that food. So I don't redecorate and copy them. Instead, I come here on Friday nights after Happy Hour and stuff myself to my heart's content, and then I go back home to my boring, white-walled home in the Richmond and cry myself to sleep. And even though I'm crying because I wish my house was colorful and pretty like the interior of this restaurant, my stomach is smiling.
author: Anna S.

description: My boyfriend and I went here for dinner last week.  He got Pad Thai which is the best Pad Thai I've ever had and I ordered Mango Curry which was one of their specials that night. We also had spring rolls as an appetizer.  Everything was very tasty!  The staff was friendly and our food came quickly.  I highly recommend this place for some good eats on Polk Street!
author: Carly P.

description:
All in all a pretty decent experience. The beer was nice and cold, served in cold beer steins. 
The food was good, but not stellar. 4 stars because it wasn't bad at all, but definitely not a 5 star experience. I had the Thai salad with ground pork, which was very good, although the meat could have been warmer. Not a bad Thai salad though. For my entree, I had chicken with preserved Chinese olive on top of rice. Because I remembered a Yelper saying it could be spicier, I ordered my food spicy (I even told our friendly little waitress "not Thai spicky, just spicy." Whoa. My entree was on fire. Maybe my pallate has grown tame, although I have a hard time swallowing this (maybe not literally...) because I can handle some spice. I could barely finish my meal in between gulps of cold Singha...but then that is what the experience is all about, right? To the point where your meal is not enjoyable as a result of being spicy, though, is another matter...so my recommendation is to just take it as it's served, and if you are a real spice freak order it spicy next time. 
I would go again. I'm not counting the minutes until my next meal there but I would go again. Enjoy.
author: Matt H.

description: My thai delivery place of choice for sure!!! I always get the thai basil chicken dish (extra spicy) and am never disappointed. The delivery guy is always cool and they get here really fast. Only thing I would change about this place is the delivery minimum, I wish it was 10 bucks instead of 15 so I could order from em more!!
author: Tommy P.

description: Good Thai food, nice little patio for outdoor lunch when weather permits.  Always a good place to watch the various forms of "street entertainment" in the neighborhood.  Reasonably priced and good service.
author: Jason M.

description: I ate here for my birthday and everyone shared the dishes.  Everything was excellent! The prices were very reasonable and the service was great. I will definately be back here for some more delicious food! I also liked the fact that the place was very clean--very important to me.
author: Maria D.

description:
first, this place is fabulously decorated. that means a lot to me. i love the bright playful wall colors--hot pink, lime green--accented by crisp white molding. the cane chairs are also a nice touch. the other thing i noticed was how clean this place felt. altho the most interesting thing about the place was the gaggle of gay boys at the front louding debating who has it harder--a black man or a gay man. (one made the point there are way more black CEOs than gay ones. another said maybe they just didn't come out about their sexuality, whereas a black man obvsiously can't hide his color.) made for good eavesdropping. 

the service was friendly and efficient. the food was pretty yummy, if a little lacking in the spice department. next time i will ask for the beef salad spicy and see if that helps things. the pad thai was great, very moist and peanuty with tons of friend tofu and a good number of shrimp. we also liked the minced chicken with basil, tho it also could have used a bit more kick. 

ok and maybe this is minor, but it still made an impression on me... i think we had possibly the coldest bottles of singha ever. super refreshing. this place is perfect for a quick meal before a show at the great american. and for a lil eavesdropping.
author: rachel p.

description: This looks like my new fav neighbourhood Thai place after the one I went to turned into the Red Door Cafe. Spunky interior that could be described as fake colonial style: high ceilings, mirror wallpaper and a probably working harmonium right next to the bar which is supervised by a photo of the king and queen of Thailand in a golden frame. Oh, and the food is great, too - had the pumpkin curry special that had a spicy edge too it, not too plain as they serve it in other Thai places.
author: Roland A.

description: Red Curry vegetables with tofu and white rice is really the best in this neighborhood, along with their good courtesy and fast service!  I've gone back several times for other dishes and had food delivered; no problems, always satisfying!
author: Corinne d.

description: The pad thai here is better than Osha, but the curry is just half a step down.  The duck noodle soup is a great hangover cure.  Good place for delivery if you live in nob hill.  Friendly staff.
author: Victoria G.

description: Very nice, fantastic service by people that really care about your experience.  The specials are well executed but I wasn't too fond of the clay pot. You have to insist they heat up your food if you like it spicy...for some reason, Thai folk don't believe it when us whiteys claim to enjoy the spice. The sticky rice is good. Sit outside but beware of the tables RIGHT next to the sidewalk lest you become apart of some lower-Polk street theatre that may or may not involve animals, blood and/or naked evangelists.
author: chris m.

description: I eat food from here like once a week. I think that this is one of the best places in the TL to get Thai for a decent price. I typically order delivery through grubhub and they are really quick on the delivery. I have to say that I love their Pineapple fried rice.... super delicious with a side of Tom Yum soup.
author: Tyler D.

description: Great food and great service. The ambiance was really wonderful l. And after I've traveled to Thailand quite a few times, I find the food good and truly authentic. I definitely recommend this place to anyone.
author: Kevin T.

description: I wanted good thai food while in SF and I took a look at the menu online and saw the sauteed pumpkin dish. This sealed the deal.  We made our way from the hotel over to Modern Thai which was a short little bus trip but a lot of walking. We arrived and enjoyed the warm bright colors and the simplistic design of the restaurant. We each had a glass of wine and then ordered the v rolls. Yum! For our entree we had the sauteed pumpkin tofu (made extra spicy) and the pad thai with crab. WOW! I've had pumpkin at other thai restaurants in LA and they normally don't cook the pumpkin well enough or do anything to enhance the flavor. This was perfect!  The pad thai was a big serving and we had plenty left over. This satisfied our hunger for the night.  This was probably the cheapest meal we had in SF but it was so damn good.
author: Glenn M.

description:
been here 3 times! i love the seafood mix something... i forgot
sticky rice and pad thai..Oak was nice.. i hope he's still there...
this place is so quiet and calming...
author: nice m.

description: went here for lunch one day and got the special. it came with soup, drink, and entree. the soup was super delish but the basil thai i order was a little too spicey for me. im sure it was great tho. it was kinda odd that i went at exactly 12 and by the time we were done eating there still wasnt another soul in the place. it guess its kind of a wierd place to go for lunch if you dont work within a block of it. the special was a good price for all that we got. i am sure i will come here again with a client or a friend that works near by. im sure its great for dinner too. they have an oustide area to eat if the weather gets nice.
author: Ashley H.

description:
I had only done take out before...getting their beef noodle soup which is delicious by the way.  

We walked in and were a bit taken aback by the bright lighting and the neon everywhere.  We almost left but were already seated when the group started to gripe and question if the food would be good.

We didn't doubt anymore with the first bite of the sauteed eggplant.
Yummy chewy and nutty brown rice formed into a cute heart shape.
Pad See Ew was also really good and not too salty.  I'm used to seeing mushy noodles in thick brown over soysauced mess,but this was really good lightly sauced with perfectly cooked veggies.
Then the pumpkin red curry came out and we were again wowed by the yumminess.

The decorations are not wierd for a Thai restaurant because this one is called "Modern" Thai.

Will order delivery again and will definitely reorder the pad see ew. I just love noodles!
author: Christine L.

description:
I went to lunch there today. I had the clay pot and it was very good. The Thai beer is good too. The best part about the whole thing was how nice they were to me. I look forward to returning. Nice atmosphere, good prices and good food.
Try it, they are nice!
author: Andrea B.

description:
I LOVE this place.    

There's a simple yet interesting twist to otherwise traditional Thai dishes. Hence the name Modern Thai. And I'm sure you will appreciate the decor. As soon as you step in, you can't help but look around. The colors are so fresh, and everything looks sparkling neat. There's a bright green wall that stands out. I think it's a very brave color choice, but it works and it brightens up the place. 

My favorite - BASIL TOFU. This is fried tofu glazed with house special sauce then topped with crispy basil. I can't say enough about this dish. The crispy basil is just delicious. Please, for your own sake, try it.

Coconut shrimps - Deep fried skewered marinated shrimps, coated with shredded coconut, served with sesame soy sauce. Need I say more? And the coconut taste is subtle.

Ground Chicken with preserved Chinese Olive - I believe this is new on the menu. You will love it. 

I've tried several other dishes and everything is good. Swing by and leave with a smile. :D
author: Ryan M.

description: Great service and tasty vegetarian dishes. Love the ambiance.
author: Stacy L.

description: What a cute place! I arrived today (well now it's officially yesterday) around 11:25 expecting them to close at 3am. It turns out that they changed their hours and now they close at midnight on Fri/Sat. Anyway, we went in because we still had time to eat. We ordered the Hoi Jar, Tom Yum soup, BBQ pork, and chicken with eggplant. It was all really good! The service was also excellent. Even though it was already midnight, she came by and told us to not worry and take our time eating. Overall, this place is excellent and I will definitely be returning!
author: Diane M.

description:
Found this place through yelp and came here for dinner tonight with my friend. When walking into this place, were were unexpectedly please with the decor and environment straight from the beginning. The place is very clean and quaint, modern (hence the name of the restaurant).
I ordered the ZATO Thai sake to drink and my friend had a glass of Pinot Noir...both very good.
For appetizers we ordered the fresh spring rolls. The actual rolls were great,  and stuffed with fresh veggies. The dipping sauce for them was good as well,  a little sweet hoisin sauce with crushed peanuts. Would have liked to seen a spicy vinaigrette sauce as well?
For main courses, we ordered the pumpkin curry which was delicious, and the beef sirloin salad. They both had strong flavors, the perfect amount of spice.
The wait staff were a little slow to attend to us but not really holding it against them as they were very nice.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
3.5 * please.
it is too modern to taste traditional.
the food is delicious as you think it is not very salty.
It is a little bit expensive when I see the crab pad thai have only a little bit crab meat on a sunrise egg. ($9.95)

however, the tom yum soup is highly recommended, very tasty and a little bit too sour. i ordered "medium spicy", which was not spicy at all....-_-ll

fish cakes are good, and they serve 4 cakes for 6.95 with small cucumber plates. I like this small "snakes", so  i asked for another one. They gave it to me for free.

prompt service, background music with pop songs in both Thai and English. I like the atmosphere that is like 70s, so I chose to meet my old friends there.

Parking would still be your headache if u want to park around over there.
author: Sue S.

description: In a city filled with Thai restaurants, Modern Thai is well above the average.  Some of the surprising items:  Drunken Noodles--great flavor and vegetarian!  Pork Larb--not too tart.
author: QuodE D.

description: This is a great "farang Thai' resturant. (american palate thai food) Prices are reasonable and the food is great. I especially like the "gang fuktong gai" (pumpkin curry with chicken) this place is on my regular thai rotation.
author: kenny d.

description: I was in the mood for thai and so far in the city I haven't had much luck with that.  My husband and I were walking up Polk and came across this place.  It looked very nice inside but there weren't a lot of people inside so we hesitated but after glancing outside at the menu we figured, why not?  So inside was very nice and the server was very friendly.  The food was outstanding!  I was in the mood for something with a little kick, and they did great on that.  Not too overbearing but spicy with good flavor.  I had the veggie/tofu meal.  My husband had the chicken/Chinese olive meal that was probably one of the best Thai dishes I have ever had.  I can't wait to go back to get more!
author: Rise G.

description:
this is my go to thai delivery place when i am craving southeast asian eats.  i have never been to the actual restaurant so this review only encompasses the delivery aspects of this fine establishment.

delivery is typically average when it comes to speed.  there are times when the food has come in about 35 minutes. most of the time, however, it is usually about a 45 minute wait for my food. thats not too bad. not great.

the people taking your order are usually very friendly.  i have really never had a problem, and considering i usually order with a card, i like the fact that i have never been hung up on under the assumption that i am paying with cash. (yes it has happened at another thai restaurant and i am not going to name names because the manager apologized profusely and i ended up getting my order for free).

the food is solid. and more often than not, better than solid.  some of my favorites are

appetizers:
basil tofu, crispy tofu and spring rolls.  i prefer the crispy tofu over the basil tofu, but if you are a fan of thai basil then i strongly suggest the basil tofu.  sometimes the crispy tofu is a little dry, but i actually like that with this tofu. for some reason it sops up the sweet and sour and peanut sauce a little bit better.  the fresh spring rolls are fantastic and a great way to tantalize the palate with many different flavors before your main course.

salad
the only salad i have ever had was the ppy salad. wow! so good! if you like papaya then this is the salad for you. so fresh. so tasty. so simple. 

soups
tom yum: the quintessential thai soup done very well here. 
seafood tom yum: when you are feeling a little more adventurous get the seafood version. its pretty expensive at around 11 bucks, but if you are in the mood for a more protein filled version of the soup this is the way to go.

noodles/rice:
i have had the pad thai (i know-so boring). but honestly it is rather good here. sometimes the noodles come a little clumpy and i can only assume this is because it has been sitting around for like 20 minutes. but it is still tasty.

pineapple fried rice: a must order. i get it every time. it is so good and the pineapple perfectly offsets the salty nature of the fried rice. add cashews and perfectly cooked onions and this is some of the best fried rice i have had. oh yea it also comes with chicken and shrimp!

green curry fried rice: tasty but rather simple. not much going on. but then again once you taste the pineapple fried rice i doubt you will try any other.

entrees:
sauteed eggplant: really great flavors. the only problem is sometimes the eggplant comes a tiny bit mushy because it is overcooked and then sits in a delivery bag for 20 more minutes.

curries: i have had almost all the curries (save for the pumpkin curry). they are all rather solid. i prefer the red or mango red. overall i dont think you will be disappointed with the curries. not as good as some thai restaurants i have been to, but definitely not bottom of class either.

my top recommendations are:
crispy tofu, ppy salad, seafood tom yum soup, pineapple fried rice, sauteed eggplant.
author: Jason B.

description:
We really wanted to like this place and were eager to give it a shot. We live in the neighborhood and have walked by to this odd Thai restaurant next to the odd video store with porn posters for years. Porn posters aside, it always seemed a little weird and empty. Recently, the restaurant was renovated on the inside and we decided to give it a shot. Chai-Yo is up the street and good but their service is pretty much that they could care less about you. 

So we went to Modern Thai and before they sat us, they already decided that we were going to be less important than other guests. They gave us the crappy small table by the door, in the walkway/thoroughfare for the servers going to the front patio, and gave us that unveiled annoyed look since we didn't want a Thai Ice Tea or Coffee right off the bat. Good start...

We had opted to sit inside instead of the unheated outside portion because it was a cool night. In the end, we should have just sat outside so we would have kept our coats on. In that case, we wouldn't have been freezing when the servers left the door open, blasting us with cold air. I closed the door a couple of times but the "customer service-oriented" server kept leaving it open. Once the host told us he would close the door but it stayed open after a couple of minutes. Brrrrrrrr. 

Then an exuberant party of 10 arrived for their table of 6 so they need to wait, joking, laughing, and hovering over our crappy (cold) table. And yes, the door was open. 

Oh, and the food. It wasn't even good. Definitely the worst in the neighborhood. I'd rather get abused at Chai-Yo(Momma) or walk to the Loin (Thai House Express or Osha) or even venture to Russian Hill. 

So, to sum up, underwhelming food, annoying service, and don't get stuck at the crappy small table on a cold night.
author: joseph j.

description:
By far one of the best Thai food places I've been to! 

I used to travel a lot for work and was recommended Thai places in various states across the nation. Not much compares to Modern Thai. 

I buddy and his GF introduced me to this wonderful place. I'm jealous of them because they live VERY close to this place and get to eat here often! 

I usually settle for the Drunken Noodles. Very good portion, wonderful flavors, always satisfying. 

Last time I tried the Basil Tofu and that, too, was amazing! 

This is a wonderful place for a first or second date. Friendly staff, fresh food, bright atmosphere.
author: Matt N.

description:
Food was great and the service was attentive.  Atmosphere a little bright and sterile.

We had the pumpkin fries, choo chee salmon, and the mango red curry chicken.  All three were very good.

The fries came with a spicy dipping sauce that melded nicely with the pumpkin flavor.  They were fried to a crisp and are a great appetizer.

The Choo Chee salmon had a thick and spicy red curry that made this a soon to be repeated dish.

The mango red curry  and coconut milk chicken was a special that should be a regular item with the spicy yet velvety sauce when combined with the sweet mango made a great combination in the mouth.

We would definitely go back and bring friends.

Also, they do delivery so you can get the great food and make your own atmosphere.
author: Michael D.

description: This is one of our favorite go-to Thais in our neighborhood, along with Chai Yo. Modern Thai has the better prices and is great value especially for lunch. I have tried quite a few dishes here but my favorites remain Drunken Noodle and Pad See Ew.
author: Alexandra D.

description: This is an excellent place for good Thai food at a great price.  The entrees are about $7, so a meal for two with appetizers and drinks is still very reasonable.  The service is excellent.
author: Steve S.

description: This place rocks!  The crab fried rice tastes soooo good with real crab no doubt and a fried egg on top (thai style).  I can't get enough!  The pad thai, ground chicken over rice, calamari, and fried fish dishes are also wonderful.  You can't go wrong.  Top it off with great service and you will definitely go back...
author: Chris D.

description: Arrived at this restaurant with a restaurant.com certificate, newly purchased. They did not honor this certificate nor did they offer a alternative offer.  With that kind of customer service, we left without eating.
author: Judy G.

description: The Spring Rolls are really good, they are wrapped tight cut well and just tasty. Ask for peanut sauce and they are through the roof.  Their delivery is very puntual and their customer service on the phone is friendly and intelligible.  I am a sucker for the pad thai, I know I should branch out ,but I just keep ordering it.  In my opinion it is very flavorful and well made for a dish that can sometimes taste like it was mass produced in China and imported in cans.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
Excellent service, and even better food.

Favorite is the Thai Basil Beef, Chicken Satae and the Chicken peanut sauce dish.
author: Casandra S.

description: Best Thai restaurant for the price. Can't beat it for such a nice place.  Very qaint and quiet.  Come on, cucumber salad for a buck!
author: Deanna C.

description: There's so many Thai restaurants in the City, but this is my favorite Thai restaurant, and I highly recommend this place. The decor is beautiful and they have really good lunch deals that are $6.95. They also deliver. Try the eggplant with chicken, pad thai, yellow curry, and pad-see-ew.
author: Lori M.

description: I love Thai food. I like eating it and I like to make it. Great place, tasty selections. Nice atmosphere in a cool neighborhood. The prices were decent. Ask for the extra condiment tray. Jalepeno's, and a selection of sauces. Yum!!
author: Terry P.

description: Delicious! Excellent Thai service and authentic Thai dishes. Great prices too. We will go back whenever we're in the City. Having spent a lot of time in Thailand we are very particular about Thai food. This lovely restaurant passes the test.
author: Dan T.

description: This is a damn good thai restaurant. started with spring rolls, because how do you not get spring rolls? Then we had the Larb with beef, aka beef salad, and it was really good! also had the sauteed eggplant with chicken, which is really good too. very fast service, and a nice and clean bathroom and nice decor makes this a winner
author: Rich B.

description:
We had a green and red curry for lunch. The price was right ($7) but it wasn't memorable.  The decor of the place is more upscale for a Thai restaurant.

But to respond to the reviews below that complained about credit cards and the tip-estimator: we did not see any problem. I was able to use my Visa, and the tip-estimator on the bill was correct.
author: Mark L.

description: Great Fried Papaya Salad... crispy, spicy and good
author: Santthosh S.

description: I've walked past this place for two years and finally decided to give them a try today. When I walked in I was going to go with my usual Basil Chicken, as I use that dish to compare Thai restaurants. But I spy-ed a yummy looking plate of Yellow Curry at the next table and had to venture that way. It was delicious, the little side salad hit the spot and the rice perfectly on the plate. The Thai Ice tea served in a glass tasted like liquid ice cream. Service was a little slow, but it was about 12:30pm.
author: Craig R.

description: Good Food Good Prices for Thai food. Definitely a great choice if your in the area.
author: C J.

description: Very good Thai restaurant.  Fun lively decor, and friendly efficient service.  We had the $6.95 lunch specials and found them to be a good solid portion of very tasty food.  My friend had the pad kee mao (not as spicy as I like, but they do have a spice tray available to heat it up!), and I had the pad khing song with chicken (fresh ginger stir fry).  Mine came with steamed rice and a nice side salad.  Both choices were delicious and I would order them both again.
author: John R.

description: I really like Modern Thai, especially if you can get a sit in the front room on a sunny day.  They make great traditional thai food and they also try out different takes on their specials board.  Most of the ones I've tried have worked out fine.  The staff are very nice, one of the waitress' always helps me with my thai pronunciations and on polite thai phrases.  Definitely worth a stop if you are in the Polk St. area
author: Cass C.

description: i wouldn't go here for super authentic thai cuisine but hence the name, modern thai.  the menu is vast and they have some interesting dishes, usually classic thai dishes with a twist.  i came here for dinner and my sister and i ordered a bunch of dishes to share (fish cakes, drunken noodles, fried tilapia, green curry with pork).  portions were a bit bigger than other thai restaurants (we pretty much took half the order to go)  and overall, we enjoyed our selection.  staff was friendly but a bit slow (we were there on a busy night).
author: Helen T.

description: First Thai place I've tried in Nob Hill and I was very impressed.  The only thing that kept me from giving it 5 stars was the red curry could have used a little kick.  Other than spice level it was absolutely delicious and I can't wait to order it again.
author: Lauren P.

description: Went with group of 5. Generally we all liked the food, and we're pretty familiar with Thai food. Stylin' decor and presentation. We had pad see ew, yellow shrimp curry, fresh ginger tofu, tom kha salmon soup, and coconut shrimp as the appetizer. All quite good, Prices decent for Frisco. Also tried a bunch of desserts--black rice mango, fried bananas with ice cream, and blueberry roti. All good as well, though I somewhat prefer sticky rice mango served at most other Thai places.
author: Lee T.

description: If you want to grab a quick Thai meal, this place is great.  Their menu isnt huge, but there is clearly something for everyone.  The service in general is very good.  We once went and it was pretty slow, but not a big enough deal to keep us from going there from time to time.  Their chicken pad thai is full of flavor, and it always comes out piping hot.  Also try their fresh spring rolls.  For 25 bucks (including tip), we got chicken satay, chicken pad Thai and fresh spring rolls.  Not at all bad.  Let me make it clear, this place will not knock your socks off, but for a quick delicious Thai meal, check it out.
author: Mike G.

description: I go to this place about 2 times a month because it is really close to my work. They give big portions and the prices are very reasonable. I love thier eggplant with beef lunch special. I have also tried the pad-thai crab lunch special which was also very good.
author: Maria C.

description: I really enjoy the setting but not the food as much.  It's not terrible but nor is memorable.  The spring rolls are quite tasty and very lite, which is nice.  The pumpkin and tofu lacked flavor and the pumpkin was not cooked enough, it also could use a little more sauce, it is a little on the dry side.  I can only speak on these dishes though, maybe other ones are more up to par.  The setting is great so it's a little disappointing, but worth a shot!
author: Steven K.

description: Went here for the first time last Saturday, and my friend and I both enjoyed our meal.  I eat Thai food at least twice a week down in the financial district, and although it's fine, the food here was much better.  Fresh ingredients, warm friendly service, well balanced flavors, good wine at a decent price...you get drift.  There are so many mediocre places to eat along Polk Street, it was nice to find one that surpassed our expectations.
author: Sean M.

description: This was the best thai I've had in a long time.  The duck red curry with lychee was to die for.
author: C B.

description: Every time I have eaten here it's great. The green curry is phenomenal. The service is good, the ambiance in the restaurant and the commotion of people talking is nice for any occasion. Very cheap for great thai food.  I have eaten at Lers Ros (very good) and the infamous Osha thai (worst thai food ever) many times, as well as many other thai restaurants in the city and Champa Garden in Oakland (one of best if you're up for the trip) and I have to say Modern is probably one of the best in the city.
author: Jared B.

description: Ended up in the area having to wait for a store to open with a friend. We decided to stop here even though the outside appearance made me skeptical. Once the food came we were both pleasantly surprised. I had the calamari, which was light and not greasy at all and the red curry, they were both delicious. The service was great. I'll definitely come back when I'm in the area.
author: Brandon C.

description: The Pad Thai and Pad Ki Mao is great..  also the fresh tofu spring rolls and the peanut sauce is killer.   I am a big fan of this place.
author: Austin S.

description: Love this place.  Minus one star for the interior, but delicious food and consistent, reliable service.
author: A. P.

description: I've been a few times.  The first couple times were fine (food was decent).  The last time the fresh spring rolls were hard.  I don't think these were made fresh.
author: C L.

description: I live in the Polk Gulch and I was so happy when I came across this wonderful and friendly Thai eatery. I have been eating here for a little over two years now and I have never had a meal that wasn't delicious. My favorite menu items and the ones that I always recommend are First and foremost the Pumpkin Curry with chicken or tofu and brown rice. Second hands down is the amazing sauteed eggplant with Thai basil, as a person who cooks, i have yet to cook eggplant well, Modern Thais is "perfect" just the right tenderness. I also enjoy the coconut soup with chicken before bedtime or if I am nursing a cold. One of the overlooked menu items that I enjoy as well is listed on side orders, The cucumber salad is so nice on a summers day before a meal and on the patio where I enjoy watching the Neighborhood Polk Street Riffraff. All in all, I've tried almost everything on the menu and I have never been disappointed. If you like your Thai more on the spicy side then tell them and I'm sure they can heat you up!
author: Rodney A.

description:
My favourite Thai place in town.  We have been going for about a year and have yet to try most of what they have on the menu as we keep ordering the same few dishes we'd tried initially: Ground Chicken with Chinese Olive (very unique flavor with the right amount of zing), Tom Yam with shrimp (such fresh ingredients) and Ginger Rice with Fried Chicken (i love all things ginger).  They are just so good and we get these random bouts of craving for them.  Portions are also huge so we've never had space for appetizers but when we can sneak in dessert, we always go for the sticky rice with mango (again, first dessert we've tried and we keep going back for the same).

We really need to try the rest of what they have to offer, especially after reading about the rave reviews on the springrolls and anything duck.

Just love the airy, roomy, colonial feel to the place and the service is excellent.  A sanctuary within the TL surroundings.

Love that they do delivery too!
author: Karen Y.

description: What a great find. Soup appetizer and entree was superb.  Service was excellent and very attentive.  Very reasonable prices.
author: Andrew J.

description: One of the best Thai restaurants I've been to.  Who knows what ever happened to BKK's remodel, but they had started going down hill.  Papaya salad is nice and fish-sauce stinky and garlicky.  Really like the bean sheet noodle.
author: e g.

description: My favorite thai place in SF. Drunken noodle and curries are so good.  Never a long wait and servers are very nice.
author: LT B.

description:
This place is amazing!  The food here taste so close to what one would get in Thailand.  That's really difficult to accomplish.  

Everything was tasty, the prices were good, the decor was nice and relaxing, and the service was really friendly.    

I'd highly recommend Modern Thai.  I'll be going frequently...
author: D. B.

description: Just went here last night with a large group--30+ people--so I was pretty impressed with the quality and efficiency of the kitchen in getting the dishes out in a timely manner and tasting so great.  I had the chance to sample a few different dishes and they were all really tasty--ginger tofu, pumpkin tofu, drunken noodles, eggplant, and some sort of curry.  The portions were very generous and reasonably priced.  We even made room for dessert!  I'm definitely heading back here next time the Thai craving hits!
author: Mimi W.

description: At first glance this place doesn't seem like a Thai restaurant.  The food was tasty and reasonably priced.  I got my food to go, the Pad See Ew and Drunken Noodle which were both very flavorful and tasty.  The staff was friendly offering water while we waited.  Definitely a spot I would go again after I try the other options on the Polk.
author: Po L.

description: Delish! Not expensive, clean environment, nice staff and great Thai food. I can't stop thinking about the calamari i had there...
author: Jessica H.

description: I had the phad thai delivery and the Tom yum soup... meeh it was not that good, in fact I thought the soup was pretty bad.   I have still yet to find a good Thai place in San Fran
author: Andrew S.

description: Good service, good food (specially the Pad Thai, which is common everywhere else but here it's just better) and good atmosphere. I ask for nothing more.
author: Oruga P.

description:
This place is a standby for me.  We were ordering from a Thai place very close to home, but got fed up with their regularly tacking on an extra few $ here and there, unexplained.

I see Modern Thai when I'm hanging out across the street at Quetzal, and tried it out.  YUM!  Their Blueberry Roti drew us in for a mid-afternoon snack.  Their friendly service and yummy food keep us going back.

Favorite dishes: pumpkin red curry, spicy green beans, praram -- veggies and tofu with delicious peanut sauce.

I like the clean modern design of their restaurant; the high ceilings add to the elegance, even though it's not a fancy place.  Mostly, we order for delivery, and they are always pleasant in taking the order, have never made a mistake, and usually arrive a lot sooner than the stated delivery time.
author: Wako T.

description: Pleasantly surprised - placed order online for delivery. It came pretty quickly (thank goodness because I was STARVING). We have tried several Thai joints, there are a couple other good places and we can add Modern Thai. The food was great - perfectly seasoned. And the price is pretty decent, too.
author: Hoa S.

description: I like the food this place, I order  Lunch for me and my husband  twice a week in this place.I ask them if I can have rice instead of Salad the manager said no.Give a change after a month I try asking again if I can have rice instead of Salad. I'm very disappointed,is that hard to give a little favor  to a customer.and they just lost one.
author: Jocil B.

description: mmm.  the fried crispy papaya salad is sooooo good.  coming from austin,tx where we have already established our favorites, we were pleasantly suprised.  we are so happy to have eaten at modern thai.  the food is excellent.  the atmosphere is so happy and sunny and the service very attentive.  i would recommend anyone to eat here.
author: Holly O.

description: a solid choice for Thai close to home, just can't bring myself to give it a full 4 stars - close, just not quite... cute atmosphere, decent wait staff, enjoyed the fresh spring rolls and the coconut shrimp were great (suggest you avoid the mango and soft shell crab salad - crab seemed bad to me, but maybe I just don't know what it's supposed to taste like)
author: Kristin D.

description: so we all know there are more thai restaurants in sf than starbucks and 7-elevens combined. but this one definitely shines. probably some of the most delicious and authentic thai eva! totally consistent with quality as well.
author: gemma h.

description: I love this place, I used to live right by and I miss it so much. I have brought all my friends here and they're hooked! The food is very tasty and fresh. They have good fried rice, curries, and there tom ka is to die for. The owner and employees are very friendly. The price is decent for the portion you get. One of the best Thai places in the city!!
author: Kan P.

description: I'm on this delivery food kick - I've put myself on house arrest to study for a test, so I'm pretty much going through all the delivery options.  I ordered the wonton noodle soup, fresh rolls with shrimp, and blueberry roti.  The wonton soup was a solid 3 stars.  It had a good amount of wontons, veggies, and bbq pork, but it lacked a bit on flavor.  Considering that they delivered this piping hot and the noodles were not soggy, I should probably upgrade that to 4 stars.  The fresh rolls were "fresh" and the sauce was nice tangy sweet.  I would've liked a little bit of spice in the sauce, but otherwise, it was great.  I imagine the blueberry roti is better eaten in the restaurant, where it would be warm, but as we got delivery and ate this last, it was cold.  That said, it was pretty tasty for cold roti!  I have a feeling that if I order some curry next time, I will like the place even more!  Good choice for Thai delivery!
author: Amy C.

description: good delivery - great fresh spring rolls, and spicy pad see yew. will definitely order delivery from them again
author: Ivan S.

description: What a cool place found by myself and a friend last weekend after just driving around and parking in the structure up the street. We were searching first for somewhere around Union Street, then the Marina, and ended up here. My friend had the pra ram tofu, a dish with crispy fried tofu and veggies sauced up in a beautiful peanut sauce. I had pumpkin curry with the brown (a bit more like red) rice--such good spicy heat and nicely cooked veggies, not to mention pumpkin cooked just right. The dessert, a sweet blueberry roti, made for a very nice ending, if not a somewhat unusual yet pleasant one. Not cloyingly sweet, this treat was also rather rich, with a heft I have never experience from its savory cousin that's more readily found in hawker and Indian cuisine. This seemed to come from a thicker version of roti as well as what seemed to be sweetened condensed milk (but surprisingly balanced in sweetness). In this light, my friend's and my choice to split the dessert was a good call. I hope to return to try a standard such as the pad thai, as well as the thai iced tea.
author: Ryan T.

description: ja. and i were hungry after an evening at the club so ne. suggested we go here. so we did. its cute! i like the front porch room, and the main room is cute too. love that bright green!  it was sunday at 9sh and we were seated right away.  besides of the cuteness, there was a lot of yummy looking things on the menu. i had the special, pineapple seafood curry with sticky rice and thai iced tea. it was quite tasty. ja had a regular chicken curry which could have used a lil more seasoning. the teas were good. id come back.
author: Merredith L.

description:
a solid 4 stars--nothin wrong with that.  nice decor the kinda place that works for local peeps and tourists. this is a good date place too.

the service was attentive without being intrusive. my red curry was good, but lacked the depth of flavor that i am used tto from my fave Champa Garden. i had an appetizer with crab and pork that was very tasty.

would i go back again? sure
author: Amber A.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant on Polk Street.  I've never really been disappointed at Modern Thai.  The curry dishes, particularly the Pumpkin Red Curry, and Chicken Pad Thai are above average.  I'm always surprised more people don't go there.
author: Luke P.

description: Have been there twice. Food is good and has $7 lunch deals. Got the green curry (was amazing) and the pad thai (was decent). Only complaint was the service. Hardly ever came around asking if I needed anything.
author: Jonathan M.

description: this place is ok. i haven't found a place to beat my favorite of all time, Joom in LA. i tried a few things, can't remember what they were but they were just eh. decor is nice but i'd go somewhere else if you can
author: Ryan C.

description: Excellent thai food and a friendly staff.  I haven't had a bad dish yet.
author: Mike R.

description: We brought Modern Thai take-out to a friend in the hospital and while it was certainly a step-up from hospital food, it wasn't awesome. The vegetarian pad thai was much better than the pad see-ew. Portions sizes were generous and the plastic take-out containers are recyclable, so that warrants a few stars. I think we'll give them one more shot when we can eat at the restaurant and enjoy it while it's still hot.
author: Cher E.

description: Everyone in my party enjoyed their meal here:  thai basil tofu, thai basil chicken, pumpkin tofu red curry, and king crab wonton & noodle soup.  It was a weeknight and not too busy, and the service was efficient and friendly.  I would go back.
author: Kim W.

description: fancy setting without the fancy prices. good service, good food, not overly greasy like some thai can be. woohoo! & Thai ice coffee for desert ! YUM!
author: AA B.

description:
really, really good thai for delivery! finally!

the coconut soup with shrimp was SLAMMIN, as was the fresh spring rolls with yummy tamarind sauce. pad thai was good, but not great. this is definitely my new place - worth it if you live in the hood and want delivery. can't wait to order again!
author: Lady L.

description: this is our neighborhood thai place and so we have been there several timss over the past 2 years...and i must say, it was pretty good 2 years ago, but its getting better and better!  we went tonight and ordered chicken satay (for my 5 yo) and a plate of brown rice (for my 3 yo) while my husband had the fish cakes and i had a basic thai fried rice with chicken.  yum - even the kids loved it (and they are the toughest critics out there!)
author: Kim D.

description: I would come back for their Red Curry w/Chicken and Trout.  The Tom Yum soup wasn't rich in content and wasn't big enough for two people.
author: Amy C.

description: I love this place. :-) One of the San Francisco essentials. Whether you love Thai food or not, I am sure you would love Modern Thai.  Friendly and cozy environment.  The food are really good. But the most impressive ones are the desserts - unique and tasty.  And all comes with surprising low price.  I think this should be what the casual luxury means. Highly recommend! All thumbs up!
author: Yee Sin C.

description: I eat here a lot. The food is good and they are really nice. They are also open really late on weekends which is what makes me come back. Yes I'm probably drunk but the food is good regardless.
author: ghgghh f.

description: I'm in love with the beef noodle soup and have just discovered the yellow curry.  I've had the yellow curry with tofu with their deliciously chewy brown rice for 3 lunches in a row and my office mates are so jealous.  They are like, "what is that? That smells delicious!"  I tried the chicken noodle and it was totally not as tasty as the beef.
author: Kelly G.

description: My husband and I love Thai food and Modern Thai is one of our favorites.  The curries are terrific, the seafood and salmon choo chee is to die for.  True, it's not the best neighborhood in the world but the food is so worth it.
author: Catherine D.

description: the tofu cashew nut dish is great, most of the food i've had here is great, and its clean and nicely appointed.
author: clancy c.

description: i live close by and compared to the others near me, this place always has something different to fulfill by curious palette
author: Mike L.

description: the lunch specials are good and cheap.  the place is clean and the atmosphere is nice.  the service is good.  the food is really really yummy!  i recently ordered a huge order for delivery and they got the order perfect and delivered it quickly!  I luv modern thai!
author: M S.
